snippet.title: Does the government have a strategy to revive the shrinking Economy? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we discuss the data that has been put out in a report by CMIE which should be concerning, the data explains how there has been a fall in consumer sentiment on the back of unemployment and lower savings. A much higher number of job losses was witnessed in March when there was a nationwide lockdown in India, the unemployment rate has gone up significantly. The CMIE report reveals that consumer sentiment has declined with over 35 lakh people remained unemployed in November 2020. The recovery progressively slowed down in July, August, and September before reversing in October and November. CMIE also added that the recovery phase is over and a decline is setting in again.

snippet.title: Why is malnutrition, obesity on the rise in India? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, A study conducted by the National Family Health Survey has revealed that some states have shown an increase in the rise of malnutrition and obesity. The current National Family Health survey was conducted on 6.1 lakh sample households. It involves household-level interviews to collect information on population, health, family planning and nutrition-related indicators.

The Senior Research Fellow at International Food Policy Research Delhi Dr Purnima Menon says that We should be very concerned about this survey. Need to focus on states where there has been a rise of malnutrition and obesity cases. 

Watch!

snippet.title: Will Maharashtra's Shakti Bill’s speedy justice help curb the crime? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we discuss the new bill that has been tabled by the Maharashtra government, the Shakti Bill is said to bring a stricter provision for crimes that are committed against women and children. The bill will bring a stricter law in order to make it safer for women and children. The bill was tabled in the Maharashtra assembly today. The stern punishments include the death penalty, life sentence, and hefty fines against the perpetrators of crimes such as rape and acid attack. It will also help in a faster probe of the said case and quicker disposal and action. Watch the video to know more about the case!

snippet.title: Centre issues COVID vaccination plan; What are the other requirements? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we discuss India’s COVID vaccine plan. Centre has shared a list of vaccination guidelines that have to be followed. From logistics, training, and execution of the process, everything is taken care of, Government has provided a detailed understanding of the COVID vaccination plan. A set of detailed operational guidelines have been issued by the Union Health Ministry. Ministry of Home Affairs had also issued a guideline pertaining to vaccination at the state and panchayat levels. Health Ministry has now issued an operational guideline that is going to study the minute detail of how the vaccination will be rolled out once it receives approval from the DCGI. Watch the video to know more about the India COVID vaccination plan!

snippet.title: Conspiracy erupts over Farm Laws' agitation; Is it possible to hijack protests? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Afrida Rehman Ali discusses the stir that is surging between farmers and the Central Government and explains all the conspiracy theories relying around the new farm law protests.
Kisan’ revolt is only intensifying day by day. The Senior leaders in the current government have issued a fresh statement. Union Minister Piyush Goyal said that farmers' agitation has been hijacked by Maoist and Naxal elements.
Meanwhile, AAP MLA Raghav Chadha & nine other party workers detained by the Delhi Police. Raghav Chadha was heading to Union Home Minister's residence to protest against the MCD over alleged corruption.
Are anti-social elements hijacking protests? Is it possible to hijack the farmers’ protest? Should farmers keep an eye on miscreants?
Watch!

snippet.title: 50% people battle suicidal thoughts; Will India normalise Mental Health issues? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate’s special broadcast, Tanvi Shukla briefs you on a mental health awareness campaign ‘Act Now’ initiated by Times Network. To understand more about mental health and how do Urban Indians deal with it, your channel conducted a survey and the results of the survey might shock you.
Some of the key takeaways from the survey tell us that Career is an important source of stress and happiness; there is mental health awareness even in small towns; Stigma around mental health is prominent in affluent class; Over 55% Indians have gone through suicidal thoughts; While 28% term mental health issue as ‘gone mad’.
Will India normalise Mental Health illness?
Watch!

snippet.title: Govt assures to amend new farm bills, but farmers threaten to intensify protests? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Sahar Zaman talks about the Framers’ protest which is intensifying even on the 17th day of agitation. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, today, has led the outrage and once again reiterated the benefits of new farm laws. 
He assured an increased income, better cold storage infrastructure and newer markets. However, the farmers have still refused to budge in. They even went on to threaten that they might continue blocking highways and even go on a hunger strike, if the Centre doesn’t take down the new norms.
But if the Central Government assured farmers that procurement at MSP will continue, then why are farmers still protesting? Watch as BJP’s Sudesh Verma BJP, President of Kisan Shakti Sang Pushpendra Kisan and Congress’ Pallavi Sharma share their views.
#FarmersProtest #FarmLawProtest #NewFarmLaws

snippet.title: Day 16 of Kisan Andolan: Will the standoff between farmers and centre end? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today marks Day 16 of the ongoing farmer protests that have been witnessed at a global scale now, the standoff between the centre and farmers continues till today. As farmers intensify their stir, even more farmers from Punjab's Amritsar are moving to Delhi to join the protests. 'If the problem is limited to certain states, where the structures are different, can the state not come in and bring in the change in laws & give assurance?' Tanvi Shukla questions Chengal Reddy who is a farmer Activist. ‘If the government's intention is not bad, what is wrong in including MSP as part of the law? What is wrong with making MSP compulsory for the private sector? The intention of these FarmLaws is for the private players and ensure farmers become weak’, says Congress’ Rohan R. Gupta.

snippet.title: Is Uttar Pradesh police using the anti-conversion law to harass citizens? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the massively debated anti-conversion law has been discussed at a political level. The anti-conversion law was brought into the picture in order to stop the cases of love jihad in Uttar Pradesh. After Uttar Pradesh implemented the anti-conversion law, many other states along with Madhya Pradesh joined in to stand against forceful conversions. In the law, Uttar Pradesh police play a major role in order to stop the conversions. Tanvi Shukla discusses and breaks down the ten instances where Uttar Pradesh police used the anti-conversion law. But where can we as citizens draw a line between choice and forceful conversions? Allahabad High Court, in a ruling, stated that individuals should have the right to choose their partner and they have the freedom to choose them from any particular faith. Is the state using the anti-conversion law to harass citizens? Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: Attack on JP Nadda's convoy: Lawlessness witnessed in Mamata’s state? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we discuss how the stones were hurled at BJP President JP Nadda’s convoy that was attacked in West Bengal. JP Nadda speaks to Times Network in an exclusive conversation about the violence in West Bengal. The political faceoff in West Bengal took a violent turn today. BJP President JP Nadda states that West Bengal’s Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee does not understand West Bengal’s culture. He further adds that she is a symbol of ‘corruption’ and has been focusing on divisive politics. He further stated that the West Bengal Chief Minister believes in lawlessness. He also states that his party will fight the elections democratically and the people of West Bengal stand with BJP. snippet.title: Gautam Navlakha Case: Are India’s prisons devoid of basic human rights? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we discuss 70-year-old jailed activist Gautam Navlakha who is waiting to get a pair of spectacles for two weeks now. Maharashtra’ Home Minister Anil Deshkmukh has ordered a probe into the matter. It has been 48 hours after the Bombay High Court pulled up the Taloja jail authorities, activist Gautam Navlakha is still waiting for a set of spectacles. There are privileged families in India where they can afford to find legal support to go to High Courts, but those in jails are still struggling. ‘The prison system is also designed to handle as many people as possible, who are chucked inside and there is not an adequate budget for treating them in a humane matter. Prisons are not voted gatherers’, says Sanjay Hegde, Senior Advocate, Supreme Court. ‘Rather than focusing on these two cases,  I would see them as a symptom of larger malice that is part of the criminal justice system’, states Prof. Vijay Raghavan, TISS.

snippet.title: Blood banks bleed dry in Maharashtra; Will the Central government take cognizance? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla discusses the impact of COVID on blood donation and the blood banks in India. The issue of blood banks is hardly ever spoken about but the issue needs the government's unwavering attention this time. The impact of COVID on the blood bank impacts all of us together and thus the issue needs to be dealt with and resolved with the help of everyone. India is staring at a possible acute shortage of blood supply. The states that are affected the most are Maharashtra and Karnataka. A red flag has been raised in the state of Maharashtra, and it has been raised repeatedly over the past few weeks. The government is trying to increase blood donation drives in the state.

Blood transfusion service in India is unorganized and fragmented. Due to this, there is negligible connectivity and communication between the blood banks, says Suryaprabha Sadasivan.

snippet.title: COVID vaccine hunt continues with Bharat Biotech & SII competing; Who will win? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla continues to discuss the COVID vaccine and the hunt that is now on for the vaccine. Ever since the COVID pandemic struck the country and the world, everyone has been pinning their hopes on the vaccine and have been desperately waiting for the vaccine. While the United Kingdom rolled out its vaccine Pfizer for mass immunization, people back home are still anxiously waiting for a vaccine. The focus as of now is on companies like Serum Institute and Bharat Biotech, who are now the front runners and have also applied for emergency use. Along with these two, Pfizer has also applied for emergency use authorization and is waiting for approval. However, the committee has asked for additional data from the applicants. 

Transparency is the key and the drug regulator has to come out and communicate, what exactly did they ask from these companies, says Divya Rajagopalan.

snippet.title: Protesting farmers' reject Centre's scheme, Does this stalemate have an endgame? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, The Modi government's proposals regarding amendments in agricultural laws are not acceptable to the agitating farmers. The farmers said in the press conference today that "we completely reject the proposal we have received. We will surround the district headquarters on the 14th. There will be protests across the country. We will stop the Jaipur-Delhi highway on December 12."

 President of Kisan Shakti Sangh Pushpendra Singh says, "If Government is not agreeing to repeal the Farm Laws, even Farmers are stubborn. We will continue with our protest. Farmers' have lost their trust in the BJP Government."

#FarmersProtest #FarmLaws

snippet.title: Is Mental Illness plaguing the people of India? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, we discuss the deteriorating condition of mental illness in India.  According to the research conducted by Nielsen in September 20207, 6% are not open to talking about mental health. Depression even today is considered a bigger issue than even poverty & illiteracy among urban Indians.
The survey was carried out in association with Nielsen among 2440 consumers. In the reports, it was revealed that career is an important contributor to the source of stress & happiness. Watch as Tanvi Shukla takes us through the key takeaways of the survey! But how can you respond when you come across someone who's going through Depression?
Dr Nimesh G Desai, Prof. of Psychiatry & Director, IHBAS, Mr Ritika Aggarwal, Consultant Psychologist, Jaslok Hospital & Research Centre, Dr Khanna, Mental Health Professional, and Dr Marcus Ranney Champion of Wellbeing explains!
#ActNow #MentalIllness #MentalHealth

snippet.title: Mysterious Illness hits Andhra Pradesh; Is this another wave of fear? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla puts the spotlight on the horror that has been unfolded in the State of Andhra Pradesh from the past few days. A mysterious illness has struck the Godawari District of Andhra Pradesh. Hundreds of pf people have been flooded to the hospital from the Godawari District and surrounding regions. Following this, the outbreak reached towards Eluru city.

As per the AIIMS report, it has been found high metal content such as lead & nickel in drinking water as the cause behind the outbreak. According to the reports, total of 505 patients were diagnosed with the mysterious illness, out of which, 120 are currently undergoing treatment, 370 are discharged and 1 is deceased.

Watch!

snippet.title: Kejriwal under house arrest; Was AAP Sarkar's claim against Delhi police genuine? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through all the details of Bharat Band which was called in by the protesting farmers today. Even though many States pledged to follow the shutdown call, a limited impact of Bharat Bandh was witnessed across the country.
According to the latest update, a sixth-round of talks between the Centre and Kisan Leaders will be held tomorrow over the controversial Farm Laws. Ahead of this meeting, Union Home Minister Amit Shah had called in another meeting with the farmers’ leaders.
Meanwhile, AAP Government has claimed that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal had been put under house arrest by the Delhi Police and no one was allowed to enter his residence. However, the Delhi Police denied all the allegations exposing several proofs. After hours of the faceoff between the Delhi Police and AAP workers over the alleged house arrest of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, the AAP workers were finally allowed to enter his residence.

Watch!

snippet.title: Fuel price hike adds to recession woes; Will the governments provide relief? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the hike in the prices of fuel. The prices of petrol and diesel have increased for the sixth day in a row. The fuel prices are at an all-time 2-year high, further adding to the recession woes. The fuel prices have raised 15 times since November 20. The price of petrol in Delhi stands at Rs 83.71, in Mumbai, it's beyond Rs 90/liter. Diesel too has gone up to Rs 80.5/liter now. Should the Central and state governments step in and provide the much-needed relief to the common man? Furthermore, can the government afford to give relief, given that the economy is in recession?

Tanvi Shukla discusses this with the panelists, which includes Anshul Avijit, Prof Aman Agarwal, and Viswas Pathak.

snippet.title: India gears up for vaccinating; Will COVISHIELD beat Pfizer? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla takes up the much-discussed topic of the COVID vaccine. Ever since the pandemic has struck in the country, everyone has pinned their hopes on a vaccine that could help them and everyone around them as well. The United Kingdom last week made an announcement of rolling out the Pfizer vaccine, which has gotten the nod from the government. Boris Johnson also stated that the vaccine will be rolled out on December 7, and India ever since has been hoping to get a vaccine soon. After Pfizer, Serum Institute moves DCGI and awaits the nod for emergency use. Serum Institute is also the first Indian company to seek emergency approval for the vaccine. PM Modi also announced the rolling out of the vaccine is just a couple of weeks away in India.

snippet.title: Will farmers' 'Bharat bandh' affect your life? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, The protesting farmers call for a nationwide strike on December 8 i.e. tomorrow. Centre sends countrywide advisory for Bharat bandh and asks states to tighten security. What will be functional and what will be shut tomorrow? 

The Bharat Band or “Bharat Bandh” call is a warning to the Centre by the farmers (Kisan or Kisan Unions) who have created a blockade outside national capital New Delhi since the last 11 days, demanding the repealing of the Farm Laws passed in Parliament’s both houses.

Mirror Now asks Bal Malkit Singh, Chairman, Core Committee and Former President, AIMTC, "What is the extent of Bandh the transport sector is likely to see tomorrow?" 

#BharatBandh

snippet.title: COVID-19 Vaccine race: Is India ready to vaccinate its mass population? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, we discuss the race for Coronavirus vaccine and India’s position in it. Pfizer India has sought an emergency use authorization from the Drugs Controller General of India. Pfizer appealed to regulatory body to allow mass distribution of vaccine and waiver of clinical trials on Indians.
Pfizer spokesperson said to Mirror Now that the Coronavirus vaccine will be supplied only through Government contracts. How can Pfizer Vaccine be made available in India given the cost and logistic concerns?
‘With Pfizer Vaccine, we don't have any local data. Given the safety, cost and logistic concerns, it will be a difficult vaccine to implement in India’ says Anant Bhan, Researcher, Global Health, Bioethics & Health Policy
Watch!

snippet.title: How has Ranjitsinh Disale’s journey been with the 'Global Teacher Prize'? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, A very special guest joining us, 32-year-old Ranjitsinh Disale, A Government School teacher, from a very small part of Maharashtra, has won a great internal award and price for the work that he been doing in the field of education, especially tribal girls education. He has won a 1 million dollar Global Teacher Award.   

The winner of the Global Teacher Prize, Ranjitsinh Disale says, "I believe that a collaborative effort of top 10 teachers, will make the world a better place & that's why I decided to share the prize money. What matters the most is to believe in the girls' education. Once a girl is educated, it benefits two families."

snippet.title: What the Hyderabad Poll results for the BJP signify? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, BJP leaders are seeing the Hyderabad election results as a ‘semi-final’ before the 2023 Assembly election, which will be the grand final in the party’s attempt to wrest away the state from the TRS. In the 2018 Assembly election, the BJP barely registered its presence, winning just one seat from the 118 it contested in the 119-member Assembly, with a vote percentage of just above 7 per cent. Is Hyderabad Polls a BJP's launchpad to Southern India? What does this mean for TRS (Telangana Rashtra Samithi) who has gripped the Telangana? Did the polarising campaign of BJP really work for them?

Watch!

snippet.title: Should India legalize the use of Cannabis? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the recent decision that the United Nations has made. United Nations has today has legalized various products of cannabis including Marijuana. The United Nations has added that cannabis is not dangerous. India along with the majority voted to remove cannabis from the list of the most dangerous substances. Cannabis was listed along with deadly opioids. As of now, cannabis is illegal in India. Should India take the move to legalize cannabis?

Tanvi Shukla takes this across to the panelists on the show which includes, Dr. Shyam Aggarwal, BV Kumar, Dr. Atul, Vikram Patel, and Tathagata Satpathy.

snippet.title: PM Modi announces COVID vaccine; Is the country ready to be vaccinated? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the declaration that the Prime Minister made today. Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced that we are just weeks away from getting a COVID vaccine, which is made in India and will be available at very affordable prices, further adding that there are three vaccine trials that are very close and that the experts believe that a COVID vaccine could be ready in few weeks. Prime Minister in the virtual all party-meeting also added that after getting a nod from the experts, the immunization process in India will begin. The vaccine primarily will be provided to the health care workers, frontline workers, and senior citizens. But is India ready to vaccinate the vast population? 

Tanvi Shukla takes this across to senior journalist Vikas Dandekar, who states that it looks perfectly okay in terms of the timeline that the PM has mentioned.

snippet.title: Farmer's Union held talks with the Centre; Will the Andolan come to an end? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the ongoing farmers' protest in Delhi. The farmers have been protesting against the three farm laws which were introduced by the Centre. The farmers have been protesting for 8 days straight and the deadlock does not seem to be coming to an end. The farmer's union and the Centre have met earlier in the day to decide together and end the impasse. The last meeting between the farmers and the Centre did not seem fruitful and was left inconclusive as the farmers demanded an immediate withdrawal of the three laws. Earlier today, Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh met Home Minister Amit Shah to discuss the matter and then put the onus back on the Centre. The matters were further escalated when Badal supremo Parkash Singh returned his Padma Vibhushan, to show solidarity to the farmers. 

Tanvi Shukla discusses this with the panelists on the show.

snippet.title: Rajinikanth makes political entry; Will Thalaivar convert his fans into voters? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the latest and probably the biggest political blockbuster news, that is Rajinikanth making an announcement of entering politics. snippet.title: Top honey brands accused of adulteration; How safe is food in India? I The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, Tanvi Shukla discusses the adulteration of honey that has been claimed by Delhi based advocacy group, Centre for Science and Environment (CSE) on Wednesday. CSE has claimed that 77 percent of samples from India's top honey brands were found to use the modified syrup in their honey to clear the safety tests. Only 3 of the 13 brands which include, Saffola, Markfed Sohna, and Nature’s Nectar were able to clear the Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (NMR) tests. Even brands like Dabur and Patanjali have not cleared the test according to the allegation. FSSAI is yet to respond to this allegation. Can India not even trust the big brands?

snippet.title: Cyclone Burevi: IMD predicts another cyclone in Tamil Nadu & Kerala, NDRF teams pre-positioned
snippet.description:
The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has announced another cyclone in Tamil Nadu and Kerala, Cyclone Burevi. It is expected to emerge into the Gulf of Mannar in the coming few hours. This is the second cyclone in the states of Tamil Nadu and Kerala in less than a week. NDRF teams have been deployed in both the states to deal with the predicted catastrophe.  
The Union Home Minister, Amit Shah has assured support to the states in this difficult situation. He said that the Centre is committed to providing "all possible support" to the two states. However, the Vice President of IMD, V. P. Sharma says this cyclone will not able as severe as the previous one.  
#CycloneBurevi #KeralaCyclone

snippet.title: Will Indian political parties find a conclusion to farmers amidst the Kisan Dharna?|The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we discuss the 7th day of the farmer crisis where the deadlock continues even as the Kisan Andolan finds no conclusive points. The centre, yesterday, moved to resolve the standoff by inviting 32 farmer unions for talks but both parties failed to reach a consensus as the farmers fail to warm up to the government’s suggestion of forming a committee to look into their demands. There are massive traffic jams at the border areas of Delhi that have been reported. The farmers have now intensified their agitation and many farmers from Gwalior are now leaving for Delhi to join the protests against the centre’s farm laws. As per the farmers, they will spread the agitation across the country so their voices are heard. They also want a special session of the parliament pertaining to the farm laws. A stage has been set for detailed talks but there has been no conclusive response from both the parties. The heavy blockade in Delhi has resulted in multiple entry points being closed for people. All eyes are now set on the Kisan memorandum. The farmers want oppression to end and be addressed.

snippet.title: Aghadi government lays a BIG charge, says ‘BJP is taking B-Town to UP’ | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we track the big story that is the controversy between the Chief Ministers of Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra, Yogi Adityanath has been on a mission for a roadmap for a film city in Uttar Pradesh. Yogi Adityanath is said to meet Bollywood A-listers. Shiv Sena on the other hand has called it a conspiracy to hurt the business in Mumbai. The BJP has gone ahead and slammed the opposition stating that the move will create more jobs. Many actors turned politicians have cited the ‘more employment’ narrative, Ravi Kishan who is also a BJP MP stated that the film industry in Mumbai is not being removed but more job opportunities are now being created for people considering how PM Modi wanted India to be a self-reliant economy. snippet.title: UK approves COVID vaccine; Will India explore the Pfizer option? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses a ray of hope which has come amid the gloom of Coronavirus. A massive breakthrough has stepped in the war against the COVID-19 pandemic. The United Kingdom has become the first country to approve Pfizer’s Coronavirus vaccine. The vaccine claims 95% efficacy in final trials.
Pfizer-BioNTech’s COVID vaccine has been authorised for emergency use by the Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Authority and is all set to be administered in Britain in the upcoming week. Meanwhile, the Central Government of India has claimed that vaccination is not needed for all. 
Does it really mean good news for India? Will India explore the Pfizer vaccine option? What should be the Central government's vaccination target? 
Watch as top experts analyse the government’s vaccination strategy!

snippet.title: Row over Assam's marriage law; It empowers women or breaches liberty? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Avni Raja discusses the new marriage law which can be passed by the Assam Government. The Assam government is currently mulling to bring in a law that will bring transparency in the institution of marriage. 
According to the new law, the couple who plans to get married will have to maintain complete transparency by disclosing their income, occupation, & religion to each other. Disclosure will be mandatory a month prior to the marriage.
State Ministers claim that this is a move to empower women and equality, however, the law has landed itself in a massive controversy as it might bring in unnecessary interference by the government and also might breach one’s right to liberty.
The new marriage law empowers women or breaches liberty?
Watch to know!

snippet.title: Dilli Chalo protest continues; Will the centre listen to India's farmers? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On this episode of the Urban Debate, the talks on the ongoing farmer agitation continue. There seem to be no signs of any kind of a breakthrough as the farmers have clearly refused the government's offer of having conditional talks after Home Minister Amit Shah proposed to hold talks immediately after shifting to the Burari grounds.

Farmers have refused to do either of those and the protest leaders demand the centre to talk with no conditions. After the farmers entered Delhi on day 2 of their protest march, they refused to leave the borders until their demands are met by the government asking the centre to hold talks without any pre-conditions.

Minister of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Minister of Rural Development and Minister of Food Processing Industries Narendra Singh Tomar has planned to hold a meeting to discuss this with Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Will the government of India listen to the nation's distressed farmers?

snippet.title: ‘Dilli Chalo’ reignites farm laws debate; What are the demands of the annadatas? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, after a 36-hour long standoff that saw pitched battles between the protesters and the police, the Narendra Modi led government has now softed its stand. The farmers will now be engaged in a dialogue that was one of their main demands which were to find a middle ground. ‘Farmers stand to gain a lot when potentially the private sector invests in storage & warehousing. We are ready to have repeated dialogues to clear any apprehensions that the farmers have’, says Tuhin A Sinha. ‘Lack of sincere dialogues and the distrust that exists between the farmers and the Central Govt has resulted into Farmers’ Delhi Protest’, says Kailash Singh Deo, a former member of parliament, Lok Sabha, BJD. Avik Saha, Convenor of Jai Kisan Andolan, The Farmers Wing Of Swaraj Abhiyan explains that the central government must be aware of it bu now and they should set an agenda for the discussion. Maheshinder Singh Grewal, Senior Vice President, and Spokesperson, Akali Dal, states that today was indeed a sad day as the government used water cannons on the farmers. He further adds that it is their democratic right to protest peacefully and march in Delhi.

snippet.title: Clashes, tear gas shells & water cannons;Did the centre handle the protest right? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, The struggle between the Farmers and the Police of Punjab, Haryana, and Delhi continues. Farmers marching towards Delhi to protest against the agricultural laws. The protest sparked at the Singhu border on Friday morning. Around 2 pm, the situation worsened and the police fired around 40 rounds of tear gas. 

Meanwhile, the farmers' organization and the Delhi Police were constantly talking about the protest site after which it was decided that the farmers would be allowed to hold 'peaceful protest' at Nirankari Samagam in Burari, Delhi.

Now the police will reach Delhi with the farmers. At the same time, Delhi Metro has stopped the facility of clearance and entry from six metro stations as a precaution.

snippet.title: Govt releases Roshni Scam dossier; Is the Gupkar Alliance right in crying foul? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses a topic which has become a topic of buzz across the country, the Roshni Land Scam. The Central Government released a dossier which exposes names of top leaders of Jammu and Kashmir in the case. Some of the top names include Former Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti and Farooq Abdullah.
As more and more names are emerging in the Roshni Land Scam worth Rs 25,000 Crores, tension amongst the hit Jammu and Kashmir politics is rising. Senior state leaders in the scheme are under the scanner of the Central Agencies over the scheme that was allegedly initiated in the regime of Farooq Abdullah. 
Is the Gupkar Alliance right in crying foul? What was the rationale behind Roshni Act?
Watch!

snippet.title: Allopathy vs Ayurveda; should Ayush doctors be allowed to conduct surgeries? I The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses the ever ragging war between Allopathy vs Ayurveda. The government has given a nod to Ayurveda practitioners to perform surgeries. To this Indian Medical Association (IMA) has said that the government is playing with the health of people. 

"This is not a fight between Allopathy & Ayurveda. We want Ayurveda to grow and progress. Our worry is 'mixopathy', the creation of hybrid doctors" added former national president of IMA, Dr. Ravi Wankhedkar. 

The decision to allow Ayurveda practitioners to perform surgery as crucial as heart transplant has stirred controversy amongst the community of doctors. Is it a justified move?

snippet.title: Lalu Prasad accused of poaching MLAs; Is RJD trying to buy BJP's MLAs? I The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses the ongoing Bihar politics. The former Chief Minister of Bihar, Lalu Prasad Yadav has been accused of poaching National Democratic Alliance (NDA) MLAs. This allegation was made by former deputy CM, Sushil Kumar Modi. Modi has alleged that Lalu is trying to lure their MLAs through phone calls from Ranchi. 
The minister tweeted "Lalu Yadav making telephone call (8051216302) from Ranchi to NDA MLAs and promising ministerial berths". 

He added "When I telephoned, Lalu directly picked up. I said don't do (sic) these dirty tricks from jail, you will not succeed,"

However, RJD functionaries have denied the allegations calling them baseless. Is Lalu buying BJP MLAs?

snippet.title: Why the Uttar Pradesh Government brought 'Love Jihad' ordinance? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Over the last few weeks, five BJP-led state governments, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Haryana, Karnataka and Assam, have declared their intention to bring a new law into effect that would curb alleged instances of 'Love Jihad,' a term used to describe the forced conversion of non-Muslim women to Islam by Muslim men. 

The draft law had come under sharp criticism from several legal scholars who had contended that the concept of 'love jihad' did not have any constitutional or legal basis. They have pointed to Article 21 of the Constitution which guarantees individuals the right to marry a person of one's choice. 

The Special Investigation Team finds no conspiracy behind law and High Court bats for love. Then why did the Uttar Pradesh Government bring love Jihad ordinance?

snippet.title: Is India prepared for COVID-19 vaccine rollout? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Post festival season surge in the number of coronavirus cases seem to have washed away the gains that were being made by what had begun to emerge as a flattening of the curve. As Covid cases continued to mount, especially in northern and western India, a number of state governments, on Monday announced additional restrictions to control the spread of the disease. 

Today, the Prime Minister had called the meeting of 8 worst affected states due to the Covid-19 situation. In this meeting, Niti Ayog also made a presentation about the Covid-19 vaccine and its distribution.

Which COVID-19 Vaccine is best suited for India? Are concerns over side-effects of vaccine legitimate? Does India have storage facilities for the vaccine? 

Watch!

snippet.title: MHA gives the approval to analyse radicalisation; Can it be legally defined? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the Home Ministry has approved the plan in order to analyse radicalisation in our country. The study will suggest practical solutions to prevent radicalisation and indicate how the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act or UAPA can be used and amended and will suggest practicable solutions and it will be conducted in four specific states. The study will hopefully reveal vulnerable targets and will help in de-radicalisation and will speak to those that are linked to radicalisation and 75 radicalised individuals to be sampled per state. Opposition parties are now making taking a different stance, the question that now comes forward is if the study on radicalisation is required; if there are any fears pertaining to the direction in which it will be headed; and how can we legally define radicalisation?

snippet.title: Is India prepared to handle the Coronavirus spike? I The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we discuss the alarming condition of rising Coronavirus cases in India. While the foregone Diwali celebration was a big relief for the citizens after a long period of lockdown it also resulted in a large number of gatherings causing a spike in the pandemic. Despite the warning by experts gross violation of wearing masks and prohibited gathering in public places was seen during the festival. As a resulted India has landed up in a grave situation with an increasing fatality rate due to Covid-19 according to the latest reports issues by Health Ministry. Will Indians survive this deadly virus? Tune in to the debate to know more.

snippet.title: Chilling law by CM Pinarayi Vijayan; Can Kerala’s new law curb fake news? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, we are looking at an ordinance which has been brought in by the Pinarayi Government in Kerala and passed by Governor Arif Mohammed Khan has signed the ordinance amending the Kerala Police Act. According to the ordinance, any social media or online post that is deemed as threatening, abusive, humiliating or offensive will face police actions. A jail term of 5 or more years can also be sentenced.  This new law brought in harsh criticism from the opposition calling it a draconian law. 
Will the new law muzzle freedom of speech or punish hatemongers? Is this a new gag order in the name of protection against abusers? Can Kerala’s new law curb fake news?
Watch!
#KeralaNewLaw #SocialMediaAbuse #OnlineAbuse

snippet.title: Why is Congress crying foul over Income Tax notice? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Congress leader and former Maharashtra Chief Minister Prithviraj Chavan have been sent a notice by the Income Tax Department. On this notice received on Wednesday, Chavan on Thursday targeted the Modi government. He said that such notices are constantly being sent to opposition leaders. 

Without giving detailed information about the notice, Prithviraj Chavan said, 'Modi government has sent a notice to me through the Income Tax Department. I believe a similar notice was also sent to Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) President Sharad Pawar. 

According to the information received from sources, the notice sent to Chavan has been asked to show the documents in respect of the property declared on his behalf in the last 10 years. On this, Chavan says that he regularly files his IT returns.

Congress slams the Government over notice and says, "Probe agencies used as vendetta tool." 

Watch!

snippet.title: Delhi fight the COVID-19 battle; Is politics risking lives of people? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the crisis which National Capital is currently fighting with and how the matter is politicized. In the last 24 hours, over 130 people have died due to Coronavirus in Delhi. Despite imposing measures, the AAP government is failing to curb the pandemic spread.

Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal led government has regulated a new norm of fining Rs 2000 for not wearing a mask. It has also ordered 42 private hospitals to reserve 80% of their ICU beds for treatment of COVID-19 patients. However, Delhi High Court has lashed out at State Government for lack of steps and even amid this, the political parties continue to fight over restrictions & fine impositions.

Why is this a political point of contention?

Watch!

#DelhiCovidCrisis #DelhiCoronavirus #DelhiCovidCases

snippet.title: Politics in Tamil Nadu gathers steam, Will BJP abandon AIADMK for Sasikala? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, DMK patron Late M Karunanidhi’s elder son MK Alagiri has hinted at launching his own political outfit ahead of the polls next year and the rumour mill has it that he might join forces with the Bharatiya Janata Party. It is to be noted here that the BJP has been unsuccessful in penetrating the political forts of Tamil Nadu till date.

Sasikala, who is convicted by the Supreme Court in a disproportionate assets case along with two of her relatives - Illavarasi and Sudhakaran – is lodged in the Parappana Agrahara Central Prison in Bengaluru. The former AIADMK general secretary is serving a four-year jail-term awarded to her in the corruption case and will complete her term in January 2021. 

Replying to an RTI query, Bengaluru Central Prison's Public Information Officer said that Sasikala is expected to come out of the jail on January 27, 2021, upon paying the entire fine amount of Rs 10 crore.

Watch!

snippet.title: Life threatening disease post-Covid, Medical experts raises red-flag | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, A sudden spike in COVID related disease in children called P.I.M.S is now emerging as a cause for concern. The disease mostly affects infants, children, & teenagers & experts say it can lead to medical emergencies like shock, organ failure & death. 

Mumbai witnesses a spike in P.I.M.S, among children & adolescents exposed to COVID. Till July, only 36 cases were recorded, but between July-Oct, caseload went up to 140. High fever post-COVID, rashes, bloodshot eyes & respiratory issues are symptoms to look for. 

In Bengaluru's Aster CMI hospital, Multi System Inflammatory Syndrome was found in 10-12 children in past 6-8 weeks. Symptoms included high fever, red eyes & rashes for 5-7 days & in some cases very low blood pressure. In Manipal Hospital, 11 children were diagnosed with P.I.M.S. 

Watch!

snippet.title: Lakshmi Vilas Bank placed under moratorium; How will this affect the Aam Janata? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla explains the effect that may come to light after RBI’s move against the Lakshmi Vilas Bank. Tamil Nadu based Lakshmi Vilas Bank has been placed under moratorium by Reserve Bank of India for 30 days which is until the 16th of December. LVB is set to merge in DMK Bank India.

The limit of withdrawal for depositors is going to be ₹ 25000, however, RBI also assured that the interest of people will be protected. The RBI has also superseded the current position of Bank in the finance market and. According to RBI, there is a serious deterioration in the bank’s financial position and DMK merger will enhance its performance.

Watch!

snippet.title: Politics rise over Bengaluru Riots l Who is the conspirator of violence? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla puts the spotlight on the politics in the State of Karnataka. After a night of mayhem in Bengaluru on August 11, where an angry mob resorted to arson, an unstoppable ruckus was witnessed in the city. Amid the investigation, Multiple links of Congress leaders emerged during the probe.

Today, Ex-mayor and Congress leader Sampath Raj, who was on a run since the riots took place, has been finally arrested. Soon after the arrest, political mudslinging began. While Congress questions the move, BJP says that the arrest was backed by valid evidence.

Watch the heated debate over Sampath Raj’s arrest in Bengaluru Riots.

snippet.title: What role is India playing in the development of the Coronavirus vaccine? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, We all know that the progression of COVID-19 disease is unpredictable. Some cases stay mild, some face severe sickness that necessitates hospitalization and even oxygen/ventilatory support. Tonight we put the spotlight again on something that the whole world is waiting for and that's the vaccine for Coronavirus. When will Covid vaccines be ready? Can India afford huge cost of vaccines? Does India have the required storage facilities? What are the challenges related to distribution and disbursal? 

Senior Journalist Vikas Dandekar says, "While it is encouraging that all of these vaccines are found to be more than 90% effective in their interim analysis, we need to remember that these are all going through very fastrack plans." 

#CovidVaccine

snippet.title: Why News portals are wary of Government's recent moves? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Mirror Now takes you through the details being sought by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (Ministry of I&B) from Digital media platforms & other updates as far as digital media regulation is concerned. 

Exchange4media Founder Dr Anurag Batra says that the Government clearly understands that the impact of digital media is now coming at par with traditional broadcast media. Hence, this needs to ring-fence. If the Government wants to bring in regulation, it needs to talk to stakeholders.

"There is enough evidence to show this is in bad faith & has nothing to do with creating a more robust environment for an industry in its infancy," says Newslaundry Co-founder  Abhinandan Sekhri. 

#DigitalMediaRegulation

snippet.title: RJD blames Congress for its LOSS;Is Congress becoming a liability for its allies? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, there is a massive question mark on the leadership of Rahul Gandhi and the Gandhi family with respect to the Congress party. The party is now facing the biggest test of nationalism, after the big loss in the Bihar elections, RJD has now blamed the Congress party for its loss. Sarika Kumari, RJD, says that 'We never blamed the Congress party for the loss. All the parties in the Mahaghathbandhan worked hard. There must be one or two people who must have expressed their personal views but this is not the party's view'. RJD has now slammed the Congress party for its loss in the Bihar elections, there has been a massive controversy that has now erupted concerning the organisational difference in the party, Kapil Sibal reads the riot act saying that Congress party thinks ‘all is well’. There is an existential crisis for the Congress party that has been intensifying. 



Now that Nitish Kumar has sworn in as the Chief Minister of the state of Bihar, this is his fourth term. RJD boycotted the Chief Minister’s swearing ceremony after the massive loss. The new cabinet will include various challenges pertaining to different issues that the state is tackling. COVID crisis and unemployment are at the top-most. Along with Nitish Kumar, his new cabinet also took the oath, Tarkishore Prasad and Renu Devi have been sworn in as Deputy Chief Minister. Radhika Ramaseshan, Consulting Editor, Business Standard says, that this is not going to be a very stable coalition as far as she can see, she further adds that Had Sushil Modi been there, his presence would have made all the difference, But he is not there.

snippet.title: Is Delhi calling for health emergency? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, From shuttling in hundreds of medical professionals from across the country to doubling testing rates, Delhi's containment efforts are switching gears as the capital attempts to recover from the third wave. 

The capital has recorded over 7,000 cases per day for the last five consecutive days, a new record and the Diwali festivities have only just begun. Experts have suggested that the increase in particulate matter that has seen Delhi's air quality deteriorate to dangerous levels, along with cooling temperatures, maybe the primary factors leading to the surge in cases. 

With falling temperatures, rising levels of air pollution, large festive crowds gathering in greater frequency, the onset of the wedding season, and increased inter-state migration across the NCR, Delhi is primed for its worst spell. Is Delhi ready to tackle a health emergency?

Watch!

snippet.title: Nitish announced as Bihar CM but race still on for Dy CM; Why is Sushil sidelined? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On this edition of The Urban Debate with Afrida Rahman Ali, we discuss the developments happening in Bihar after the election results that came out last Tuesday on the 10th of November. The NDA has made some significant decisions with regards to Government formation. 

JDU Chief Nitish Kumar was chosen to be the leader of the NDA and will be sworn in as the Chief Minister of Bihar for the 4th term in a row. What has made ripples in this decision-making process is the choice of names for the Deputy Chief Minister which has not been officially announced yet.

Sources have told Mirror Now that it is likely that the state of Bihar will have 2 Deputy Chief Ministers. Although NDA is tight-lipped in terms of making a formal announcement and there are 2 names that are doing the rounds which is Renu Devi & Tarkishore Prasad. 

Who will be the next Bihar Deputy Chief Minister? Will Bihar have two Deputy Chief Ministers? Will BJP reshuffle its leadership in Bihar?

#RaceForBiharDyCM #BiharGovt

snippet.title: Diwali celebration chorus 'Vocal for local' in markets | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Covid pandemic has changed several things and a completely different new normal is now in place. Diwali the festival to ravish variety of traditional sweets has also changed in line. With more focus on boosting the immunity, focus also now on healthy snacks and alternatives. 

Diwali celebrations bridge gaps and strengthen bonds by reinforcing the emotions of universal peace and brotherhood. People look forward to celebrating this festival that adds the vibrant colours of the rangoli, the glittering lights of the diyas and the sweetness of the mithais to our life. And as people gear up to celebrate this joyous occasion, send across these messages to colleagues/employees, friends, family, students and your someone special.

snippet.title: NDA wins the Bihar battle, Will Nitish Kumar continue as state Chief Minister? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, After the NDA won the battle in Bihar, politics has now taken center stage. Apart from the Chief Minister, it also remains to be seen who will be the Deputy Chief Minister of Bihar. Will Sushil Modi continue or will BJP put another face? 

Joining us on the panel today, Kumar Anshuman, Senior Assistant Editor for Politics at Economic Times, Ajay Kumar, Editor for Prabhat Khabar Bihar, Kailashpati Mishra Special correspondent for Dainik Bhaskar, Patna, and Narendra Nath Mishra, Political Reporter for Navbharat Times.   

"Nitish Kumar wants the BJP to give clarity on the road ahead. Only then will he play his cards," says Narendra Nath Mishra, Political Reporter for Navbharat Times.

snippet.title: Covid warriors working in pandemic & festivities, Tales of valour & dedication | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, We have all had a tough year. But, the toughest has been for the Covid frontline warriors. The kind of trouble and pain they have gone through deserves a salute. This Diwali, let us take a moment to thank these warriors. 

The fire department is one emergency service department that is busier during the festive season. Mirror Now salutes these warriors who put their lives at risk to save others. Mirror Now's Sreeja MS speaks to firemen at Banaswadi Fire Station in Bengaluru. 

Mirror Now's Alok Singh speaks to police personnel at Connaught place police station in Delhi, like cops across the country, have worked tirelessly through the pandemic & who even now, during the festive season is on duty and away from their families.

snippet.title: Finance Minister brings in stimulus package; Will it make a difference? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla takes up the new schemes that have been introduced today by the Finance Ministry in their press briefing today. Finance Ministry in their press briefing gave a push to Atmanirbhar Bharat 3.0. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman introduced a 12-point stimulus package, which is being called Atmanirbhar Bharat Rozgaar Yojana. The package aims to incentivize jobs and help the distressed sectors as well. This comes in as a big boost before Diwali, but how much will it push for the economic revival, is something that is yet to be seen. The package has been introduced at a time when the country is battling the COVID pandemic, but how will the package impact the citizens post-COVID is what the debate is going to focus on.

Senior Economist and Professor Santosh Mehrotra state that millions have lost jobs in our country and poverty is increasing by the day, so what size of the stimulus is and when you put it in the position is critical. He further adds that it is critical to keep people above the poverty line and generate demand.

snippet.title: COVID-19 cases hits Delhi badly, Where is the national capital lacking? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, As the COVID-19 spreads at a blistering pace, the general mood in the national capital is one of resignation. Defying nationwide trends, Delhi is among the few states that are heading in the wrong direction in the fight against the Coronavirus pandemic. The city reported more than 8,500 cases on Wednesday (11th November 2020), setting another daily record. The death toll increased by 85, taking the total to 7,000. 

Mirror Now explains why this is a bigger concern than ever before. 

All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Former Director Dr Mahesh Chandra Misra says, " We anticipated the spike in COVID-19 cases because of the festive season. People have started believing that Covid is gone & they aren't taking enough precaution. We seem to be in 'Auto' mode now."

#COVID19India

localized.title: COVID-19 cases hits Delhi badly, Where is the national capital lacking? | The Urban Debate
localized.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, As the COVID-19 spreads at a blistering pace, the general mood in the national capital is one of resignation. Defying nationwide trends, Delhi is among the few states that are heading in the wrong direction in the fight against the Coronavirus pandemic. The city reported more than 8,500 cases on Wednesday (11th November 2020), setting another daily record. The death toll increased by 85, taking the total to 7,000. 

Mirror Now explains why this is a bigger concern than ever before. 

All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Former Director Dr Mahesh Chandra Misra says, " We anticipated the spike in COVID-19 cases because of the festive season. People have started believing that Covid is gone & they aren't taking enough precaution. We seem to be in 'Auto' mode now."

#COVID19India

snippet.title: What does the Bihar verdict means for national politics? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Today we are putting the spotlight on Bihar election verdict. At the end of a dramatic counting day that was as exciting as Tuesday's IPL final, Bihar’s final verdict of the Assembly election arrived well past midnight. Proving most exit polls wrong, the ruling NDA crossed the mid-way mark in the 243-member Bihar Assembly, winning 125 seats.

Mirror Now questions BJP's Guru Prakash Paswan, asks "Has the coalition dharma's definition changed? Is it now about destroying coalitions? I don't see any ally left except Janata Dal (United) and Dr Ramdas Athawale."

RSS Supporter Dr Nigam says that BJP believes in inclusive politics. But if you want to confront BJP in the election, you will have to be careful because then they will destroy you.

#BiharElectionResults2020

snippet.title: Do the results confirm the perception that Congress is a liability in alliances? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, NDA’s historic win with 125 seats in alliance with BJP. Mahagathbandhan has been reduced to 110 sears and AIMIM and JLP have made huge dents when it comes to the prospects of JD(U). The elections have proved that the public of Bihar wanted to vote for development and empowerment. Congress’ defeat has now stirred new controversies when it comes to elections, new organisational changes are expected from the party considering how strong the ruling party is, the opposition has to bring a new change in the system. From crediting women voters for BJP’s victory in Bihar Elections 2020 to reaffirming the support to Nitish Kumar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivered a victory address at the BJP headquarters and thanked every single voter who made BJP what it is. Tanvi Shukla and Mirror Now’s Managing Editor Vinay Tiwari discuss the key takeaways from Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s address at the BJP headquarters.

snippet.title: Election Commission dismisses foul play charges; Will the opposition accept? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla talks about the Bihar election and its verdict, which was supposedly coming today but has now been delayed. The Election Commission has also conducted three press briefings today, something that has never been heard in this country before. These briefings come after the opposition has accused the NDA and Nitish Kumar of undermining Bihar polls and of fixing the result. Election Commission in its first briefing stated that the procedure of counting vote is free of any biases or pressure. RJD leader Manoj Jha, however, did not agree much with this and stated that they will wait for the final result and then take the matters to the court.

Tanvi Shukla states that the last leg of counting is underway but the NDA is leading and the EC has declared results for 142 seats as of now. Former Election Commissioner SY Quraishi also spoke to Mirror Now and stated that the delay has been unprecedented and the delay was only expected till midnight.

snippet.title: JD(U) admits losing seats; Will the party admit NDA's due role in elections? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Vinay Tewari talks about the much-discussed Bihar elections. The Bihar elections were the first of its kind since they were conducted during a pandemic. While the precautions and the way rallies were held might be different, but the drama that has unveiled is no different. While everyone expected the result to be out soon today, this extension was completely not anticipated. The Election Commission has also done two press briefings already. This after the opposition accused the NDA and Nitish Kumar of undermining the polls. 

Vinay Tewari takes this up with his panelists. JD(U) member Satyaprakash states that this is an unusual election that he has witnessed and he further admits that the party definitely has lost a few seats.

snippet.title: Stunning lead by NDA; Last leg of counting underway in Bihar | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, Mirror Now is tracking fine details of the Bihar elections, NDA is just above the halfway mark in terms of lead, NDA has 123 leads, Mahagathbandhan has 113 leads and others have 7 of which 5 are with AIMIM. That is the situation that Bihar is witnessing right now. An update from the Election Commission is expected, the slow counting has been due to the COVID protocols pertaining to the polling booth and voting machines, more precautions are being taken in terms of the counting process.

Tuhin Sinha of BJP, states that Congress’ entire campaign cannot be anti-Modism, Unfortunately, Rahul Gandhi does not grow out of there. Yogendra Yadav, President of Swaraj India, adds that Mahagathbandhan parties have reached Election Commission’s office, he further questions if it is fair to start crying foul and conspiracy, as the counting is still underway?

snippet.title: Bihar Election 2020: Why the slow counting trends? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, NDA with 122 leads, Mahagathbandhan with 114 leads, LJP is not leading in any constituency, Others leading in 7 constituencies. Why is counting slow for the Bihar elections, and what does it mean? 

Mirror Now's Alok Singh and Ayushman Kumar report LIVE from outside BJP HQ in Delhi and Nitish Kumar's residence in Patna. 

Rashtriya Janata Dal Syed Faisal Ali says that "even if they win 115-120 seats, they'll be shot of two seats. If we're short of two seats, we'll get support from smaller parties."

If it comes to a close call, will Asaduddin Owaisi be a person to follow? Watch what Senior Journalist & Author Nilanjan Mukhopadhyay and Senior Journalist Sanjay Singh has to say. 

#BiharElectionResults

snippet.title: Pfizer-BioNTech announces COVID vaccine breakthrough, One step ahead in a fight? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, In a major breakthrough, in the race to cure COVID, pharmaceutical giant Pfizer-BioNTech has reviewed that the COVID-19 vaccine in a phase 3 trials has shown 90% efficacy. Pfizer Chairman and CEO Albert Bourla said in a statement that, “The first set of results from our phase 3 COVID-19 vaccine trial provides the initial evidence of our vaccine’s ability to prevent COVID-19,” AFP reported. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), no vaccine is 100 per cent effective.

Dr Shahid Jameel, Director, Trivedi School of Biosciences, Ashoka University, speaks to Mirror Now and explains over the vaccine. 

#COVIDVaccine  #COVID19 #CoronavirusVaccine

snippet.title: What Democrats win means to India? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, The change at the helm of the United States is likely to have profound implications domestically, of course, but will also have a significant bearing on the Indian economy. A more pragmatic approach to bilateral trade and increases in domestic healthcare spending could see the Indian economy benefit significantly from a Joe Biden presidency. There is also likely to be a strategic shift in India-US relations as they relate to trade. The United States is among the few countries that India enjoys a current account surplus with i.e. India exports more to the United States than it imports from it. What does Joe Biden's win mean for India?

#USElectionResults2020

snippet.title: Should nation rise above sentiments & ban firecrackers? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, The NGT has ordered a ban on firecrackers till November 30 in places with 'poor' air quality across India in a bid to protect people from the increase of air pollution amid ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. The NGT said there will be a total ban against sale or use of all kinds of firecrackers in the NCR from midnight of November 9-10 to the midnight of November 30-December 1, 2020. 

Mirror Now shares the latest AQI & asks where does the onus lie. Should we depend on states, who failed to look beyond politics, or should we take the matter in our hands & pledge not to burst crackers this time?

Watch!

snippet.title: Will Biden intervene in India-Pakistan’s Kashmir issue? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Afrida Rehman Ali discusses key issues which are raised after the US Election. Democratic Joe Biden was been declared as the new President and Kamala Harris elected as the first woman Vice President in the US.

How will new President impact India? Will Biden go soft on China? What could change in terms of trade tariffs, China policy & immigration after replacement of a Republican President with a Democrat President? Will Biden intervene in India-Pakistan’s Kashmir issue?

Former Diplomat & Official Spokesperson of MEA Vishnu Prakash presents his views over the arrival of the new president. Times of India Foreign Editor Chidu also raises a point, says ‘The process of transfer is going to be messy, tedious & long-drawn. Declaration of Joe Biden winning election is a media projection. But, the actual certification of Election Results comes after all votes are counted

Watch!

snippet.title: Haryana allows 75% job reservation for locals; Is job quota promise just rhetoric? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about a call taken by the Haryana Government for providing reservation quota for the Haryanvi locals. Haryana assembly has passed a bill to provide 75% reservations in the private sector to locals who are seeking jobs in the state.

However, the bill provides a quota for local people in private-sector jobs that provide a salary of less than ₹50,000 per month. Experts are saying that this isn't very attractive for the industries. So, what's the point of bringing such a law, where you promise jobs, but there won't be new jobs coming in? Is jobs quota promise by states just rhetoric?

#Reservation #QuotaBill #Haryana

snippet.title: National Capital battles pollution; Is politics costing Delhi its clean air? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses the hazardous air which is choking Delhi. The citizens are paying price for slow death in the National Capital. For the second day in a row, the Air Quality Index in Delhi and NCR region remains severely toxic.

The rising pollution is also resulting in a surge of respiratory and Coronavirus diseases. What does Delhi government & its neighbouring State Governments need to do to curb Delhi Air Pollution? Is politics costing Delhi its clean air?

Aam Aadmi Party’s Reena Gupta shares her views over this issue saying ‘Central Government has zero concern for the environment. Since the time they've come to power, they've diluted every environment law. Because of Pollution, we're losing 6% GDP every year’. To which BJP’s Harish Khuranna counters questioning whether Eastern-Western Peripheral was made by Delhi Government?.

Watch!

snippet.title: Trump asks to stop vote counting; Is he scared of losing or has another card left? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla discusses the result of the most-awaited elections, that is U.S Elections. While Donald Trump and Joe Biden have been in a close call with each other, with Biden leading in some states, Donald Trump has come out with a new move. Earlier in the day, Donald Trump tweeted asking to stop the count and then later tweeted again, stating that any vote that came in after election day will not be counted. Joe Biden's current vote count stands at 253, while Trump stands at 213. The counting continues but at a very slow pace.

Tanvi Shukla discusses the U.S Elections and what the results are likely to hold with her guests on the show. Former diplomat Ashok Sajjanhar states that it's a battle that is really poised with heavy advantage to Joe Biden. Tanvi Shukla questions Seema Sirohi, that even in some of the swing states, Latinos have voted for Donald Trump. How can one explain the non-white support for Donald Trump?

snippet.title: BJP ruled states mulls for anti-conversion law; Are the existing laws failing? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla talks about the new controversy that has been sparked by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. U.P CM in a rally said that the state is going to introduce stricter laws to fight Love Jihad. Following U.P CM, other BJP ruled states have announced a similar action to that of Yogi Adityanath. Love Jihad is once again back into the narrative. 5 BJP ruled states have stated that they are mulling an anti-conversion law. Yogi Adityanath was backed by Haryana, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, and Assam. The leaders of all these states have used the term Love Jihad repeatedly. Tanvi Shukla explains how it all started and whether the existing laws are not enough?

To discuss the same, Tanvi Shukla takes with the panelists on the show. Fuad Halim CPI(M) leader states that the issue in itself is pathetic. He further adds that however, timing is vital as the Central government has failed to contain COVID-19 and has performed miserably in terms of the economy, rural unemployment, on the other hand, has increased.

snippet.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar drops a googlie in last campaign; Will this trick work? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla talks about the Bihar elections and the end of campaigning for phase 3 polls. The state is set to go for polls on November 7th and the result will be out on November 10th. Ever since the Bihar elections began, the drama unfolded and it has only gotten better with time. Now as the curtains close on the Bihar elections, CM Nitish Kumar made an interesting declaration. Nitish Kumar stated that this is the last time he is contesting for elections. This came on the last day of campaigning and in the last rally. Will this change the game for Nitish Kumar, who has run the state for the last 15 years? Is this just an emotional pitch or is Nitish Kumar really going to put an end to his career in politics?

To discuss the same, Tanvi Shukla takes this up with the panelists on the show. Kamal Nopany of the JDU party says that the CM has announced that this is his last election. Wouldnt that be demoralizing for the party cadres? Senior journalist Arati Jerath also tells Tanvi that Nitish Kumar is a very lonely man. Further, she thinks that he has been sensing the strong negative mood against him amongst people. She further adds that this seems like a desperate emotional appeal.

snippet.title: Trump prepares for a legal battle; Why is there a delay in the Election results? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, as the world prepares for the massively debated elections, United States is gearing up for a new leader, a new leader who focuses on real issues pertaining to immigration, health, economy, and the treatment of minorities. The country awaits the verdict on November 4. There has been a delay in the verdict of the elections. Democratic Joe Biden remains calm whereas Donald Trump remains incumbent. He has now taken the legality of the matter and has claimed his premature victory because be wong several states. He has also cited an election fraud. Donald Trump has threatened a legal war over the elections as counting is still underway for the race to the White House. Donald Trump has already won the elections against Joe Biden and that the goal now is to ensure integrity.

snippet.title: Is the fear of unrest on result day of the U.S Elections justified? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla talks about another crucial election that has begun in another part of the world, the U.S elections. The U.S presidential elections have begun from today and with this, the race to the white house will come to an end soon. The first polls have taken place and the world is anticipating who will now take over the charge of the United States. Why are there fears of unrest on the result day?

Tanvi Shukla discusses this topic with a group of panelists including Natalie Jennings, Shubhajit Roy, Nancy Pelosi, and Chidanand Rajghatta. Nancy Pelosi, states that the House of Representatives is prepared to make the decision if the winning candidate fails to get 270 votes. Further, Shubhajit adds that if Donald Trump feels that he is losing or his margins are lower, then he would definitely challenge.

Watch!

snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla talks about phase second of the Bihar elections. 94 seats across the state went for polls today and it is only the last leg of the elections is left before we find out that who will be the CM of Bihar. To understand the dynamics of Bihar Elections, Tanvi Shukla takes the issue to the panelists. Mirror Now's Managing Editor states that he does not put too much credence in voter turnout. Senior Journalist Aditi Phadnis states that voter turnouts are not indications of anything.

snippet.title: While the nation battles COVID pandemic, should Diwali be celebrated with crackers?|The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla talks about the challenge that is going to pose itself in front of us in just a few weeks and that is Diwali. While the country is already struggling with the COVID pandemic, the festive season is likely to take the number of COVID cases up. Experts have repeatedly red-flagged, how pollution, smog, fumes can be disastrous in our war against the Coronavirus pandemic. The National Green Tribunal today sent a notice to Centre on several states, indicating that the 2018 SC judgment on cracker banning will not be enough this year. Further, the NGT has advised banning crackers and the use of green crackers is no remedy for this problem. Rajasthan has taken the lead and has banned the sale of crackers, however, all other states should also follow, especially those in North India, as they are already battling with pollution.

The same is taken up with the panelists Raman Malik and Manpreet Sandhu, and Dr. Sanjeev Bagai. Sanjeev Bagai states that this year's Diwali celebration will no less than be a death trap for all of us. Raman Malik, spokesperson of BJP states that what did we do the entire year and this debate always comes up around Diwali and Holi.

snippet.title: Should the judiciary be more gender sensitized? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about gender sensitization because of a bizarre order that was given by the Madhya Pradesh court, in a case of molestation. The order came out in July 2020, but it is being discussed in detail again now because of the plea that was filed by a hoard of judges in the Supreme Court. The issue has also been raised today by the Attorney General of India KK Venugopal, who admits that there is a need for gender sensitization in our judicial system. This admission comes after some of the most bizarre and derogatory judgments from different courts in the country. 

Tanvi Shukla is joined by a group of advocates and judges, who explain what prompted them to take the matter to the Supreme Court? Aparna Bhat, a petitioner says that all kinds of comments have been made for women in these judgments. Justice Gyan Sudha Mishra is asked whether there are any gender sensitization programs, to which she says that there are, and they are still prevalent.

snippet.title: Will the Investigating agencies & the Centre take notice of the Jharkhand scam? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the recent scam that has been unearthed by The Indian Express. A scholarship scam has come to light from Jharkhand, wherein the pre-matric scholarship money is allegedly being siphoned off by a nexus of middlemen, banks, and officials as well. The scholarship was meant for poor students, belonging to the poor community, yet the advantage of that money is being taken by someone else. Apart from the money, the bank details and the Aadhar details have also been allegedly taken. 

To discuss the same, Tanvi Shukla is joined by Professor Ravi Srivastava, Abhishek Angad, Avni Kapoor, Sudesh Verma, and Professor Gaurav Vallabh.  Abhishek Angad is Indian Express' correspondent in Jharkhand who unearthed this scam and did an exhaustive investigation into the matter. He claims that they were informed that some students were not receiving the scholarship money, and when they looked into it, they got to know that it was a much bigger problem. There were middlemen, banks, even school officials also involved in it. Professor Ravi Srivastava says that the DBT system is subject to systematic corruption and inefficiency. DBT hides as much as it reveals.

snippet.title: Bihar Assembly Elections 2020: Phase 2 set at high voltage begins | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Afreeda Rehman brings the updates on the ongoing Bihar assembly elections as the second phase of the three-stage Bihar polling is all set to begin. The stakes are very high this time with voting in 94 constituencies across 17 districts and is likely to decide electoral fate of JD(U)-led NDA and RJD-led UPA.

For phase one on 28 October, 71 constituencies in 16 districts were covered. The Congress has put up candidates in 24 constituencies while the three Left parties are contesting for 14 seats. Around 7.29 crore people are set to cast their votes in the state with nearly 78 lakh first-time voters.
