snippet.title: France attacks: Is freedom of expression over religious sentiments?  | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla illustrated how France President Emmanuel Macron’s statement triggered a big controversy and topic of debates. Freedom of Expression versus Religions has become the talk of the town. 
It all started when a teacher in France referred to a cartoon of Charlie Hebdo to Prophet Mohammed in class. A brutal slurry which, lost three lives, was followed by the incident. This act sparked massive outrage even in India. Protest against France President and ideology was staged in Mumbai and Bhopal.

In the name of Freedom of Speech or Secularism, is there a subtle attempt being made to target minorities? Can hurt sentiments justify barbaric violence? Why is a section of Muslims so angry?
According to Former MEA Secretary Pinak Chakravarty, the whole issue now has been highly politicised. He further says ‘Freedom of Expression can be interpreted in different ways in different countries. But this kind of violence can't be justified’.


Journalist Noopur Tiwari, on the other hand, states that ‘The whole idea of Freedom of Expression and laïcité, the French concept of Secularism, is really misunderstood by a lot of people around the world. Satire is by definition not something that works of oppressed people’.
Watch!
#FranceTerrorAttack #FranceAttack #FreedomOfExpression

snippet.title: Sudden rise in Corona cases; Spike due to cold, pollution or bad governance? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses the COVID-19 outbreak which is haunting the National Capital. The spike, day by day, is only becoming worrisome. Delhi reported 5739 cases in the last 24 hours.

While, Delhi Health Minister has cited aggressive contact tracing and testing as the reason for the steep surge, Delhi Governor, on the other hand, approved government’s proposal to raise a number of passengers in buses from 20 to full seating capacity amid the surge.

But, what's the key reason for this sudden spike in COVID-19 cases? What should our priority be right now? What can the central Government do help the people of Delhi?

Sharing her views on this, Aam Aadmi Party’s Reena Gupta says ‘With cold weather setting in & worsening air pollution, a spike was expected. It is being monitored at the highest level and we're very well equipped & prepared if in case the number of cases rises’.

Medical Director, LNJP Medical Director Dr Suresh Kumar cites a different reason for the spike, says ‘Air Pollution is one of the reasons but, more importantly, the behaviour of people is what needs to change. Young people are still very careless, gathering in crowds and in return carrying the virus back to family and friends’

Watch!

#COVID19 #DelhiCovidOutbreak #DelhiCoronavirus

snippet.title: Chairman of Maruti Suzuki R.C. Bhargava talks about rising sales & sustainability | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss with R.C. Bhargava, Chairman of Maruti Suzuki, the potential revival of economy as buyers return back amidst festivities. However, the question remains if this is a mere temporary blip or can one be more hopeful. 

R.C. Bhargava, says that there is no sure shot way of knowing how sustainable this buying will be. The festival season, the pent up demand, the rural income have all been positive factors for a demand like this, he says. However, he adds, that there will be a lot of negative factors once those first set of buyers get exhausted. 

#RCBhargava #IndianEconomy

snippet.title: How will civic bodies function amidst heavy rainfall & COVID in Indian states? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, In today's discussion we talk about the massive rain disaster that took Tamil Nadu by surprise. Every year, rains wreak havoc in major cities across India causing huge losses. However, this year, a single day of rain threw Chennai out of gear. The process of planning must change. 210 water bodies are identified within the Greater Chennai Corporation limit. Even with rich resources, these are abandoned. Chennai MunicipalCorporationand Tamil Nady government should take accountability and action. People must get involved in the process of planning and implementation as suggested by Srinivas Murthy, Architect, and Urban Designer. Former BBMP Commissioner Dr. Ravindra stated that there is a need to bring in innovations in urban systems. Whatever is the system, the way we operate on-ground, the reality is very different and that's where it becomes complicated, he further added. 


Policy Analyst and Campaigner, Leo Saldanha pointed out that the problem is the embedded bureaucracy and the bureaucrats who guide the politicians in a particular imaginary & then politicians take advantage of it.

snippet.title: Will the new ordinance announced by central government help curb Delhi pollution? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the new law announced by the central government to tackle pollution in the Delhi-NCR region. 

Year after year Delhi chokes as pollution keeps on increasing. To curb this pollution, the central government has announced the formation of a high powered commission with 20 permanent members which will look at the issue of air quality management in the national capital region. 

The new law imposes a penalty for violators which goes up to one crore rupees as a fine and also a jail term of up to five years depending on the violation. The law will be effective immediately and will look into stubble burning, dust pollution, and other pollution problems prevalent in the region.

Reena Gupta from Aam Aadmi Party states that she does not see anything new in this particular ordinance. She further states that they already had EPCA with the powers that have been promised in this commission. But, she continues that, EPCA did not use its powers because there is no political will to actually do anything.

#DelhiPollution #DelhiAirPollution

snippet.title: Rising attacks on women for saying NO;  Is India no country for women? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we live in a world that has questioned women over every little choice that has been made. Women have been told to behave a certain way, dress a certain way, and talk in a certain way only to be safe in a place. We, as a society have still not constructed a safe space for women. What lies ahead is the trauma faces by these women due to patriarchy. Men still do not understand that NO means NO. There is no value given to something like consent and if a woman wants to do something. Acid attack is one such criminal, brutal, and gun wrenching crime that is committed in India because a woman does not consent to a man’s wish. A man shot at point-blank, stalked, and harassed, and made completely uncomfortable with everybody around her body. Tanvi Shukla shares the details of such instances that are growing in our society and what a woman goes through. These gut-wrenching details bring light upon factors that cause rapes, a rapist. The dangerous part is that because of such growing instances, many young girls would be scared to say No, just because of the fear and consequences. What can we as a society do about it?

snippet.title: Arogya Setu Controversy: Is information commission not taken seriously anymore? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we discuss the Right To Information is paramount in a democracy and is a right given by the government, but unfortunately, it is witnessed that the same authorities are now trying to take away the same right from the citizens. The big controversy that has now erupted, an RTI activist asked the IT ministry ‘who created the Arogya Setu application?’, considering the usage of the application in times of Coronavirus, the application is asked to activate on every mobile phone. Activist Saurav Das had filed an RTI pertaining to the Corona tracker. The centre has responded to the allegation that no one knows who developed the Arogya Setu application after an RTI body questioned the centre over what they called an evasive reply to the creators of Arogya Setu. Centre has issued a clarification stating that the Arogya Setu application is a product of the government of India built in collaboration with the best minds in industry and academia. Various issues are being raised as far as the safety of the data of citizens regarding the Arogya Setu application is concerned.

snippet.title: Decoding the Chirag Paswan and Munger Firing factor; What does 54% turnout signify?|The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla takes up the first phase of Bihar Polls decoding the Chirag Paswan and the Munger Firing factor. On the first day of polls, nearly 54 % population turned up to cast votes across 71 seats. There is a significant decline in the percentage of voters as compared to 2015 elections which was 56.66 % as against 53.54% this year.

Dr. Ajay Pandey, LJP spokesperson, says today LJP has emerged as a largest political party contesting in #BiharAssemblyElection2020 in terms of number of seats we're contesting. The voter turnout shows it is the vote against the current Govt".

Anand Madhab, Bihar Congress says 1 person died & 25 injured showing a serious failure of the whole administrations of the current Govt. There's a growth in crime rate by 150% under the Nitish Kumar regime.

#BiharBattle #BiharElections

snippet.title: Is India finally witnessing revival in its economy after COVID-19 pandemic? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Reserve Bank of India’s announcement of ‘cashback’ relief for borrowers. 

PV Subramanyam, a personal finance expert, talks about what happens loan borrowers who have chosen the option of moratorium but have not paid any EMI for several months during the Coronavirus lockdown. 

For the next story on Urban Debate, we discuss, if the rise in consumer expenditure during the festival season can be considered as a revival in the economy. 

Madan Sabnavis, Chief Economist at CARE Ratings Ltd., said that this is playing out the way they expected. But at the end of the year, he said, we are going to end up in negative growth rate in GDP and it should be a concern for policymakers. 

Lalit Agarwal, Chairman, and MD of V-Mart Retail and Chairman of Northern Council of Retailers Association of India said that the consumption level still is not as per the last year, it is lower. He further added that, however, it is bound to increase and we are going to see a good November this year. 

#IndianEconomy #RBI

snippet.title: Ballabgarh horror: Why are officials not present outside girl colleges in Haryana?| The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Ballabgarh horror case. A 20-year-old girl from Ballabgarh was shot dead outside her college by an alleged stalker in Faridabad, Haryana. The incident has been recorded on camera and the accused has been arrested. Her family demands that just arresting the culprits will not be enough, speedy action needs to be taken against them. 

The other story today talks about the India-US signing the Beca agreement together. The U.S Secretary of State, Mike Pompeo along with Defence Secretary Mark Esper are visiting India for the 2+2 bilateral talks between the two countries. The talks are centered on various issues including diplomatic and political tie-ups. 

The third story on the Urban Debate is about the Delhi civic doctors protesting for securing their salaries. The relentless doctors have not been paid for three months. However, both AAP and BJP were engaged in a blame game whilst the doctors suffered. Today, the MCDs have declared that they have discovered the funds to pay the doctors.

#BallabgarhHorror #India-USMeet

snippet.title: Is BJP purposely sidelining Nitish Kumar in the upcoming Bihar Elections? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the upcoming Bihar Elections, since the first round of campaigning has just got over and Nitish Kumar’s declining importance in the state.

BJP’s ally, the current Chief Minister of Bihar, Nitish Kumar, has recently been missing from the party’s posters just ahead of the elections. Speculations have been raised whether there is a conscious effort to reduce Nitish Kumar’s important or if there is any understanding that the 15-year term is bound to bring about the baggage of anti-incumbency. 

Neerja Chowdhury, a Senior Journalist, has commented on Tejashwi Yadav’s rising popularity and Nitish Kumar’s decline of the same. She said that Tejashwi Yadav has definitely become an alternative figure on the Opposition side. However, the vote may possibly be more against Nitish Kumar than a vote for Tejashwi Yadav. 

Professor Ashok Pankaj, Political Analyst commented on Nitish Kumar’s performance and said that if you look at the performance of Nitish Kumar compared to the first tenure, the second and third have been lacklustre. He added that the CM has not been able to come up with new ideas to strengthen governance. 

#BiharElections2020 #NitishKumar #Bihar Polls

snippet.title: Why does Delhi require extra COVID-19 precautions just ahead of winters? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the rise in Corona cases amidst festivities, pollution and winter.
According to the AQI reports, the pollution levels in Delhi today were 409, which falls in the severe category. With the rising pollution levels, Covid-19 cases being positive have also gone up. 
Dr. Jugal Kishore, Head of Community Medicines, Safdarjung Hospital says that previous experiences of flu cases and respiratory disorders rising during winter times were already a testament of Covid-19 cases going up during the season. He further adds that the pollution level in city adds onto the agony of Coronavirus. He says that none of this is unusual and was all expected. 
Dr. Chandrakant Pandav, Former Professor and Head of Centre for Community Medicine, AIIMS says that are multiple associations for the rising number of cases. He agrees with Tanvi Shukla and says, festivities and pollution have all resulted in the rise. 

#DelhiPollution #Covid-19

localized.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the rise in Corona cases amidst festivities, pollution and winter.
According to the AQI reports, the pollution levels in Delhi today were 409, which falls in the severe category. With the rising pollution levels, Covid-19 cases being positive have also gone up. 
Dr. Jugal Kishore, Head of Community Medicines, Safdarjung Hospital says that previous experiences of flu cases and respiratory disorders rising during winter times were already a testament of Covid-19 cases going up during the season. He further adds that the pollution level in city adds onto the agony of Coronavirus. He says that none of this is unusual and was all expected. 
Dr. Chandrakant Pandav, Former Professor and Head of Centre for Community Medicine, AIIMS says that are multiple associations for the rising number of cases. He agrees with Tanvi Shukla and says, festivities and pollution have all resulted in the rise. 

#DelhiPollution #Covid-19

snippet.title: Will the sudden rise in child marriages continue post lockdown? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the hidden impact of Coronavirus pandemic and lockdown. 
With Coronavirus disrupting the per diem lives of everybody including major economies it has also wreaked havoc in the lives of many children. Child marriages in Maharashtra have increased by 78.3% till September. 138 cases have been reported in the last three months. Women and Child Development Ministry have stopped 120 child marriages whilst the local authorities are also working on the same. 
Poverty and financial instability has driven many families to marry their young daughters off. This year’s figure has witnessed a steepest rise compared to the last five years. 
Isidore Phillips, Director of Divya Disha commented on the issue. He stated that the biggest problem in child protection is that if we do not acknowledge that child marriages are happening, we will not be able to work towards resolving it. He emphasised that we need to first start by acknowledging that there’s a problem. 
Charu Pragya, Spokesperson for BJP stated that whether it’s health, education or employment, girls have lost out on all these because of Covid-19 pandemic. To tackle this, she said, we need to ensure that prevention of Child Marriage Act is a secular act, spread awareness by education not only for parents but girls too. 

#ChildMarriages #Maharashtra

snippet.title: Heavy rains wreak havoc across India, Misgovernance flooding major cities? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Sahar Zaman, Why big cities in our country established with infrastructure are flooding frequently? Heavy downpour in Bengaluru has left several low lying areas completely flooded. Visuals from various parts of the city show severe waterlogging & inundation. More visuals from Koramangala 4 & 6th block showed roads flooded with water up to 5 feet. These low lying areas have been facing the issue for years now and little has been done to find a permanent solution.

Captain Ganesh Karnik of Bharatiya Janta Party says that the uncontrolled & unplanned urbanisation and badly managed urban development issues have contributed in this. Reverting to this, Mirror Now's Sahar Zaman says, "We've identified the causes of this. But it's about Governments having to fix it."

Mahesh Palawat, Vice president, Meteorology And Climate Change SkymetWeather says, "This is climate change taking place gradually. Reason being that greenhouse gases are increasing, global warming and rising air temperature."

snippet.title: Will migrants be a crucial factor in Bihar Elections 2020? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through the latest updates from the State of Bihar. The political dispute between four main parties seems to be only surging day by day. The latest faceoff is witnessed between the Mahagathbandhan and the NDA alliance. While RJD has promised 10 lakh jobs opportunities in Bihar, the BJP has promised 19 lakh jobs

Meanwhile, Mirror Now's Reporter speaks to the voters in Bihar about government's free COVID-19 vaccine promise made by the Bhartiya Jana Party and also gets their views on the forthcoming elections. As political parties are making several promises, many questions arise in the voter’s mind.

What will the political parties do for the migrants, if chosen to power? What is the strategy for job creation? Bihar is second from the bottom according to NITI Aayog’s healthcare index. Will it go beyond giving free COVID-19 vaccine? In the past few years, the issue of spurious liquor has cropped up & several people have been jailed because of the violation. Is it the time to relook at prohibition law?

Watch as expertise in panel helps us decode these questions!

#BiharElections #BiharPoll #BiharElections2020

snippet.title: Is India's COVID-19 race on right track? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla illustrates nine such stages that are needed to be crossed before COVID-19 vaccine reaches anyone of us. She also talks about the major challenges that are lying ahead of us afore the vaccine arrives

Expertises share their views on India’s race for COVID-19 vaccine and the relevancy of promise made by BJP, of distributing free vaccines if elected.

Former Health Secretary Sujata Rao ‘Given the economic condition, I doubt the govt will be able to provide everyone with a free vaccine. Also, the government will be able to give a generic guideline, the last mile will depend on states & the majority don't have the capacity to do that’

Prof. Sudhir Krishna from National Centre for Biological Sciences, on the other hands, says that ‘It is likely there are going to be huge regional differences across the country. A good analytical plan from early on would allow us to do fine tailoring of the whole process’.

Watch!

#COVIDVaccine #COVID19 #CoronavirusS

snippet.title: Maharashtra government’s block against CBI: a move to stop misuse or fair use? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Maharashtra government’s withdrawal of ‘general consent’ for CBI.
Maharashtra government in its new order, stated that it had revoked ‘general consent’ provided to the CBI to carry out any probes without the government’s consent. However, the Uddhav Thackeray government has changed its stance on the same and the CBI will now have to seek the State government’s approval to carry out any new investigation.
This, the government says, has been done to avoid any political misuse of central forces like the CBI. The decision comes after the UP government suggested a CBI probe in the TRP case handled by the Mumbai Police. Similarly, had this consent been revoked earlier the SSR case would have become much more complicated for the CBI to probe into. 
Mahesh Tapase, Spokesperson for NCP, stated that there has been a large scale apprehension by non-BJP stated about misuse of CBI. He further added that according to the Delhi Special Police Establishment Act of 1946, CBI has to take permission from state government to enter into its territorial area. He adds that the government is just exercising the act. 
Rajiv Ranjan Prasad, Spokesperson of JDU, on the other hand says that the Congress missed the CBI during their term of power and therefore now fears that the government might misuse the CBI against them, in the same way. 

#MaharashtraGovernment #CBIBlock

snippet.title: Should vaccine distribution be used as an election campaign promise? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla demonstrates a controversy which has been stirred a few days ahead of Bihar Elections. The Bhartiya Janata Party released a manifesto for Bihar Poll was certain promises were made to the people. One of their main promises was distributing free COVID-19 vaccines in Bihar, but only if they got elected.

This free vaccine distribution promise irked the opposition parties, which resulted in numerous slandering remarks. Some parties even termed promise as a bribe for voters.

But, should vaccine distribution be used as an election campaign promise? If Free Vaccine is the need, shouldn't it be extended to all states? In a diverse income country, should vaccine be made free for all?

On one hand, RJD’s Syed Faisal Ali says ‘The BJP is trying to fool the voters of #Bihar. This is a desperate attempt to regain their lost ground: RJD's Syed Faisal Ali’.

While on another hand Congress; Dr Shama says ‘The EC should take strict note of this. It is kind of a threat. Secondly, the vaccination is on a trial stage so isn't this a false promise? And why free vaccine only for Bihar? This shows that this is an election gimmick’

Watch!

#BiharElection2020 #BiharPoll #BJPBihar

snippet.title: Are State governments allowed to challenge Centre’s Farm Law Bills? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss if opposition parties can challenge the Centre’s Farm Laws and make amendments to the same.
The three Farm Laws passed by the Centre have created an uproar all over India. Farmers and opposition alike are protesting against the laws. 
Punjab Chief Minister, Captain Amarinder Singh initially protested against the laws and has now passed three of their own Farm Bills distinct from the Centre’s. Congress has claimed the Bills protect the farmers from the negative impact created by the Centre’s Bills. 
Following Punjab, Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, and Maharashtra are now all looking into producing their own Bills. 
Avik Saha, Convenor of Jai Kisan Andolan, commented that fundamentally, the states are asking how the Centre is making laws of farmers, farming and agriculture as these are state subjects. He says, after all, if things becomes bad, the state governments will have to face the consequences. 
Congress’ National Media Panelist, Aman Panwar said that the consultation process was completely absent in the laws brought in by the Centre. He further said that they had brought in these acts in consultation with the farmers after understanding what they need.

#FarmBills #CentreVsOpposition

snippet.title: Is Joblessness the biggest election issue in Bihar? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the current state of employment in Bihar and their role in the coming Assembly Elections. 
While it is always witnessed that in states like Bihar, corruption, law and order, and caste based politics are some of the favourite topics while campaigning, there seems to be a difference this time. 
Most parties have opened dialogue of unemployment in the state and made several promises to provide better opportunities. It is important to note that Bihar contributes to 15 lakh migrants leaving the state in lieu of jobs. The question remains, has this contributed to making it the number one issue of the Election?The Coronavirus pandemic has only added to the issue of unemployment. RJD’s Tejashwi Yadav has promised 10 lakh jobs to the people. BJP and JDU have mocked the promise, questioning its validity. 
Sarika Paswan, Spokesperson for RJD commented on the same and said 4.5 lakhs job already exist as government jobs in Bihar which can easily be given. She further states that remaining 5.5 lakh jobs are also related to these. According to her, 10 lakh vacancies exist right now for doctors, engineers, teachers and more. 
Anshul Avijit from the Indian National Congress stated that the number of youth unemployed in Bihar is more than 30%, which is a critical figure. This, he says, will determine the course of the election. He further adds, that the party has got good growth rate and growth creates jobs. 

#BiharElections2020 #UnemploymentInBihar

snippet.title: Can Muralitharan, Vijay Sethupathi be blamed for giving up artistic freedom? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss Vijay Sethupathi’s decision of backing off from Muttiah Muralitharan’s biopic ‘800’. 

The recent controversy that sparked over Muttiah Muralitharan’s biopic 800 has now resulted in the actor backing off from the project. Before quitting, the actor had tweeted that he will not be backing off from the film but when Muttiah Muralitharan, himself, requested the actor to quit for his career’s sake, Vijay Sethupathi replied ‘vanakam’. 

The trolls have successfully butchered artistic freedom by severely criticising a great Sri Lankan cricketer and Tamilian actor. 

The backlash originated from people reflecting on Muttiah Muralitharan’s views on the 2009 genocide against Tamilians. To this Narayan Lakshman, Associate Editor of The Hindu, has questioned, "Are the same people objecting to Vijay Sethupathi playing this role, demanding that internally displaced Tamils in Sri Lanka be rehabilitated? Are you so dedicated to the cause or are you picking this because he's an easy target?”

Film Producer, Dr. G. Dhananjayan has stated that the main issue lies in the fact that a popular actor is seen as playing and endorsing Muttiah Muralitharan, a person considered to be anti-Tamil or betrayer of the cause.

snippet.title: MP's crass politics continues, Will political parties penalise Sexist Netas? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the never-changing sexism plaguing the Indian politics. 

Kamal Nath, former Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh, recently called his former cabinet colleague Imarti Devi as ‘an item’. Furthermore, he has refused to apologise for the same, claiming that he never meant to offend anyone and ‘item’ is not even a derogatory word. 

On the other hand, a BJP Minister, Bisahulal Singh has questioned Vishwanath Singh’s first wife whereabouts, while calling his second wife a mistress. 

BJP to condemn Kamal Nath on his comment held protests and wore masks made out of his face while dancing like item girls, sporting lehengas. This idea of protest is yet another insult to women all over. 

When questioned the validity of this protest, Charu Pragya from BJP said, “Kamal Nath justified the word ‘item.’ My party workers were trying to show how offensive that word is.” 

Advocate Trisha Shetty, says that we need to focus on shaming the sexist politicians publicly and asking political parties what punitive action is being taken. She further states if someone made such a remark on a male politician, there would definitely be violence.

#SexismInPolitics #KamalNath

snippet.title: Shouldn’t citizens deserve better than political candidates with criminal cases? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the recent data released by ADR on the criminal background of the candidates contesting in the Bihar elections. 

Over a thousand political candidates were analysed by ADR and the numbers have been dispiriting. The number one party with the most number of criminal cases is RJD. 54% of their candidates, i.e. 22 candidates who were given tickets to contest in Phase 1 have criminal cases against them. LJP who has recently split with the NDA contests second with 49%, 20 candidates, having criminal cases. BJP witnesses 45% of their candidates having serious criminal cases. Congress, although has far fewer seats comparatively has not fallen behind with 43% of its candidates having criminal cases. Lastly, JDU has allotted 29% of its tickets to candidates have criminal cases. 

Jagdeep Chhokar, from ADR, speaks on the matter. He says that although the Supreme Court made it mandatory for political parties to upload on their websites the detailed information of candidates with pending criminal cases, only one party has followed the norm. 

Neerja Chowdhury, a Senior Journalist, says that political parties are a law unto themselves. “There is no political will to bring about a change… Unless the voters of India say enough is enough, nothing will change,” she says.

#CriminalNetasOfBihar #BiharElections2020

snippet.title: COVID-19 protocols violations during festivals, PM Modi's message a warning? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we talk about the Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s warning to the Nation just ahead of the festive season. 

The PM in his address urges people to continue wearing masks and not be reckless during these testing times. He goes on to say that if people stop wearing masks they are not only putting themselves at risk but also the lives of their family members, including kids and adults.

The coming festive season is a make or break fight against the virus. As noticed in other countries after a decline, a sudden surge cannot be ruled out and with people being negligent it becomes far more dangerous.

Dr Mahesh Chandra Misra, Former Director, AIIMS speaks on the same. He says that it has been witnessed through Sero Surveys that 30% of people are carrying antibodies. This confirms the notion of community spread. He further states that if people do not take their health in their own hands, they cannot blame the government, doctors or hospitals. 

Dr Shashank Joshi, DEAN Indian College of Physicians, Lilavati Hospital and Member, Covid-19 Task Force, says that in the name of festivities, one cannot over socialise and get into a doomsday situation. “We have just started bending our graph and if this continues, by the time vaccine is around, we'll be looking at a much better India,” he continues. 

#PMModiSpeech #COVID19

snippet.title: Will the festive season worsen Covid-19 pandemic in India? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Centre’s biggest coronavirus concern currently. As the festive season kicks off in most parts of the country, what cannot be forgotten is that Covid-19 still exists endangering the lives of people.
A government appointed scientific panel has released a study report on Covid-19. Tanvi Shukla reports the key findings of the report. 
Some of them include that the lockdown did help in saving lives; Covid-19 peaked in September and is a good news; winter might increase the spread; pandemic might end by February 2021 and that lockdown cannot be continued even though the pandemic still exists. 
Mirror Now reporters present the hustle and bustle from various states across the nation during the festive season ignoring the pandemic guidelines. 
Dr. Samir Dalwai, NCP and Developmental Paediatrician, says that many children and adults are experiencing anxiety which is bound to make them go out and make living indoors difficult. He further goes on to say that viruses stay for thousands of years.
Tanwi Das, Political Analyst comments on the festive season and comments that the socio-economic structure depends on the festive season in Bengal. If the annual source of income is cut off, she says, they will starve to death before Covid. So Durga Puja cannot be stopped. 
#Covid-19 #FestiveSeason

snippet.title: Is India firmly on the path of COVID-19 recovery? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the weekend edition of Urban Debate with Afrida Rahman Ali, Government has appointed 10 members panel which has released its report on the progression of the COVID-19 pandemic in India. It also talks about the prognosis and lockdown impacts. Take a look at the 10 important findings that this report talks about. 

The member of COVID-19 Taskforce in Maharashtra, Dr Shashank Joshi on Government's COVID report says that the report says that pandemic will end by February 2021, I don't think anybody can make such predictions. Retrospective part I accept, prospective part I don't.

Mirror Now questions the Director of the Centre for Cellular and Molecular Biology, Dr Rakesh Mishra on the COVID report, asks "The report says February 2021, we'll be out of the pandemic. How do you see this particular finding, especially when we don't have a vaccine yet?"

Watch!

snippet.title: Is politics over Muttiah Muralitharan’s biopic justified? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the recent controversy surrounding Muttiah Muralitharan’s biopic 800. Tamil Nadu’s famous star Vijay Sethupathi who is going to play Muttiah in the biopic, is also receiving backlash for the same. 

The backlash for the biopic stems from the cricketer’s views on the 2009 killings against Tamilians. According to the protestors, Muttiah Muralitharan’s comments were in favour of the accused, who were held responsible for the killings. This has led to many people from the industry and netizens on Twitter asking Vijay Sethupathi to drop out from the film. 

Narayan Lakshman, Associate Editor of The Hindu, commented on the following. This is Tamil chauvinism, he said. He also continued to say that this is fuelled by election pressure, and is the shortest route to curb artistic freedom. 
Kasthuri Shankar, an actor, commented in support of Vijay Sethupathi. She said, “Let's not fool ourselves that this is only the question of artistic freedom. I am an artist and I  completely support and trust Vijay Sethupathi’s judgement about the movie.

#MuttiahMuralitharan #VijaySethupathi

snippet.title: Ballia murder case sparks controversy; Is the UP Police trying to shield accused? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Ballia murder case. A man murdered in front of the SDM and other police officials, raises the question whether having political patronage allows you to kill someone?
A dispute for allocation of a ration shop got so ugly that it resulted in a man being murdered in the presence of top officials and yet there was no arrest made. 
After a massive rise in the number of cases in UP and the administration and officials being under constant scrutiny, it seems there is no law and order in the state. 
Sharat Pradhan, Senior Journalist, has commented on the government. He stated that the officials went out of their way to indirectly protect the accused and still claim their law and order is better than most states in the country. 
Samajwadi party’s Ghanshyam Tiwari has stated that the government has turned Uttar Pradesh into a lawless land. People sitting on the lap of criminals cannot construct ‘Ram Rajya’, he said. Instead they can constructs arguments of ‘Ram Rajya’, he continued. 

#BalliMurder #UPPolice

snippet.title: Should Supreme Court take severe actions against Delhi government for pollution? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Delhi government’s ignorance as the pollution spikes again. The government’s lack of efforts for the same despite Supreme Court issuing over hundred orders raises the question of whether the SC should take actions against the officials involved? 
Years after facing the same problem and seeing no improvement in the matter, we discuss how can we fix the problem. 
A petitioner, Aditya Dubey, states that the main cause of pollution in Delhi is stubble burning. He goes on to say that even after years of facing the same problem, the government has not done anything. Covid-19 crisis will further aggravate and something has to be done otherwise many might die. 
To this, BJP spokesperson, Raman Malik says, "Environment Minister has stated that 95% of pollution in Delhi comes from Delhi itself & 5% comes from stubble burning. It is one of the many reasons.”

#DelhiPollution #DelhiChokes

snippet.title: Gupkar Declaration EXPLAINED; What could be the future of Jammu & Kashmir? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Gupkar Declaration. A day after Mehbooba Mufti was released, National Conference president Farooq Abdullah called for a meeting of the signatories to the 'Gupkar Declaration'. What's Gupkar Declaration & "Politically, what could be the future of Jammu and Kashmir?"

It is a positive step of the mainstream to have a point of view & convey the feelings and aspirations of the people, & also ask for peace in the region says, Dr Sameer Kaul. We are sure that we'll get back what was snatched from us illegally through the constitutional mechanism that exists. Just because the government has done it, doesn't necessarily put me under a binding to agree to it says S.S Bukhari. 

A lot of the stuff which was being done is illegal. The removal of Article 370 was done by sleight of hand. It was done, neither by the State Assembly nor by any kind of consultation by the people says Manoj Joshi. 

 #Article370  #GupkarDeclaration #JammuAndKashmir

snippet.title: Chennai: Preachers' dirty chat with minors OUT; Why was scripture union silent? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the unholy secrets where Preachers' dirty chat with minors are out. 2 members of Scripture Union, an international Christian organisation have been booked for sexual harassment in Chennai. Why was scripture union silent for over 2 months? More details & questions have arisen such as, "Why do we always have a case where the system drags its feet when it comes to the matters of religion?

Once a crime has been committed, perpetrators have to be given an opportunity. We were monitoring them & had refrained them into entering into schools. Thereafter, we set up a committee & suspended them says Praveen Alexander, Lawyer representing Scripture Union. 

In most religious organizations, only when the issue comes out, they scramble with we did this & that. They don't take the proper legal system to take action against the perpetrators. The system is very complacent in these cases says Advocate, Sandhya Raju George.

#Chennai #ScriptureUnion #SexualHarassment

snippet.title: Hyderabad Floods: Reasons that show Government failed in preparing better | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Hyderabad witnesses unprecedented rainfall in the last few days. It has broken the record of the past 100 years. Over 33 people have died in Telangana after rain & flood wreaked havoc. Mirror Now shares 5 reasons for flooding that show how governments failed in preparing better. 

Architect & Urban Designer Srinivas Murthy says that the problem to this kind of a situation is about those hundreds of lakes which were connected by water channels in the past & those, which typically lie in the valley areas now encroach upon the buildings.

snippet.title: Delhi fights pollution amid COVID; Is the national capital living hell for people?| The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the rising pollution in Delhi and the poor air quality amid COVID. As winters are approaching, poor air quality along with COVID is posing a serious threat to the citizens in the National Capital. Experts have warned that COVID cases may spike in winter. Has the Delhi govt failed once again?

snippet.title: Under-age driving in Delhi snuffs out two live, Taking risk for joy ride? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Horrifying story from the National Capital Delhi. A 17-year-old took his uncle's car and went for a joy ride. Later a family of 6 little children were out on the street doing their normal activities, while they were crossing a road,  gets run over by 17-year-old teenager driving a car. 

An 8-year-old and a 5-year-old were mouths down along with their uncle and their 6-year-old brother. The brother condition is serious, the 6-year-old child is now fighting for his life at the AIIMS trauma centre. 

The teenager driving uncle's car is been picked up by the police and they are now trying to figure out whether his parents should be held accountable or his uncle or the legal guardian the case of a juvenile. 

#Hit&Run

snippet.title: Are Governor's across States getting too politically involved? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla speaks about the increasing politicization that is happening in in our Raj Bhawan. A massive political dispute erupted between Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray and Governor Bhagat Singh Koshiyari after the demand and protest outrage for re-opening of temples surged.

Governor Koshiyari wrote a letter to CM Uddhav primarily to request the re-opening of temples in Maharashtra, however, he further stated that ‘You have been a strong votary of Hindutva. You suddenly turned secular, a term you hated’.

Are Governor's across States getting too politically involved? Do you believe that there's an increasing political interference by the Governors who essentially hold a constitutional post?

Senior Journalist Ashutosh says, ‘In my opinion, the post of the governor should be abolished and the Chief Minister should run the administration, good or bad’. Whereas BJP’s Sudesh Verma says, ‘The way Pawar has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi, this shows that they just want to politicise. If at all, he should have written to the President of India’.

WATCH!

#MahaCMVSGovernor #CMVSGovernor #TempleProtests

snippet.title: Tanishq Jewellery withdraws ad on religious unity;Brands held hostage by brigade?| The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla today, we discuss the withdrawal of Tanishq Jewellery's ad on religious unity. Tanishq's Ad about interfaith unity faces backlash; coloured as 'love jihad' by section of trolls. The ad was withdrawn after online bigot bullies strike. Are brands being held hostage by the boycott brigade?

Tanishq has always taken up social causes. I feel extremely sorry that they buckled under the pressure & withdrew the ad. I wish the way they had stuck to their guns says, Nandita Chalam, Former Senior VP & ECD, JWT.

Social media & the rise of right-wing politics tries to see something harsh everywhere. Having said that, let's see that it's a social responsibility to promote brands & not just brands' responsibility to promote social values says, Madhavan Narayan. 

Watch!

#Tanishq #Tata #TanishqAd  #BoycottTanishq

snippet.title: Metro car shed moved from Aarey Colony; Is this pro-environment move or politics? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Afrida Rahman Ali, we discuss the controversial reversal of moving Metro car shed that was moved out of Aarey in Mumbai. 

The previous BJP administration’s decision to situate the Metro Car Shed in Aarey Colony has been categorically reversed by the Maharashtra Chief Minister, Udhav Thackeray and will now be placed in Kanjurmarg. 

The green decision to protect the lungs of the city comes as a major relief since massive protests broke out after the BJP government’s decision. 

The question, however, remains, that whether this was a right decision taken by the government or was it just a political move?

Zoru Bhathena, an Environmentalist commented on the decision saying the shift of the Metro car shed from Aarey to Kanjurmarg is a win-win situation for Mumbai. He added that the decision was initially taken by the Devendra Fadnavis government back in 2015 and is finally being implemented. Existing lines are being integrated, he said. 

Devyani Kaushik fro BJP spoke against the decision. She declared that this is an unfortunate decision which will increase the project cost by 4,000 crores rupees. In addition to this, she added, that the Kanjurmarg land has various issues. She further stated that without paying the government anyone will be able to claim the land tomorrow.

#MetroCarShed #AareyColony

snippet.title: 12-year-old raped & brutally thrashed; When will women be safe in India? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Afrida Rahman Ali, we discuss the outrage in Tamil Nadu happening over an acquittal of a 17 year old man accused of rape and murder. 
A 12 year old young girl was brutally raped and then murdered with multiple injuries all over her body. The boy was arrested by the police from the same locality for allegedly raping the girl who was found dead at her home. 
The boy was then lodged in a home for children which goes against the law. The girl was electrocuted to death by an electric wire that was shoved in her mouth and nose. 
The Sessions Judge, in its verdict on Tuesday announced that the prosecution failed to build a case and was unable to prove the charges against the boy.
Following the acquittal, major outrage has broken over the state raising question on the investigation and the criminal justice system. 
Pramod Madhav from Mirror Now shed some light on the matter. He states that the mother found her daughter bleeding when she entered the home and nothing could have been done since she was pronounced dead. He also specifies that the village was expecting some relief and justice from the fast track court but to their surprise the court observed lack of evidence as a reason for the acquittal.
#TamilNadu #RapeInIndia

snippet.title: Sudden power cut jolts Mumbaikars, CM orders probe, but What was the reason? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Afrida Rahman Ali, we discuss the recent power cut that took the citizens of Mumbai by surprise today. Almost fifty lakh households of Mumbai experienced a complete cut in power as well as many operational businesses came to a standstill. 

The Suburban railways also came to a sudden halt resulting in many passengers to change their travel routes and plans. The shock came at around 10 am in the morning leaving numerous people in anxiety and disbelief. 

Tensions arose not only for travel and communication but also for Covid-19 care facilities where a constant supply of power was vital for patients. 

However, the power has been restored in almost 95% of the places affected. 

Tune in to listen, Sanjay Thakur, Vice-Chairman of All India Power Engineers Federation explain in detail the reason behind the power cut while talking to Afrida Rahman Ali.

#MumbaiPowerOutage #PowerCutInMumbai

snippet.title: Govt data reveals 165% jump in sedition cases, Is the clause being misused? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Sahar Zaman, we discuss the rise in sedition cases in the past 3 years and its misuse. The sedition law is Section 124 of the IPC. The NCRB figures show a 165% jump in the sedition cases in India. Is the government misusing the sedition clause? Should we continue having this law? Why shouldn't this law be scrapped? Which govt will have the political will to scrap the law? 

Change in society comes through dissent and disagreements. Every right-thinking person must oppose the govt whenever there is an opportunity to do that says Former Chief Information Commissioner, Shailesh Gandhi. For the govt, dissent is sedition. UAPA is being put on anybody & everybody says Congress', Shama Mohamed.
Watch!

#SeditionLaw

snippet.title: Is the country ready to re-open school and enter into a new normal? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Afrida Rahman Ali discusses the pitfalls and the important concerns regarding the reopening of school. In the fifth phase of unlocking, everything has opened up or will be opened up including the gyms, malls and cinema halls as well. But, several states continue to defer the reopening of schools. 

Maharashtra and Gujarat government have said that they will consider reopening of schools after Diwali, Uttar Pradesh government stated that schools for students will reopen for classes 9th-12th, from Oct 19th, while the other states have still not decided on this issue. But the real question is, whether our schools are ready for this new normal that we are stepping into?
To discuss the same, Afrida is joined by Dr Tanmay Mahapatra, Anubha Sahai, Samir Dalwai and Gurumurthy Kasinathan. Gurumurthy Kasinathan states that the solution doesn't lie in opening schools closed or open entirely. The decision is with the states and the districts. Samir Dalwai states that a decision has to be taken at a district-level based on certain parameters. The number of new cases in the district has to be decreasing in the preceding 2 weeks, and the case positivity rate should be less than 5%.

localized.title: Is the country ready to re-open school and enter into a new normal? | The Urban Debate
localized.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Afrida Rahman Ali discusses the pitfalls and the important concerns regarding the reopening of school. In the fifth phase of unlocking, everything has opened up or will be opened up including the gyms, malls and cinema halls as well. But, several states continue to defer the reopening of schools. 

Maharashtra and Gujarat government have said that they will consider reopening of schools after Diwali, Uttar Pradesh government stated that schools for students will reopen for classes 9th-12th, from Oct 19th, while the other states have still not decided on this issue. But the real question is, whether our schools are ready for this new normal that we are stepping into?
To discuss the same, Afrida is joined by Dr Tanmay Mahapatra, Anubha Sahai, Samir Dalwai and Gurumurthy Kasinathan. Gurumurthy Kasinathan states that the solution doesn't lie in opening schools closed or open entirely. The decision is with the states and the districts. Samir Dalwai states that a decision has to be taken at a district-level based on certain parameters. The number of new cases in the district has to be decreasing in the preceding 2 weeks, and the case positivity rate should be less than 5%.

snippet.title: How is COVID-19 affecting our Mental Health? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On a special edition of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla discusses a topic which is still considered as a taboo in many parts of the country. As we celebrate International Mental Health Day, the entire world witnessed mental health as one of the biggest challenges amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Tanvi Shukla also takes you through a study which was carried on COVID-19 blues. Is there still a lack of awareness in a large percentage of our organizations as to how they should be taking care of their employees?

‘The pandemic has brought about a whole different dimension of mental health, related issues & disorders. There has been an increasing sense of anxiety. Due to decrease in social interaction, sense of feeling isolated & stressed has increased’ says Psychotherapist Dr Ruksheda.

Whereas, Mental Health Expert Dr Prakriti explains the difference between a psychologist, therapist, counsellor, psychiatrist and who should one approach for when seeking help. 

Watch!

#WorldMentalHealthDay #MentalHealth #COVID19

snippet.title: Will the Sarod legacy be kept alive as Maestro Amjad Ali Khan turns 75? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Legend Ustad Amjad Ali Khan who has been awarded Padmabhushan in 2001, joins Tanvi Shukla. A great musician who did his first recital when he was a 6-year-old. He has performed at the United Nations, House of Commons, and in every single part of this world. In a glorious career that spans over decades, Ustad Amjad Ali Khan has won millions of hearts and have taken an instrument like Sarod across the world and made it popular. 

“Our wealth is our culture and music. We want to hand over this. I hope this eight generation of my family realizes their responsibility,” says Wah Ustad! Sarod Legend Amjad Ali Khan to Mirror Now.

snippet.title: 10 reasons why RBI is optimistic on economic revival | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Today the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) after holding it's bi-annual monetary policy review came out and gave an exhaustive briefing on what was discussed and what's its view is on the series of issues. 

The Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) newly-appointed Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), on Friday, voted unanimously to keep key rates unchanged. Despite keeping status quo on rates, RBI delivered a lot more especially to soothe the nervous bond markets. Benchmark 10 year yield eased to five-week low and cooled off around 8bps to 5.93% intraday. 

Prabir Jha People Advisory HR strategist and Founder & CEO Prabir Jha say that we will need to watch the second half of this fiscal to be able to see if this is something that will cut across sectors, scale, and companies that even have a global consumer base.

Watch!

snippet.title: Delhi's COVID-19 battle intensifies;Will winter season add to the existing crisis? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss if the winter season may add onto the Covid-19 challenge. The Centre for Disease Control and NITI Aayog has issued a warning to groups that are vulnerable who can be severely affected in the coming winters.
The pollution and smog in the northern parts of the country, especially Delhi may get massively affected according to Dr. Mahesh Chandra Misra, Former Director of AIIMS. To combat this he said, “People can use one thin cloth mask, and a mask on top of it. This will prevent them from pollution and Covid-19.” 
When asked whether the pollution or the cold temperatures will affect our respiratory problems more, Dr. Shashank Joshi, DEAN Indian College of Physicians, Lilavati Hospital and Member, Covid-19 Task Force, replied that its the people’s irresponsibility. He said, “The biggest challenge that we have is that as we are unlocking people are behaving irresponsibly.” He added that even though there has not been a relationship between cold and Covid-19, the same may not be true for India, since we are a tropical country.
#Covid-19 #CovidInIndia

snippet.title: Fake TRP scam busted by Mumbai Police, Viewers & advertisers cheated? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Fake Television Rating Point (TRP) busted by the Mumbai Police. 4 people have been arrested and a news briefing that was held by the Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh. 3 channels, Box Cinema, Fakth Marathi, and Republic TV which is run by Arnab Goswami were named by the Mumbai Police Commissioner. 

exchange4media Group and BWorldOnline  Chairman & Editor in Chief Anurag Batra say that Advertisers, brands and media agencies have to go beyond ratings. They have to look at the quality of content, credibility and balance. 

In a view, Mirror Now Managing Editor Vinay Tewari says, “It is important for quality to be considered. It cannot be a numbers game. This has lowered the level of discourse and information that is supposed to be supplied by us honourably and with integrity.”

#RepublicFarziRatings #FakeTRP #TRPFraud #ParambirSingh #RepublicTRPFraud

snippet.title: Has the Fake-TRP Scandal of Republic TV exposed the worst secrets of Indian Media? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we talk about the Fake TRP Scam that has been exposed by the Mumbai Police. The Commissioner of Mumbai Police, Param Bir Singh, while briefing the media announced that a suspicious pattern was noticed in the viewership of certain channels.

While investigating, it was discovered that confidential data about the placement of barometers were given to these channels. The channels then bribed the households to watch their channels the entire day to jack up the TRPs which would then result in higher advertising revenues. 

Vinay Tewari, Managing Editor, Mirror Now, commented on the scandal. “We have seen multiple cases where channels have covered stories in a most irresponsible manner possible, by showing off numbers to back their claim. Now it seems, as the Mumbai Police are alleging, a lot of it is basis kind of fraud,” he said. 

Prahlad Kakar, Advertising Guru commented, “The reportage of most channels today is so loud, they have lost credibility. It’s become entertainment, & no longer news. Advertisers would supposedly want to advertise on whichever channel has most eyeballs and tamasha”. 

Anurag Batra, Chairman and Editor-In-Chief B World Online, and Exchange 4 Media group said, “Advertisers, brands and media agencies have to go beyond ratings. They have to look at quality of content, credibility and balance”.

#FakeTRPScandal #RepublicTV

snippet.title: Massive crackdown on child pornography; Is social media really a safe space? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, A shocking incident that was reported from Kerala where the state police have busted a child pornography racket. Not only has the team made a huge number of arrests, 41 people including IT professionals have been arrested for allegedly sharing sexually explicit content involving children through social media. 

Brijesh B Singh, IG Maharashtra explains that social media has become a breeding ground for pedophiles, people who share infringing images. Under POCSO, anyone who comes to know of such material should report it under Section 4.

The accused were allegedly circulating the material using chatting platforms such as WhatsApp, Telegram Messenger, and using encrypted handles. The Kerala police have seized multiple evidence in the form of 285 different devices such as laptops, modems, hard discs, mobile phones, memory cards, and other electronic types of equipment. 

Ritesh Bhatia, Cyber Security Expert explains that on the dark web there are kids as young as 6-year-olds who are saying that they are ready to do a show and quoting an amount. 

The police also suspect that the case is not just a child pornography racket but as chats have been scrutinised, also indicates child trafficking.

snippet.title: Rhea Chakraborty granted bail; Are celebrities an easy target for witch hunt? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, as Rhea Chakraborty gets relief from Narcotics Control Bureau, it is stated that she was had not participated in the procurement of drugs. Many have now claimed witch-hunt pertaining to the different narratives that are now set in the Sushant Singh Rajput death case. AIIMS forensic report ruled out murder and foul play, whereas Sushant Singh Rajput's family lawyer has now asked for a fresh new probe in the case. Geeta Luthra, a senior advocate in the Supreme Court states that the question is, would the rule of law not be the same for everyone? She further adds that the Supreme Court itself has said that criminal cases of MLAs and MPs gave to have special benches.

KV Sridhar, Ad Guru, explains that it is up to individual celebrities to draw a line between what is legal and what is moral. He further adds that it is very difficult to not destroy yourself if you put a foot on the wrong side of the law. 

Nupur Mehta, an actor questions if it is concerning when the law-enforcement agencies believe that film actors need to be treated differently?

'To even have the conversation that because you’re a celebrity, we’re going to hold you to a different standard and you’ll have to pay more dearly than other people is ridiculous', says  Sucharita Tyagi, Film Critic.

snippet.title: SC on Right to Protest in Shaheen Bagh; How will it impact the future protests? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, amidst the various debates, the Shaheen Bagh case has now come forward with a lot of many revelations. Supreme Court's verdict on Shaheen Bagh protests that are held in the public domain is the most questionable debate. 

Shaheen Bagh emerged as the centre of CAA-NRC protests during December 2019. Not only was it recognized nationally but internationally too. Anjali Bhardwaj, a social activist states that the court has upheld the right to protest. 

She further affs that it has said that protests should be in designated spaces. Unfortunately, there has been a huge shrinking of space where people can come out and put forth their points of view. 

Sudesh, a BJP spokesperson explains that there is a way by which one can disown the government, he further explains that one can mobilise public opinion. 

When elections come, one can throw out the government, but one cannot say what they are doing is correct and what the other party is doing is wrong.

'Social issues are the remedy and cause of the protest and administrative issues ensure that the larger citizenry is not impacted. Both have to go hand in hand,' says Sidharth Luthra, Former Additional Solicitor General.

snippet.title: Bihar elections: JDU-NDA alliance gets strong; LGP nudged out | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses the Bihar elections, which are just around the corner. Days ahead of Bihar elections, the NDA has announced its seat-sharing formula. LJP has given its decision of contesting the elections without any alliance in Bihar. While the LJP still backs BJP, but the LJP doesn't want to fight alongside the JDU. Janta United Dal will contest for 122 seats and BJP will be contesting for 121 seats and the remaining will be taken by the H.A.M from JD(U). 

The BJP has meanwhile made it very clear that anybody who wants to be part of the alliance has to recognize that it is Nitish Kumar who is going to be the part of leadership and their face.
Furthermore, preparations for elections have also begun in Tamil Nadu as well and there has been a massive rift within the AIADMK, about who the next CM candidate is going to be. A hectic meeting takes place just a day before the party is said to announce who is going to be the face for CM for the elections.

Furthermore, preparations for elections have also begun in Tamil Nadu as well and there has been a massive rift within the AIADMK, about who the next CM candidate is going to be. A hectic meeting takes place just a day before the party is said to announce who is going to be the face for CM for the elections.

snippet.title: Mumbai Police’s BIG disclosures on social media; Is the threat real? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about one of the most pertinent and persistent problems, especially in this day and age and that is social media, which has become a weapon, Uttar Pradesh police and government have claimed that the Hathras case is being used in order to bring disharmony in the state of Uttar Pradesh. Posters have been shared online, fake news and protests have been called, all with the help of social media. Similar is the case in Maharashtra in connection to the Sushant Singh Rajput case. After the AIIMS panel ruled out murder, Mumbai police has begun its operation to mull down the fake news that was maligning the image of the Mumbai Police.

The Maharashtra government has now come out and said that there was a larger conspiracy to defame the Mumbai Police and the government. The Mumbai police are probing nearly 80,000 social media accounts, belonging to people from different countries and are fake, as per Mumbai police. They further add that 80,000 fake social media handles were created around that story in order to discredit the Mumbai Police. The governments now repeatedly blame the social media for a coordinated large attempt to target the government.

snippet.title: US Elections 2020: Who is dominating the race to the White House? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about another country which is dealing with a lot of fake news and ideological differences apart from India and that is the United States of America. It has become crucial for them at this particular point as they are heading into a big election and U.S President Donald Trump has tested positive for COVID-19, just weeks ahead of the big elections. It is not just Donald Trump but many in his entire team, his close aides, all ended up getting infected. 

To discuss how the things are shaping up as Donald Trump recovers and is getting back to work, Jacqueline Alemany, Political reporter with the Washington Post joins Tanvi Shukla. Jacqueline states that with Donald Trump testing positive, his ground campaigns were put to a halt, but, according to Donald Trump, he is planning to travel soon but much of his campaign staff has been affected with the virus. 

Jacqueline Alemany states that the president would have protected himself better if he would have worn a mask and maintained social distancing, instead he continued to shake hands and has been in close proximity.

snippet.title: Hathras gangrape case: Is women safety as important as a conspiracy for UP govt? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the Hathras case as the spotlight remains to be on that case. The story began with a brutal assault of a 19-year-old Dalit girl by 4 upper caste men and was left paralyzed. The girl succumbed to her injuries and died in Delhi while she was being treated. Ever since the incident, there have been multiple theories that have come up and are revolving around this case, and the one which has gathered most eyeballs is how the Hathras case is being used to defame Uttar Pradesh and to create a situation of disharmony in the state. The centre of attention, in this case, has now become the conspiracy that the Yogi Adityanath government alleges. UP Police has filed 22 FIRs and is a statewide crackdown. Tanvi Shukla on today’s debate asks some important questions related to the Uttar Pradesh police and the different course of actions they take up in different cases. While the Uttar Pradesh police have filed 22 FIRs, and in such a short span of time, where does this quickness go when crime against women are reported. 

Tanvi Shukla is joined by BJP spokesperson Sameer Singh from Uttar Pradesh, Kirubamunuswamy, Saira Shah Halim, Meeran Borwankar and Gautam Mukherjee. Kirubamunuswamy tells Tanvi Shukla that U.P is well known for caste, panchayats, which do not only allow honour killings but also order gangrape of women if they violate social norms. Gautam Mukherjee adds to this and states that in a country of 1.4 Bn people, it is expected that statistically there will be a lot of rapes. But, by committing such horrendous crime, how do these people get away with it?

snippet.title: Is Hathras probe getting derailed? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, A 19-year-old was brutally assaulted, fought for her life for 2 weeks and then she died. She wasn't even given a proper funeral. This injustice cannot be for goddard. The truth of this case has to come out. 

Mirror Now asks BJP's National Spokesperson Anila Singh on the Hathras horror says, "Why is everything more important to the Uttar Pradesh Police and the government right now than finding out who took away that young girl’s life?"

AMU, President of RDA at Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Dr Hamza Malik says that If the sample is collected within 96 hours, sperm can be detected in it. Absence of sperm does not mean there was no rape. The definition of rape has been expanded after the Nirbhaya case.

snippet.title: Sushant Singh death probe: Top conspiracy theories busted | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the status of the Sushant Singh Rajput case. A hundred and fourteen days later, and after the AIIMS report, we discuss the five big facts on Sushant Singh Rajput probe. 

The AIIMS report has repudiated the murder conspiracy and ruled it out as suicide. Satish Maneshinde, Rhea Chakraborty’s lawyer has stated that the Mumbai Police had also reached a conclusion after the Cooper Hospital’s toxicology report that there was no foul play involved. He went ahead to say, “I would beseech all those who are jumping to conclusions, to come to rest & wait for the CBI to make a declaration and file a report before the Court of law”. 

Sanjay Hegde, a senior Supreme Court Advocate, commented on the entire case by stating, “Sushant Singh Rajput had had a history of mental illness, there were fights over his treatment, things had not gone well at that stage in his career. He committed suicide. It has been blown up. The drama must now end”. 

Geeta Luthra, Senior Advocate Supreme Court, on the other hand, states that “The fact that Rhea Chakraborty was not with Sushant Singh Rajput for the last 4-5 days, in its own way takes away the theory of abetment to suicide”. 

MN Singh, Former Commissioner of Police, Mumbai expresses his dejection over the case. He states, “It is very unfortunate that while the case was being investigated, the media made all kinds of insinuations against various types of people and created a campaign to malign the Mumbai Police.” 
#SushantSinghRajput #RheaChakraborty

snippet.description:
Election season is setting in and as individual parties prepare individuals to big camps and alliances figure out their strategy, something interesting has happened in the last couple of days. Not surprising because there was a built-up to the Lok Janshakti Party (LJP).

snippet.title: UP Govt files FIR for inciting caste violence in Hathras; Attempt to save face? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On this edition of The Urban Debate Weekend, we discuss the Hathras gangrape case and the Uttar Pradesh Government's decision to file an FIR for inciting caste-based violence against unnamed persons. This FIR also comes close to the decision of the Yogi Adityanath led the government's decision to call for a CBI inquiry.

If we go through the timeline of the investigation; we can see a hasty cremation of the victim, to begin with, opposition leaders like Rahul Gandhi & other leaders being heckled and blocked from Hathras and now this alleged attempt by the Uttar Pradesh government to save face. Is the probe on the right track? Is there any hope of justice to be served to the victim?

On the panel, we have Former DGP of Uttar Pradesh VN Rai, BJP Spokesperson Manish Shukla, Samajwadi Party Spokesperson Juhi Singh and Congress Spokesperson Aishwarya Mahadev to debate on the UP government's move in the Hathras gangrape horror.

snippet.title: Politicians unite with citizens for Hathras rape victim, propaganda or concern? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the case that has shaken the nation to its core, i.e. Hathras gang-rape case. The Hathras gang rape case has not only sparked outrage because of the brutality that was committed by those four upper caste men on a Dalit girl, but also what followed after it. The Uttar Pradesh police did not file an FIR initially and the one that was filed did not have any MLC test report in it. The matter was further aggravated when the U.P police cremated the victim’s body in the absence of the family and have restricted their movement from thereon. U.P police have also denied entry to the media and political leaders.  But the questions that persist are why U.P police intimidating the family, are they trying to pressurize the family? Have the phones of family members taken away? Why is the media denied doing its job?

The panel on Urban Debate includes the spokespersons from national parties because it is they who should be answerable as well, given that they are showing due interest in this issue. But it is important to find out if their interest is because of their own political motifs or are they genuinely concerned, because even as Congress, Samajwadi Party continue to take on their rival BJP, none of them brought substantial reforms in the policing of the states.

snippet.title: Hathras Case: What is the UP government trying to hide? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the main issue that is haunting the nation today. There is no transparency about the probe carried on by STI and the government. No questions are being answered by the authorities while the nation remains stranded. 
The officials have blocked all the roads to the village and have laid seize on Hathras. The family is not allowed to talk to the media and is practically being held hostage. The eagerness of the UP ADG to dismiss the rape case has outraged everybody. Selective information is being passed on to mislead the media. The UP police are also claiming the entire outrage to be a part of a conspiracy, an evil designed by the media. 
Mirror Now reporter Alok Singh, presents us with the grim picture of Hathras. The entire village is barricaded and no one is allowed entry. 
“Hathras will go down in history as an episode which tells you that brazenness is a part of official statecraft; lack of sensitivity, lack of compassion, complete disregard for norms is now a part of state policy,” Vinay Tewari, Mirror Now Managing Editor, tells Tanvi.
While the former UP DGP, SVM Tripathi comments, “You cannot, at this stage, say that rape was committed or not. At this stage of the investigation, it may have been much better for anybody not to have given a definitive opinion.” To this, Brinda Adige, Women’s Rights Activist retorts, “All the evidence has been wiped out. Even if you call the S.I.T or CBI, there is nothing government can be proven. This is a criminal act by state agencies including the UP government”
#HathrasGangrape #UPPolice

snippet.title: Hathras gangrape case: Is the UP Police pressurising family to change statement? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we take up the misleading stance of UP Government's in the Hathras Gangrape case. A 19-year-old Dalit woman in Uttar Pradesh was gang-raped by four upper-caste men in Hathras District on September 14. The victim succumbed to her injuries in Delhi's Safdarjung hospital. She was left in a pathetic condition with her tongue chopped off and the body paralyzed.

The victim was forcibly cremated by the UP Police midnight at around 2:45 am without her family's consent. Surprisingly, the UP Police made claims that they had the consent of the family which were rebuffed by the girl's father.

BL Vohra, former DGP said not one political party since Independence has thought of doing police reforms. They don’t want to let the control of the police go from their hands, for their own vested interests.

#HathrasGangrapeCase #JusticeForHathrasGangrapeVictim

localized.title: Hathras gangrape case: Is the UP Police pressurising family to change statement? | The Urban Debate
localized.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we take up the misleading stance of UP Government's in the Hathras Gangrape case. A 19-year-old Dalit woman in Uttar Pradesh was gang-raped by four upper-caste men in Hathras District on September 14. The victim succumbed to her injuries in Delhi's Safdarjung hospital. She was left in a pathetic condition with her tongue chopped off and the body paralyzed.

The victim was forcibly cremated by the UP Police midnight at around 2:45 am without her family's consent. Surprisingly, the UP Police made claims that they had the consent of the family which were rebuffed by the girl's father.

BL Vohra, former DGP said not one political party since Independence has thought of doing police reforms. They don’t want to let the control of the police go from their hands, for their own vested interests.

#HathrasGangrapeCase #JusticeForHathrasGangrapeVictim

snippet.title: UP Police cremates Hathras rape victim's body without kin, Will CM Yogi condemn? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the case that has shocked the nation to its very core and has once again made us hang our heads low in shame. A 20- year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh’s Hathras was gang-raped by 4 men and was strangulated. The girl was left paralyzed with her spine broken and was brought to Delhi for treatment after 14 days of this brutal incident that took place with her. Yesterday, that 20-year-old breathed her last.  The girl was violated twice, first by those 4 brutes, who the police didn’t think of arresting immediately, and then by the state police who cremated her forcefully without the will of her family. The dereliction and brutality on the part of the state police are what has caused uproar now. 

The treatment that has been meted out both to the family and the victim, speaks volume about what we have become as a nation and where are we heading to. The treatment that has been done by the police, in order to cover up their lies is horrific in its own different ways. 

Is this the dignity to the dead we talk about? Is this the treatment we talk about when we think of our daughters and girls?
