snippet.title: Nationwide face-off over fee payment; Fair to block education over fee dues? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the dispute between parents and private schools was being discussed, as schools bar students from attending online classes over non-payment of fees. The question as to can schools bar right to education over pending dues was the topic of discussion. Whereas the other perspective given to the debate was that if schools do not collect fees, how will they survive?

Bhavna Sapkal, a parent, says that the situation we are in right now amidst the pandemic, schools do not have any operational charges. The parents are not getting full salaries and some are even jobless. She further adds that schools should be considerate enough to understand the calamity and not ask parents to pay the entire fee amount.

'As far as budget-private schools are concerned, we are down to 50-60 percent of our students, but our operational costs are almost the same as before', says Vikas Jhunjhunwala, Founder and CEO of Sunshine Schools. He also adds that the operational costs are almost the same as before and it is not easy to reduce the fees.

Another parent Amit Hoshing says that parents are ready to pay 50 percent fees even if a school does not start, as a parent, it is difficult to bear the cost of the internet for online classes, electricity costs, and buying a new mobile phone.

snippet.title: Are Social Media giants becoming political tools? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate Today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the big controversy revolving around the social media giant ‘Facebook’. This story came to light after The Wall Street Journal printed out an article stating that the Facebook’s public policy executive in India was opposed to post hate speech rules to specific groups and political parties including the BJP.

Are political parties extensively using and abusing social media giants as political tools to manipulate and influence the voters?

Congress’ Abhishek Dutta says, ‘It is not about BJP winning or losing an election or Congress winning or losing. It is about having a set policy because Facebook is an influencer. Why can't the country formulate a policy to control the hatred? This needs to be addressed’.

While, Author Shivan Singh says, ‘My primary problem is that, right now, we do not know how Facebook & Twitter make the decisions about what should be on the platform and what should not. The Social Media giants need to come out with a clear policy’. The other members on the panel also release some debatable statements.

Watch!

snippet.title: SC refuses to defer NEET-JEE exams; Is it the time to restart education in India? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, as exams are being held amidst the COVID pandemic, the question of safety and students being stressed out was discussed. Conversations over restarting education continues, the Supreme Court has rejected the plea seeking postponement of NEET and JEE exams. The question as to can we pull off this mammoth task and if the exams are conducted via offline mode, can we ensure the safety of the students? Should India look at re-opening the educational institutions?

Sayantan Biswas, Petitioner, Says that the Standard Operating Guidelines can be implemented in examination centres, but questions as to what SOPs can be implemented in the environment. He also says that parents, police, transport workers, and others are involved in the exam process will eventually be at risk. Students want to give exams without being stressed about their lives.

'The Supreme court in its eternal wisdom has spoken about how long we are going to wait to hold examinations' says Aiyshwarya M, Congress, she also questions as to why the Supreme Court is holding virtual meetings?  Some students have to travel for 300-400 kilometres for exams and only two-three percent are in favour of exams being held, says Anubha Sahai, Advocate and President, Indiawide Parents Association.

snippet.title: Extension for Sourav Ganguly & Jay Shah; Is BCCI's national interest valid? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Sourav Ganguly's tenure as BCCI Chief has erupted controversy as questions are raised over his tenure along with Secretary Jay Shah should be prolonged after BCCI filed a petition in the Supreme Court. Is BCCI's national interest argument valid?

Rahul Mehra, a Lawyer, explains that Indian sports have suffered the bane of individuals and it continues to suffer despite Lodha reforms. It is piggybacking on a legend like Sourav Ganguly. BCCI invokes national interests and passions when it suits them.

'If someone has invested his experience at the state level, it should benefit a higher level, if Sourav Ganguly moves from BCCI Chief to ICC Chief, it will add value to everybody around', says Atul Wassan, Former India International Cricketer. Nikhil Chopra, Former India International Cricketer wants his regime to continue because they are doing good for the cricket.

snippet.title: Was Bengaluru's brutal mob attack a planned conspiracy? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Bengaluru riots that have disrupted the peace of the city were being discussed. Bengaluru is now fighting COVID-19 and the brutal vandalism over a social media post.

We always speak about taking the strictest possible actions against the agitators, but if someone takes the law into their hands, certainly they need to be punished for it, says, Brijesg Kalappa, Karnataka Congress. 

Vivel S Reddy, BJP Karnataka says that the government will be initiating a law to seize the properties of the offenders and they will be brought to book. TR Prasad Gowda states that it was Akhanda Srinivasa Murthy's residence where the protest was organized by the Muslim youth. He says that the vibrations of the protest were such that anyone could predict it would go to a bad extent.

TR Prasad Gowda states that it was Akhanda Srinivasa Murthy's residence where the protest was organized by the Muslim youth. He says that the vibrations of the protest were such that anyone could predict it would go to a bad extent.

snippet.title: Privacy VS COVID health safety; Are Kerala & Karnataka police breaching privacy? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Kerala has started the controversial method of COVID-19 tracing and the government has received of flak for the same. Karnataka too has been tracing the call records of its COVID-19 patients. The fact that the government has created Arogya Setu a mobile application that specifically helps in tracing COVID patients, why are state governments resorting to such unethical ways of contact tracing. The question as to who will ensure that call records are not being misused by the police still remains intact.

The government needs to monitor the activities of people and individuals, however, there should not be a feeling of political vendetta in it, says, Vivek Srivastava, CPIM. Shankar M Bidari, Former DGP, Karnataka explains how it is the bounded duty of the state to protect the citizens of the society, this move is in the interest of public safety. Dr. Pavan Duggal, Cyber Law Expert states that such a method is a gross contravention of the fundamental right to privacy of the Constitution of India.

snippet.title: 5 lakh people die due to lack of organ donors; How can citizens help? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, as India celebrates the Organ Donation Day, it is reported that around 5 lakh lives are lost in India due to the unavailability of organs. This Organ Donation Day, we discuss how we can help save lives. Dr. Vasanthi Ramesh, Director of National Organ and Tissue Transplant Organization explains why it is important for every Indian to be part of the organ donation program. 

All the myths need to be busted, there has to be an institutionalised mechanism and hospitals and NGOs need to work together, says, R Sundaram, Senior Journalist. Brajesh Kunwar, Senior and Chief Interventional Cardiologist, says that India needs to have dedicated hospitals to transplant, then only we can have good results.

Counseling is very important and that is why people need to be trained in order to counsel well as the prime purpose for a doctor is to save lives, says, Sr. Pranaw Jha, Senior Consultation Nephrologist.

snippet.title: Bengaluru Riots: Who tore the city's peaceful character apart? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Bengaluru riots were being discussed, the vengeful riot that took place in Bengaluru over a social media post and led to a mob violently attacking Congress MLA and a police station.

Aiyshwarya Mahadev, Congress Spokesperson states that the incident is deplorable, such sort of violence being resorted to, is something that deserves action and condemnation. 

Dr. Tasleem A Rehmani, National Secretary SDPI, and President, Muslim Political Council states that two members of the party were found linked to Bengaluru violence, and four members were accused of inciting violence at a protest in January.

Rajshekhara S, Political Editor, Bangalore Mirror, explains that whenever riots break out in Bengaluru, this area has been a hotspot for them, he adds, that BJP knows that it is a sensitive area, hence the  BJP government should have alerted and kept a better track at the situation.

snippet.title: Technical glitches in Delhi University's exam portal; Are online exams credible? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the open book examinations that are being conducted by the University of Delhi was being discussed. Dr. Rajesh Kumar Jha, Member, Executive Council, University of Delhi explains how there is no academic rationale in conducting the online open-book examination. Students have been taught and prepared for a pen-and-paper exam format, he then explains that a situation like this cannot be changed suddenly. 

The system conducting an online examination, has been assembled immediately and has been launched for students, says, Abbas Naighat, he further states that problems tend to arise. However the year for students will not be wasted, and the government will put in every effort to make it happen.

The Parliament Session of the country is usually conducted between the middle of July up to August, there has not been any sign of this, says Akshay Marathe, AAP, he says that the same Parliament has created the University of Delhi, but it is forcing students to write online exams.

snippet.title: Mumbai's fatality rate double the national average; Should Mumbaikars be worried? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, as Mumbai has noticed a surge in COVID cases, the entire narrative of how Mumbai has been handling the COVID crisis was being discussed. Dr. Om Srivastav, Jaslok Hospital, states that the number of deaths due to COVID-19 in Mumbai is much higher than in other states. 

Dr. Rahuk Pandit, Fortis Hospital, explains how one of the biggest reasons that cater to Mumbai's COVID crisis is 40 percent of the population is a comorbidity in patients like diabetes and hypertension. He also adds if such illnesses are not controlled patients tend to do worse than others.

Dr. Samir Dalwai, Development Pediatrician, explains the concept of 'happy hypoxia' which is defined as a decrease in the partial pressure of oxygen, which results in patients not seeming as symptomatic. This gives them a false sense of security where patients end up not going to the hospital.

snippet.title: Is India's COVID-19 success story a fallacy? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla today, the COVID testing rate that has been a basis of comparison with countries that have noticed a spike in COVID cases was being discussed. Prime Minister Narendra Modi today met Chief Ministers to discuss the way forward. Tanvi Shuka shares the data on India's testing rate and questions, why is India still unable to ramp up its testing rate?

We cannot compare the situation of India with European countries, the number of testing has to be matched with many other things like contact tracing and isolation, explains Dr. Anant Mohan, Professor and Head of Department of Pulmonary, Critical Care, AIIMS, he further adds, all the factors together make an impact.

Dr. Arokiaswamy Velumany, Chairman and MD, Thryocare Technologies Ltd explains that the basis India is conducting the testing, we should know the numbers that we are targeting. 

Dr. Suneela Garg says that the government has to strengthen the containment strategy, she also says that we as a country need to create awareness, remove the stigma that exists which ends up discriminating against other people and focus upon managing strategy.

snippet.title: Sushant Death Case: A political situation fought over a policeman's shoulder? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Sushant Singh Rajput's death case was being discussed, the question is why Mumbai police are not investigating the case and where does Bihar police come in the entire scenario, especially when the death happened in Mumbai. Tanvi Shukla questions SK Bhardwaj, Former DGP.

After a day-long courtroom drama, the fight continues about who is going to investigate the late actor's death. There have been cases where entire families have committed suicide in Noida and Delhi. CBI did not interrogate then, In Sushant's death case, we are looking at a political situation being fought over the policeman's shoulder.

Sanjay Hedge, Senior Supreme Court Advocate, adds, there were deaths in Delhi riots, people were unhappy with the investigation. But they cannot ask the police of other states to investigate. There are certain procedures that need to be followed in law.

snippet.title: Is the fear of Hindi imposition legitimate or is BJP a Hindi majoritarian party? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the ongoing language was being discussed. It was reported that the language war reignited after DMK MP Kanimozhi faced discrimination over the language barrier in Chennai. Following this, leaders like MK Stalin and P Chidambaram have also spoken against it. Dr. Geeta Bhatt, the Academician, states that she feels this divide is superfluous and it is used most of the time for political reasons.

Language policy has been approved by the central government is a free form of language and it does not impose, says, Vivek S Reddy, BJP Karnataka. BJP is a Hindi majoritarian party, we have seen the schemes unfolded by the party, none of the schemes has any other language, ays DMK's Sarvanan Annadurai.

snippet.title: Is no exam stand amid COVID crisis genuine fear or a politicized statement? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the question of examinations amid the Coronavirus pandemic was being discussed. Dr. Mungekar, Former Rajya Sabha MP, Congress, Former VC, Mumbai University questions if there is a legitimate fear about holding examinations in the current scenario or can it be done and everything else is just politics?

Akshay Marathe, AAP explains how he took an online examination and he assures that if he did not have a laptop, a quiet room, and speedy WiFi connection, it would have been impossible to take the examination, he then states that a large majority of the country does not have access to these amenities. He further questions the central governments over why they are holding the future of the students to ransom.

Professor MM Ansari, Former Member, UGC, states that a large number of universities have conducted examinations or are in the process of conducting examinations, whereas others have expressed their inability due to the COVID threat.

snippet.title: Dubai-Calicut Air India Flight falls into a valley; Over 190 passengers onboard | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla decodes the dismal accident that took place in Kerala’s Kozhikode district. An Air India aircraft ferrying from Dubai to Kozhikode with over 190 passengers crashed after overshooting the runway and going into the valley at Kozhikode. The plane after landing broke down into two parts.

Rajeev Jain, Additional DG Media, Civil Aviation Ministry stated that ‘No fire reported at the time of landing. There were 174 passengers, ten infants, two pilots & five cabins crew onboard the aircraft. As per initial reports, rescue operations are on & passengers are being taken to hospital.

Retired Air Marshal Bhushan Nilkanth Gokhale speaks exclusively to Mirror Now on the key recommendations that would help avoid such situations.
Listen in!

Rhea Chakraborty, her family member and former manager Shruti Modi were questioned by the Enforcement Directorate in Mumbai.

Meanwhile, Patna SP VinayTiwari was released from quarantine & he has returned to Bihar. While speaking to media, he said, "The probe was quarantined, not me".

In another story, three massive landslides led to major destructions. These landslides have hit three different districts of Idukki, Wayanad and Sabarimala. Several people have been missing and over 20 people are reported dead. The dismal weather conditions are hampering the rescue operations.

In another story, three massive landslides led to major destructions. These landslides have hit three different districts of Idukki, Wayanad and Sabarimala. Several people have been missing and over 20 people are reported dead. The dismal weather conditions are hampering the rescue operations.

snippet.title: International COVID-19 drug racket busted; Are Netas circulating a wrong message? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through two major topics that spark debate and controversies amid the surging crisis of Coronavirus pandemic.

Over 15 ministers affected with COVID-19 have got themselves admitted in Private hospitals. Does it send the wrong message to the common people when netas choose private over government hospitals?

Congress’ Aadil Boparai says, ‘You've high governmental representatives who have no faith in public infrastructure because there's no allocation towards boosting infrastructure. Funds need to be dedicated towards healthcare’. Whereas Mahesh Bigala of TRS says, ‘It should be an individual choice because it's a health condition’.

In another case, an international Remdesivir smuggling racket was busted in Rajasthan, Haryana, Delhi and Uttar Pradesh. This COVID-19 vaccine was illegally smuggled to Iraq from India. How is this racket happening? At what point Remdesivir is getting out of the supply chain into the black market?

Watch to know!

snippet.title: Bihar DGP Gupteshwar Pandey breaks silence on Vinay Tiwari's 'quarantine row' | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Bihar DGP, IPS Gupteshwar Pandey speaks exclusively to Tanvi Shukla breaking his silence on the ‘quarantine row’ and shares his views on the Sushant Singh Rajput’s Death case, Mumbai Polices’ investigation and unprecedented quarantine of SP Vinay Tiwari.

IPS Pandey says, ‘Vinay is facing very depressed and helpless in Mumbai. BMC quarantined him midnight. This is kind of house-arrest & not quarantine. The case has now gone under CBI has there is no point in keeping him there. There was no positive response even after the Supreme Court’s observation. This is extremely unethical behaviour. Every day hundred planes land, how many people get quarantine like this? This is selective’.

snippet.title: Has Sushant Singh Rajput's Death Case turned into an ego battle for cops? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla explains the entire issue revolving around Sushant Singh Rajput and Disha Salian’s death case investigation. Now, the case is slightly turning into an ego battle between the Bihar and Mumbai police, especially after the Supreme Court’s hearing.

The Apex Court has raised a question on quarantining Patna SP Vinay Tiwari, while Bihar police claim that it is a virtual house arrest, Mumbai Police, on the other hand, denies the allegation saying that is a mandatory move with respect to COVID-19

Why should the two police department be locking horns like this? Is it high time for the police & government now to step back and let CBI investigate?

‘Unprofessional conduct has been displayed by both Mumbai & Bihar Police. If the police were really autonomous & professional, the Sushant Singh Rajput case could have been solved in 5 days’ says Former IPS Officer, Yashovardhan Azad. While, Advocate Geeta Luthra state, ‘Question is that can a person who doesn’t have jurisdiction, transfer the matter to Centre. The law envisages that to get CBI to enquire, the state police should agree. In this case, Maharashtra is the jurisdictional Police & they've not agreed’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Ram Temple promise fulfilled; is majority politics now an all-party trend? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla demonstrates the grand Bhoomi Pujan celebration at Ayodhya’s Ram Mandir. The BJP and its politics amid the 80s -90s revolved around the Babri Masjid and Ram Mandir controversy. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other BJP leaders displayed their unapologetic faith towards Lord Shri Ram.

Is this a change in politics that every party is looking at? Was it necessary to hold this grand event amid Coronavirus crisis?

BJP’s Shweta Shalini says, ‘We know that we came into power second time only because if the development work that the BJP has done. Prime Minister Narendra Modu is known to fulfil all his promises & this is another feather in his cap.’

While, Binoy Viswam, Rajya Sabha MP (CPI) says, ‘BJP very cunningly tried to use legion under people's faith for their very narrow and anti-people political ends. There are thousands of people dying due to COVID-19 pandemic & the priority should be to fight it & help those in need’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Ram Mandir's Bhoomi Pujan sparks controversies, is the criticism warranted? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through the latest updates on the foundation laying ceremony of Ram Temple in Ayodhya, illustrating various major controversies that emerged and came along with this mega event.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi had stated in his address that ‘India has scripted history and Ram is for all’. However, while entire India is engrossed in chanting the name of Lord Ram, there are others who have lashed out at the Government for conducting the Bhoomi Pujan.

‘Artificially manufactured controversy is being provoked towards Hindus & incites Muslims. All this is contempt of court’ says, RSS Supporter, Desh Ratan Nigam. Whereas, Neerja Chowdhury, Senior Journalist questions ‘The Supreme Court gave its verdict & it seems like the Muslim community has accepted it, just like they had said. Court also talked about 1992 demolition being a criminal act; then shouldn't you hold those responsible for it, culpable in some way?’

WATCH!

snippet.title: Sushant Singh Rajput case: Is CBI probe the only option left now? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the CBI probe option in the Sushant Singh Rajput case. Mumbai Police keeping investigations under wraps, questions are continuously rising.

The matter is going to be taken up in SC tomorrow. Prem Krishan Jain, Former Additional Director General of Police Maharashtra since a lot of twists & turns have taken place, SC will come up with a clear directive as to who will continue investigating the case. Two agencies cannot carry out investigations. Are Disha Salian’s death related to Sushant’s death? 

Former DGP Arvind Kumar Jain says Mumbai Police has been very cooperative & professional police and there has to be an order from the higher-ups for such a thing to happen. This has sent very wrong signals throughout the country and the dispute will only increase further.  Issues present before Mumbai Police for the possible causes of suicide were not looked into properly.

snippet.title: Ram Mandir Bhumipoojan: Is identity politics still core to our Indian system? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss, the identity crisis and political effects that have come into play since the construction of the Ram Mandir. A battle between Congress and BJP for decades. 

Almost 5 centuries-old & 70 years of legal tangle later the bhumipujan is all set to take place. Senior Journalist Ashutosh says with the beginning of the construction of Ram Mandir it was reinforced that Hindutva is an ideology, which at one point was communal politics, has taken over & is now hegemonic politics. A major paradigm shift has taken place since the old order.

Political parties who were the biggest hindrances in the construction of the Ram Mandir now say 'Ram Sabke hai'. Time & again, Senior leaders of the Congress have stood like walls against the construction of Ram Mandir. Lord Ram is a symbol of national unity and that’s what tomorrow should stand for. The BJP will never understand this as it’s not on their agenda says Supriya Shrinate. L.K Advani shares his views too.

snippet.title: Punjab Hooch Tragedy: Does nexus of politicians for illegal trade of liquor exist? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Punjab Hooch Tragedy and the rising death toll. The worst kept secret of villages, dhabas and the State is revealed.

Senior Journalist Vipin Pubby takes you through how the crackdown on the Punjab Hooch Tragedy started and the extent and scale of the racket that has killed over 100 people. People’s FIR were not being filed on time. These homemade liquors have caused a lot of harm to the people since the past few months.

Congress's Rimple Midha on being questioned about the existence of a nexus for such a long time, if not with the blessings of the politicians said that politicians are not involved. People have been selling such liquor since January. Many people are being caught in this racket. However, Shashi Kant, Former DGP, Punjab such a thing cannot happen without the complicity of the politicians across the spectrum: Have you heard about such a mess in any other state? Why is it happening only in Punjab? If mafia has established illegal distilleries during such a time, the responsibility lies on the govt to get rid of them. Cuts were being paid to the police for carrying out such illegal trade.

snippet.title: Sushant Singh Death: Why did Mumbai Police sit on threat alert? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla we discuss, the facts of the Sushant Singh Rajput case. With fictional stories and political angles coming into play, what to believe and what not to will be thrown light on. A big reveal is being made by Mumbai DCP.

Mumbai Police has issued a statement after chats between Sushant's kin & Mumbai Police DCP were revealed. Mumbai Police says it was an informal communication. When asked for a written complaint O.P Singh said he wanted it to be resolved internally. A big twist that puts Mumbai Police in the dock. Sushant's family never used names and no such questions were raised by the family

Former DGP AL Banerjee says in such a high-profile case, chances of cover-up don't seem to be there. This case has got a lot of media attention, there are powerful people involved & thus it cannot be swept under the carpet. The entire case depends on the forensic evidence. Nobody can judge based on social media photos or reports. The chain of evidence will link us to whether this was a suicide or a homicide. 

#SushantSinghRajput

This case has got a lot of media attention, there are powerful people involved & thus it cannot be swept under the carpet. The entire case depends on the forensic evidence. Nobody can judge based on social media photos or reports. The chain of evidence will link us to whether this was a suicide or a homicide. 

#SushantSinghRajput

snippet.title: Is it ideal to have a vernacular medium of instruction amidst transferable jobs? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the national educational policy was being discussed. A change in the education system was needed, and it took place after 34 years. Lata Vaidyanathan, an Educationist, explains that she is worried about children moving from state to state or a classroom with children who speak multiple languages, at that time, who will decide the mother tongue or what is the regional language.

Dr. MK Sridar, Member of National Educational Policy Drafting Committee 2020, states that the country needs to emphasize on multilingualism and we need to have an ecosystem which will facilitate picking up and transacting in as many languages as possible, he further states that this is the approach of the policy. 

Only 1-2 percent of India is in transferrable jobs, for those children that are in Kendra Vidyalayas and Central schools, they will ensure that the interest of these students are taken care of, says Shweta Shalini, BJP, who emphasizes on the use of mother tongue as a medium of instruction.

snippet.title: Opposition demands CBI probe; Is Mumbai police conducting a fair investigation? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, amid the various investigations, politicians, police, ED, families, actors, and directors, Tanvi Shukla explains the six key versions that are now in the Sushant Singh Rajput's death probe. 

Prem Krishan Jain, Former ADG Maharashtra states that the legal way for Bihar police should be to register an offense under zero FIR and transfer it to Mumbai. He also states that if two investigating agencies look into the same case, there are bound to be differences. 

Until the court decides what is to be done in the case, it is only conjecture, says Retired IPS Officer, Aftab Ahmed Khan. He further adds, the Bihar Police is being pressurized and thus are giving statements. Mumbai police is careful about making statements. 

In a suicide case, the police have to carry out a particular kind of investigation, in this case, Mumbai police have spent more time speaking to the actor's secondary contacts, instead of primary contacts, says Vinay Tewari, Managing Editor, Mirror Now.

snippet.title: BMC's serosurveys & med reports diverge; Is Mumbai heading towards herd immunity? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Mumbai's COVID crisis was being discussed. According to Mumbai's serosurvey findings conducted by BMC based on 6,936 samples, antibodies are found in 40 percent of people, and 57 percent of people living in the slums and 16 percent of people were found living in housing societies were exposed to COVID-19 infection.

Dr. Jayanti Shastri, Head of Microbiology, Nair Hospital, and Head, Molecular Lab, Kasturba Hospital explains that the most important question is if these antibodies persist beyond three months. Another round is said to take place in August and then the team will collect samples and compare. 

In a population of six-seven thousand people in three wards, is not a reflection of the entire Mumbai city, what is needed is large serosurvey comprising of all 24 wards, explains Dr. Rahul Pandit of Fortis Hospitals and member of Maharashtra's COVID-19 taskforce. 

Dr. Shashank Joshi, Dean, Indian College of Physicians, Lilavati Hospital, and member of COVID-19 taskforce further adds that this is a surprise result in the slum population, he also states that the numbers are seen in clinical practice and the surveys are reported are often divergent.

snippet.title: Will the New Educational Policy revamp education while maintaining inclusivity? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, as the Indian government has introduced the New Educational Policy 2020, there are various debates going around the entire scenario. The contours of the plan to revamp the education are now unveiled, Centre says that the new educational policy is a milestone.

Ashish Dhawan, Founder, CSIF India explains that the new educational policy is a landmark document where we need a national mission focused on foundational literacy and that we need to significantly improve by 2025.

Aiyar Yamini, President, CPR India, also states that the educational policy may finally free the teacher and the classroom from the tyranny of syllabus completion and pass percentages, which is considered as the biggest challenge that has held back the country's schooling system. 

The choice of language as a medium of instruction should be left to school and parents, says Dr. Kulbhushan Sharma, President, National Independent Schools Association.

snippet.title: Delhi riots: Is probe tilted towards one side of judgment along with lawyers? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, the new tug of war over the appointment of lawyers for the Delhi riots case has begun between Aam Aadmi Party and Delhi Police. Tanvi Shukla explains the entire matter. Delhi government is well within its right to appoint a panel of advocates and see to it that a fair trial is done, says Rani Srivastava. 

When looking at the sections pressed against the Muslims and the Hindus, we can see that the probe is tilting on one side, so it is right for the government to say that they should be allowed to pick lawyers, says Ananya Bhardwaj, Senior Assistant Editor, ThePrint India.

Anila Singh, BJP asks Arvind Kejriwal as to why he is not coming forward and telling what is wrong with Tushar Mehta, Amit Mahajan, and all the other lawyers provided to them. As per his statements, Rahul Mehta and the team will fight the court, Aam Aadmi Party's intention look mala fide.

snippet.title: Sushant Rajput Death Case: 2 probes, 2 states and 2 versions? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, the ongoing debate over police investigation in Sushant Singh Rajput's death was being discussed. Now that the death case involves Bihar police and Mumbai police, it is now a slugfest. There are two probes, two states and two versions of the story.

As the case investigation is still going on, there is no closure. At this stage, to say that Mumbai police have failed will not be a correct statement, says, MN Singh, Former Commissioner of Police, Mumbai.

Aryama Sundaram, Senior Advocate, Supreme Court, states that this is the first complaint given by Sushant Singh Rajput's father and is a recent one. He also explains how the case was never given to Mumbai police hence one cannot fault them. He further states that it is right for Mumbai police to investigate the case and not Bihar police.

Film critic Mayank Shekhar further elaborates saying that we have lost sight that someone lost their life and we should be investigating that. He adds, with a new angle, the things that are upcoming, do have relevance with the case that helps in investigating deeper.

snippet.title: Is Bollywood averse to outsiders? Shoojit Sircar and Hansal Mehta speak to Mirror Now | EXCLUSIVE
snippet.description:
In conversation with Shoojit Sicar and Hansal Mehta, Hansal Mehta talks about how lockdown is treating him and his adapting to the workings of the Bollywood industry. Shoojit Sircar has adapted new skills as well. They talk about the revival time for the Bollywood industry and a minimum of 2 years for revival due to this pandemic. 

Indoor shoots are being done with proper precautions taken. The crew work in an intimate environment and shootings should start by November this year. They discuss how the pandemic has aroused Bollywood conspiracies and a divide between the insiders and outsiders. They term this as a social epidemic. An equitable working environment should be encouraged. Have groups already been established in the industry? Ongoing debates may not make sense to few but discussions are important. People are choosing to work in big production houses. They talk about the Bollywood industry engulfing you if you let it. They stress the importance of making responsible films and recognition. Nepotism is also hinted at in the industry.

snippet.title: Kerala activist Rehana Fathima moves to SC, Is nudity necessarily obscene? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, the debate over nudity and obscenity was being discussed, Activist Rehana Fathima was booked for a video that showed her minor children paining on her semi-nude body. The case has moved to the Supreme Court, saying that nudity is not necessarily obscenity. 

If people really want to raise a point, they should go to Bollywood and book everyone who objectifies women, as women are often objectified there, says Yogita Bhayana on the row over video of Rehana's children painting her body. She also says that she does not believe that Rehana was objectifying herself in the video.

CPI leader Annie Raja states that the core issue is that is a woman's body is being viewed as a sexual object. Even the court seems uncomfortable about a woman's body. She further states that nobody forced people to watch the video, it is about personal choice.

snippet.title: Legality of the points raised by the Rajasthan Governor over assembly session | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the ongoing Rajasthan political turmoil was being discussed. Rajasthan's Governor Kalraj Mishra has responded to the state in order to call for an assembly session. He has highlighted three aspects where the session has to give a 21-day notice, if somebody plans trust vote they must adhere to the Supreme Court, and the assembly session has to follow COVID guidelines. 

Aryama Sundaram, Senior Advocate, Supreme Court explains how this is clear politicking done by the Governor and he has used the Coronavirus pandemic to the advantage of what he wants to achieve. 

Sanjay Hedge, Senior Advocate also mentions that the Governor is taking advantage of the pandemic situation very selectivity, he also questions the Governor says that after the 21-day period there will not be any pandemic. He agrees that the Governor is politicking.

snippet.title: Sharp rise in COVID-19 cases in India, was Unlock implemented too early? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, As the COVID cases are on a rise in the interior areas, districts that barely had any cases, in states which had a very low number. The question of whether Unlock in India was implemented too early is being discussed. 

Priyam Manisha, Political Analyst speaks to Tanvi Shukla on how Bihar has only a handful of people who can manage the COVID-19  situation on the ground. She also mentions that the primary healthcare centre does not exist in Bihar. It is now in a situation of collapse. 

Anant Bhan, Researcher, Global Health, Bioethics, and Health Policy explains how lockdowns might be useful as a temporary platform to allow you to prepare, but it will not help in averting the spread of infection. The sooner people realize that it is better. He also says that the country cannot go on in the lockdown mode.

snippet.title: Is the Government shying away from a debate over environment? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla briefs on the Environment Impact Assessment 2020 notification. This assessment talks about the impact of any project or construction on the environment. The Central Government has decided to change some rules that were issued in 2006, however, many activists are against this change. What is problematic about the Environmental Impact Assessment Notification 2020?

‘There are many clauses in the draft notification which essentially protect the polluters’ says, Environmental Journalist, Bahar Dutt

While BJP’s Gopal Agarwal asks, ‘Our environmental laws were not strong. In this new notification, the govt has aligned the environmental requirements to set environmental standards. We have put objectivity into the system. Where is the problem?’

The Rajasthan Political Row is not sighing relief; the Gehlot Camp has now thronged outside the Raj Bhawan demanding an assembly session. Is there a need for such an extent?

‘The governor has no discretion in refusing to call a session. Therefore, legislatures protested. When Constitutional authorities don't follow the Constitution, what else is to be done’ says Congress MP Kapil Siba.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Should Bihar elections be held amidst COVID-19 pandemic & floods crisis? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla gives an update on the current status of healthcare infrastructure in Bihar & explains why conducting an election amid a COVID-19 pandemic will be a big challenge. The State is rated second last with respect to healthcare index by NITI AAYOG.

Should elections be held amid this pandemic and flood chaos?

Dr SY Quraishi says, ‘Conducting elections is a constitutional responsibility & in India, can be postponed only if an emergency is declared. Polling day is just a 1-day affair, people crowd markets every day’.

Whereas, Dr Nawal Kishores says, ‘In a democracy, the most important stakeholder is people, and now the people are at risk. The elections in Bihar can wait, but the pandemic won’t’.

'Infant mortality rate in Bihar is 48, the 34th worst in the world. At this kind of infrastructure, we can't fight the battle; need to have death audits', says Dr Nafis Faizi.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Greater Noida: Speeding car collides with bike & cycle, Two people dead
snippet.description:
Greater Noida: Breza car in Greater Noida collides with a cycle and bike. Two people died on the spot. A female along with two others have been grievously injured and hospitalised. The car was moving at a very fast speed. The car collided into an electricity pole, bottles of alcohol also found in the car. Police reveal that the car driver was in an inebriated state at the time of the collision.

The driver of the car Sundar and cycle rider Aditya have been declared deceased. Police reached instantly at the accident spot and the casualties were rushed to the hospital where the paperwork was carried out.

snippet.title: Bihar: Patient pleads for help over filthy isloation wards, dies the next day; Will CM respond?
snippet.description:
Bihar: The isolation wards for COVID patients in Bettiah are filthy. No doctors and healthcare are available for patients in the wards. A video went viral uploaded by a patient from inside the isolation ward who was admitted to the hospital and later passed away on Thursday. 

Narendra, the patient who died shows that there was no one to look after them in the ward. Dogs roaming freely in the ward. The continuous increases in cases in Bihar also poses a problem to the government. Shyam tells Mirror Now, the healthcare facilities are scarce in all of Bihar. The patient continuously pleads for help but he is treated like an animal. The images being circulated are horrific and pose questions in front of the government.

snippet.title: Uttrakhand: Locals forced to use damaged bridge to cross rivers, DM Swati says no reason to worry
snippet.description:
Uttrakhand: The locals in the Chamoli district of Uttrakhand have been forced to use a local bridge to cross rivers. A landslide has caused these bridges to collapse. Incessant rain in the Chamoli district has caused distress to the locals and there is no one to help them out.

On speaking to the District residents of Chamoli, he said the bridges have been damaged since the floods in 2017. No measures have been taken to repair the bridges. The locals are crossing the bridge every day and putting their lives on stake. This has caused distress to the locals. 

However, Swati S Bhadoriya, DM of the Chamoli district says the PWD has made a paddle bridge at a distance of 200 metres from the damaged bridge but the residents refuse to use it. The locals have been using a kaccha road to which is safe.No reason to worry.

snippet.title: Rajasthan battles the political war; Karnataka fails to fight COVID-19 | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through the latest developments in Rajasthan’s political turmoil. A plea was filed in the Supreme Court by speaker seeking for the High Court to not issue its final orders regarding disqualification. However, the Gehlot Government and speaker got a back seat when the Supreme Court gave a go-ahead for the High Court for further proceedings. The Apex Court during the hearing today also asked critical questions about the involvement of the speaker in the disqualification of the rebel MLAs.

What does this mean? What powers does the speaker have?

Whereas, Kailash Vasdev Senior SC Advocate said,’ The speakers' powers come into force when there are proceedings within the House when a group leaves a party or is wanting to move to another group’.

While Rajasthan is battling its political war, the State of Karnataka is bizarrely losing its Coronavirus battle. Mirror Now gets you an exclusive investigation from Bengaluru exposing some shocking revelation and negligence from the hospitals in the city.

WATCH!

snippet.title: What are the challenges of schooling in COVID-19 era ? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through an interesting report revealing the impact of Coronavirus and lockdown on the Education Sector. One of the big casualties of the pandemic has been to the students as schools and colleges have continuously remained shut across the country.

A study called the 'State of Sector Report' conducted by the Centre Square Foundation has brought to light some big findings on the impact of COVID-19 on education & private schools in India.

The big and concerning question is, how will this put an impact on students’ mind?

‘Parents feel that because they're not sending their children to schools, so they're not supposed to pay; forgetting that even private schools are run by society’ says, Rajinder Nath, Vice President of All India DAV institution.

snippet.title: How serious is Coronavirus in your city? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, we first look at our Prime Minister Narendra Modi who is addressing the nation at the India Idea Summit organized by US-India Business Council. He says, ‘We all agree that the world is in need of a better future. It is all of us who have to collectively give shape to the future’.

Mirror Now assesses exclusive Sero Survey report data from containment zones of 10 worst-hit cities in India. The survey results reveal that 49% of people in Ahmedabad, 36% of people in Dharavi, had antibodies against COVID-19. Every third resident in Mumbai is exposed to Coronavirus. 70% of the cases are recorded only from 10 cities, including, Mumbai, Delhi, Bengaluru, Tamil Nadu and more.

Dr Bhramar Mukherjee Prof. of Epidemiology at the University of Michigan speaks about the herd immunity & the scale of testing being done in India, says, ‘We have a cascade of peaks waving through the country in the next 2-months. What's lacking is the comprehensive long-term strategy’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Ashok Gehlot's brother raided; Congress cries foul | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla explains why no political party is holier-than-thou & raises the question on cases being revived when it suits the political parties. 

While the Rajasthan political turmoil intensifies, the property of Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot’s brother Agrasain Gehlot gets raided by the ED in connection with the national fertilizer scam. Is Congress crying foul now?

Congress’ Dr Shama Mohamed says,’ Why is it that when leaders join BJP they get cleansed as if they’ve taken a dip in the Ganga. If BJP wants to go after genuine leaders, they should go after everyone’.

Whereas Sudhindra Bhadoria says, ‘There is a need to make institutions like these, independent of the control of those who are in power. We need to free them from their clutches & strengthen democracy’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Assam Gas Well Explosion leaves 3 foreign experts injured
snippet.description:
Assam: The gas well explosion in Assam which took place near gas well number 5 of Oil India In Baghjan, Tinsukia has left three foreign experts injured who were working at the site. They have been rushed to the hospital immediately. The explosion took place while operation for dousing the fire at the site by the experts. The fire dousing operations have now been put to a halt. The explosion has injured the experts and they have been taken to the hospital to get treated. The operations are halted due to the explosion at the gas well and injuries to experts.

snippet.title: Delhi's Sero Survey results out, what should be the next strategy? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses the much talked Sero Survey that was conducted in the National Capital. The Sero Survey was held to estimate the spread of Coronavirus. The Delhi Government has released the reports on public domain today and the results are quite alarming. One out of four people in Delhi has been affected with COVID-19.

How relevant is the survey? Should we be concerned? How should policies change basis Sero Survey results?

AAP’s Akshay Marathe says, ‘We are not taking any decisions based on this survey. We will not, at this point, be in a position to change or evolve our strategy based on the results of sero survey’.

Whereas, Former Professor & Head, Centre for Community Medicine, AIIMS Delhi, Dr Chandrakant Pandav says,’ If the methodology is not right, the results don't mean anything. There is a lot of missing information here’.

Watch!

snippet.title: Seven reasons why Bengaluru is failing COVID-19 war | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through seven reasons why Bengaluru is failing the Coronavirus war. Heartbreaking news comes to light from the city where a pregnant woman lost her baby while delivering in the auto after she was denied admission at 4 different hospitals. Much such news exposing medical negligence have been disclosed from the State of Karnataka.

But what needs to be done in Bengaluru, so that we don’t have instances being reported on a daily basis of medical apathy?

Dr Sudarshan Ballal says, ‘Bengaluru has a robust number of hospitals, both in the private & government sector. Problem is that there's no data management and a single authority allocating beds. A real-time dashboard is needed’.

While Karnataka is struggling to fight the Coronavirus, Tamil Nadu Ministers, on the other hand, are openly flouting lockdown norms. Fisheries Minister D. Jayakumar flagged off a rally to create awareness about Social Distancing, without following it himself.

Watch!

snippet.title: Will AIIMS win the COVID-19 vaccine race? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through a pile of topics, while some news brings in a ray of hope others remain a series of apathies.

The AIIMS in Delhi has started its trial for their COVID-19 names ‘Covaxin’. Oxford also has begun their trials for vaccine by maintaining transparency in their entire research. Most vaccines fail in stage 3, as this is on a large scale and it is where the real test of the vaccine comes, says, Dr.Rakesh Mishra, Director of Centre for Cellular and Molecular Biology.

Assam Floods death surges to 110. Over 70 lakh people across the state affected and 85% of Kaziranga National Park still remains submerged. 113 animals have died so far & 140 have been rescued.

A woman in labour was denied admission by nearly 10 hospitals. She spent almost 10 hours, trying to find a bed & had to finally deliver the baby in an auto-rickshaw. Unfortunately, the baby died half an hour later.

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes through the surging political crisis in the State of Rajasthan. While all other States are battling the Coronavirus pandemic battle, Rajasthan, on the other hand, is busy saving its own government. The Congress vs Congress tussle witnessed a sensational twist after Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot made the shocking allegation on Sachin Pilot.

After the venomous comments made by the CM, it shows this is an internal war between the Congress members. When we demand CBI action, we're within our rights, why should Congress have problems?

Professor Ranjan Mahan says, ‘What Ashok Gehlot said today, reflects his frustration with the way he's being treated’.  Whereas Congress’ Pawan Khera says, ‘Senior leaders of BJP are openly heard talking about buying MLAs. localized.title: Rajasthan politics: Is the tape proof of spying or a sinister plot? | The Urban Debate
localized.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes through the surging political crisis in the State of Rajasthan. While all other States are battling the Coronavirus pandemic battle, Rajasthan, on the other hand, is busy saving its own government. The Congress vs Congress tussle witnessed a sensational twist after Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot made the shocking allegation on Sachin Pilot.

After the venomous comments made by the CM, it shows this is an internal war between the Congress members. When we demand CBI action, we're within our rights, why should Congress have problems?

Professor Ranjan Mahan says, ‘What Ashok Gehlot said today, reflects his frustration with the way he's being treated’.  Whereas Congress’ Pawan Khera says, ‘Senior leaders of BJP are openly heard talking about buying MLAs. Instead of worrying about this, they want to know if we've tapped their phone lines legally or illegally. This is an admission of guilt’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Why are Mumbai's outskirts neglected despite surge in COVID-19 cases? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla brings to you the horrific state of affairs from the much forgotten COVID-19 hotspot in India. The Mumbai Metropolitan Regions and the outskirts of Mumbai have seen a spike in Coronavirus cases count yet no authorities are taking preventive measures to curb the pandemic curve here. What made the cases surge?

‘In the Mumbai Metropolitan Region, testing was restricted & there was no capacity building of healthcare infrastructure. In addition, there is a shortage of healthcare workers’ says Dr Shashank Joshi.

While in Delhi, A major Plasma Therapy Racket has been exposed by Times Network where the authorities are earning profits amid plasma shortage by charging over ₹ 80000 for donor’s blood.

Watch!

snippet.title: Will IPL 2020 minus spectators lose its dazzle? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through a new topic of discussion amid lockdown. The sports field has been badly hit by the Coronavirus pandemic across the globe, however, ideas of reopening various sports are mulling around the corner. Should the games begin? How will the match be held in an empty stadium? 
‘Travelling is our biggest challenge. You've got to look at Sports as an economic activity' if you've opened up other industries then I don't see why the sports industry, with all precautions, be opened as well’ says Former Indian International Cricketer Deep Dasgupta.
Whereas, Kartik Murali says, ‘I know that everybody wants a bit of normalcy but, it's tough and unfortunately we have the curve flattened to be able to have an event of this magnitude, you need to be extremely brave to take that call’.
Watch!

snippet.title: Cops in Madhya Pradesh brutally assault Dalits, Who will police the police? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla the discussion unfolds on the brutal assault on a Dalit couple in Madhya Pradesh’s Guna. The unfortunate incident has brought to the forefront police brutality again begging the question, will the couple get justice? 

The shocking violence displayed in the assault has caused an uproar across the nation, as yet another incident of inhumane policing makes the news. There has been a furious demand for justice and action against the perpetrators. 

“While the act of police seen in this video is a shame to humanity, there is another side to the story,” says, Neha Bagga, BJP Spokesperson 
 
Tanvi Shukla asks the legitimate question in the movie ban row, can a film be banned on religious sentiments? The movie ‘Muhammad: the messengers of god’ has sparked a debate as the Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh, seeks a blanket ban under the IT Act. 

“Nobody has seen even a photograph of Prophet, so anything imaginary has not been taken in a good taste, among the Muslim community. All over the world, no image of Prophet is acceptable for anybody,” says, Dr Tasleem A Rehmani, National Secy SDPI & President of Muslim Political Council

The Assam floods have wreaked havoc across the state, causing damage to both life and property. Times Network reporter, Arindam Das, bring the ground report of the present situation and the relief efforts to help the affected.

In a special segment, Mirror Now brings ‘Conflict - Life At The Red Line’, the stories of India’s frontline COVID workers, who have risked their lives every day since the outbreak of the pandemic to sustain the country’s healthcare system. 

Dr Rahul Tambe, Senior Consultant, Nanavati Super Specialty Hospital speaks to Tanvi Shukla about the difficulties the doctors and medical staff have had to overcome to combat the deadly virus. 

#CopsTurnBrutes  #IndiaForAssam #MovieBanRow #FightAgainstCoronavirus


SUBSCRIBE NOW for more such videos ►http://bit.ly/2LesD8T

For More Updates ► http://www.mirrornownews.com

snippet.title: Massive COVID surge in Mumbai's backyard, Kalyan-Dombivli new virus hotspots | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the lens is on Maharashtra, the worst affected state in the country but the conversation shifts to its neglected areas of Kalyan-Dombivli which have seen a massive surge in COVID cases. 

The regions have remained out of focus, while the attention has been fixed on Mumbai, however, Mirror Now investigates the deep connection between both areas and how the situation in Mumbai cannot improve without working to curb the spread in both. 

"If the number of COVID cases in Thane is coupled with that in Kalyan-Dombivli, it will become the third-largest urban cluster in Maharashtra, and one of the top ten clusters in the country," says, Dr. Abhay Shukla, National Co-convener, Jan Swasthya Abhiyan 

Amid the heavy rain lashing Mumbai, there have been several cases of urban infrastructure collapse bringing into question the efficacy of civic bodies and government in securing the safety of the people living in the vulnerable areas. 

Who is accountable for the insurmountable damage to life and property? 


#KalyanCovidCaseSurge #MumbaiBuildingCollapse

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: What has been the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on India's economy? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the discussion on the COVID impact on the Indian economy rages focused on 6 key indicators to measure the health of the economy namely, GDP, jobs, tax collection, car sales, and the overall economic activity. 

Nikunj Dalmia, Managing Editor, ET Now highlights the holistic view of the global markets, stating that while this year has seen the worst, next year might bring revival, a prediction in line with prevailing market global cues. 

Madan Sabnavis, Chief Economist, Care Ratings limited offers an alternate view,  he says, "I don't think demand revival is likely. 2020 is a washout year and supply problems will remain because of uncertainty. Given the federal state of our Govt, certainty isn't being provided." 

There is a challenge present before the government to do what it takes to bring India's economy back on track. 

Watch the video to know more! 

#CovidEconomicImpact

snippet.title: Assam floods wreck havoc across the state, rescue operations underway | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla see the magnitude and impact of the floods in the state reeling from the disaster which has taken lives, displaced lakhs, and led to national parks drowning. Mirror Now reporter Arindam Das shows how the floods have affected the wildlife at Kaziranga National Park, which is 90% submerged underwater. 

The floods have hit the state amid a pandemic leading to several challenges as the state authorities and NDRF teams work to help those hit the natural disaster.

The practice of having fake followers on social media platforms exposes a major racket affecting several celebrities. There are over 100 portals selling followers to anyone who can afford them, which have now been flagged. The investigation has now reached the Mumbai Police. 

One person has been arrested by the CID in the death case of West Bengal BJP MLA Debendra Nath Roy who was found hanging a few days earlier. CM Mamata Banerjee has denied all allegations of murder, however, new evidence proving the contrary is emerging. 

As the Rajasthan political turmoil peaks and top Congress leaders remain silent on Sachin Pilot sacking, there are questions on what the leader's next move will be.


In a major relief to Indian students studying in the U.S, the Trump Administration has revoked its earlier order, which said that all foreign students taking online classes amid COVID were to return to their native countries. After a tussle that left students in a bind, the order has now been rescinded. 



 Watch the video to know more! 

#AssamFloods #FakeFollowers #BengalMLADeath #RajasthanPoliticalCrisis

snippet.title: Sachin Pilot sacked, are young Congress leaders restless as veterans take charge? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, see the conversation on the sacking of young and popular former Deputy Chief Minister of Rajasthan Sachin Pilot from his post as Deputy CM and Congress President of the state. Will the move make younger leaders in the party restless? 

The Congress has denied any wrongdoing or mishandling in the matter and has slammed the BJP for its statements claiming otherwise. 

“I can fully appreciate that Sachin Pilot has some genuine grievances. But, for that he had to raise it from top to the bottom; all doors are open to him. Even if he does it now, it will be solved” says, Abhishek Singhvi, National Spokesperson, Congress

How will the party placate both sides, to bring back the confidence of its MLAs and people in the government? 

The Left has claimed that it has no part to play in the Kerala gold smuggling case and its recently revealed terror funding links, however, the opposition in particular Congress has alleged that the political links of Swapna Suresh extend to the CM’s office. 

“This indirectly shows that somewhere, knowingly or unknowingly, the CM is also part of this otherwise why is he refusing to suspend this officer when there are so many allegations?” Says, Sreenivasan Krishnan, Secretary, AICC 

#OldGuardvsFreshTalent #GoldSmugglingCase 



Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: Should university exams be held or cancelled amid COVID-19 pandemic? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, see the conversation on the UGC decision to hold final year university exams amid the COVID-19 pandemic. There has been a tussle between the governments of six states who have openly opposed the UGC's decision to not cancel the exams of the students. 

"If UGC wanted to be the apex body to set guidelines, they should've acted sooner. After state govts took the initiative to cancel exams, the UGC realised opposition states have stolen the march on them and made conducting exams compulsory,"  says Ruchi Gupta, National Students Union of India

There has been a massive outrage on the UGC notification as students, parents, and teachers express their concern about the safety of students. 

"It is inexplicable how all consultative processes have been done away with and the future of the students is being played with," says, Sourya Majumder, College Student

There have been several requests, petitions, and letters written to the HRD Ministry and the UGC to cancel the exams and promote students. 

Will it take stock of these demands? 

#StatesvsUGC



SUBSCRIBE NOW for more such videos ►http://bit.ly/2LesD8T

snippet.title: Comedian given rape threats, Backlash forcing comics to reconsider jokes? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, In case of Agrima Joshua, the first response of Maharashtra govt was to order action against her. Unfortunately, that is what it has come to. When men take to social media & abuse women, give rape threats, no action is taken unless there's an outrage. Why this selective action?

I have to keep figuring out a better way to phrase myself, to put my words but I do wish there was an understanding towards our job. says, Comedian Sejal Bhat

It is beginning to feel like we are becoming one of the most dangerous places in the world, for women. It has literally  gone from I am offended by this to let's rape a woman. says, Comedian Radhika Vaz

The vandals went to a comedy club & shot a video of themselves vandalising & put it out on social media. They aren’t in fear of action being taken, but we are afraid of telling a ‘joke’!. That tells how badly skewed the balance is. says, Comedian Neeti Palta.

The only thing these people have is their identity. While they are just being exposed to new information, they feel their identity is being challenged. That creates insecurity & it is expressed as anger, which is misdirected. says, Comedian Azeem Banatwalla.

Watch!

snippet.title: Rajasthan political crisis explodes, Will Congress lose power in the state? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Tanvi Shukla see the massive developments in the Rajasthan political crisis unfold showing the unraveling state of Congress leadership. How will the top leadership cope with this latest political turmoil as voters feel betrayed amid an already prevailing healthcare crisis. 


The controversy surrounding the stance taken by Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot and Deputy Chief Minister Sachin Pilot has sparked a row with no end in sight. As the BJP slams the Congress for its weak dealing with the crisis and the allegations on both ends of the spectrum fly, uncertainty looms large in the state. 

“The contradictions were there for everybody to see. The Congress leadership ought to have stepped in much earlier,” says, Javed Ansari, Senior Journalist

Congress has responded to the allegations as it takes stock of the serious crisis in the Rajasthan government. The party is yet to make a formal statement on the issue. 

"The party is serious that is why senior leaders have spoken to Sachin Pilot & things will be clearer tomorrow,” says, Charan Singh Sapra, Congress Spokesperson 

As the MLA’s are huddled in a resort, while the leadership holds negotiations to placate both sides, the question remains will Congress emerge from this crisis or will it lose Rajasthan? 

#PilotvsGehlot 

Watch the video to know more!

localized.title: Rajasthan political crisis explodes, Will Congress lose power in the state? | The Urban Debate
localized.description:
On The Urban Debate With Tanvi Shukla see the massive developments in the Rajasthan political crisis unfold showing the unraveling state of Congress leadership. How will the top leadership cope with this latest political turmoil as voters feel betrayed amid an already prevailing healthcare crisis. 


The controversy surrounding the stance taken by Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot and Deputy Chief Minister Sachin Pilot has sparked a row with no end in sight. As the BJP slams the Congress for its weak dealing with the crisis and the allegations on both ends of the spectrum fly, uncertainty looms large in the state. 

“The contradictions were there for everybody to see. The Congress leadership ought to have stepped in much earlier,” says, Javed Ansari, Senior Journalist

Congress has responded to the allegations as it takes stock of the serious crisis in the Rajasthan government. The party is yet to make a formal statement on the issue. 

"The party is serious that is why senior leaders have spoken to Sachin Pilot & things will be clearer tomorrow,” says, Charan Singh Sapra, Congress Spokesperson 

As the MLA’s are huddled in a resort, while the leadership holds negotiations to placate both sides, the question remains will Congress emerge from this crisis or will it lose Rajasthan? 

#PilotvsGehlot 

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: Are secrets buried with gangster Vikas Dubey's death? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, If there was any intent of cleaning up the system, that opportunity has been lost. We will never know who helped Vikas Dubey all this while. Those secrets have been buried with him forever. 

Senior Journalist Sharat Pradhan says  “By ensuring this encounter, the Uttar Pradesh govt has managed to put a lid on all the unopened chapters of Vikas Dubey's life, which would have brought to the fore his connections with people in the ruling dispensation.”  

Sudhin Bhadoria from BSP says “There is a need for an enquiry into this whole issue, an enquiry to breakdown the widespread nexus. The whole system is in peril. We must take this opportunity to cleanse the system before it's too late.”

Samajwadi Party's Juhie Singh says “This perception-creation, image-creation has to stop. No action is being taken (by the Uttar Pradesh govt). This was a murder to hide certain facts.” 

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: Vikas Dubey Encounter: How did the case unfold? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Vikas Dubey's encounter unfolded and explained, according to the UP police

Why is the police not clarifying whether Dubey was on a transit remand? With loopholes in the police story, here are 5 big questions that the U.P Police must answer!

Former Additional Solicitor General Vikas Singh says "If the police personnel who were behind the killing of the 8 policemen, were not suspended till now, this clearlys that the killing of Vikas Dubey was a mandate given by the Govt of the day."

Fmr Chief Justice Chhattisgarh HC Justice Yatindra Singh says "If a gangster is put in jail, he forms his own clique, runs everything from jail. They become more powerful in jail. We must improve our judicial system which is absolutely broken."

Former IPS Officer Yashovardhan Azad says "Thinking that encounters mean justice, is a grim lesson for democracy. Democracy’s institutions fail because politicians take over to give selective dispensation. This is how the mafia prosper." 

Former Commissioner of Delhi Police Neeraj Kumar says "The circumstances under which the encounter has taken place in which Vikas Dubey was killed, are suspicious. Only a proper probe can answer all the doubts. The criminal justice system has totally collapsed."

Tanvi Shukla asks Former DGP U.P Dr. Surya Kumar Shukla "With the killing of Vikas Dubey, how will we now find the people who were helping since all these years?" 

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: Vikas Dubey's 7-day manhunt ends in U.P, Gangster nabbed in Ujjain temple | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, After a 7-day hunt by Uttar Pradesh police, gangster Vikas Dubey was arrested this morning near Mahakal Temple in Ujjain, by the Madhya Pradesh Police. 

Here is all that transpired in the last 1 week. 

Managing Editor at Mirror Now Vinay Tewari says "A man who was being hunted by 3000 people, was caught because of a flower seller, aided & abetted by a security guard. It shows how this was about polices vs police, where one section was looking for him & another possibly helping him." 

Resident Editor Navbharat Times Sudhir Mishra says "Keeping in mind all that took place today, it is difficult to believe that this was an arrest."

Former DGP Kerala Dr. N.C. Asthana says "There are reasonable grounds to suspect that the police were dragging their feet so that at least some evidence of the nexus could be wiped off. Obviously, Vikas Dubey's nexus runs far deep." 

Watch the video to know more!


SUBSCRIBE NOW for more such videos ►http://bit.ly/2LesD8T

snippet.title: Nationwide COVID data study, Detailed analysis of states | India Outbreak Report | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Nationwide COVID 19 data study shows Gujarat, Delhi & Mumbai as stable, but Thane as the worry.

Dhrubo Ghosh Dastidar, Director, Protiviti India gives a detailed projection analysis of how key States have fared in the Fight against Coronavirus. 

Tanvi Shukla takes you through the 10 states where COVID 19 cases are likely to peak first.

VivekSubba Reddy from BJP says "The big challenge to Karnataka Govt is to target & face this peak and ensure it's minimized. Massive preparations are being made in terms of an increase in the number of beds, home quarantine rules & other various things." 

Public Health Doctor and Researcher Dr.Sylvia Karpagam says "Two things Karnataka Govt can really work on - 1. Ensure that more people don't get infected, 2. Ensure serious patients have access to emergency care & aren't denied any sort of healthcare." 

Tanvi Shukla asks "With lockdown in so many districts, what happened in TamilNadu? Were people not being careful enough or were the authorities not implementing the rules properly?" to Arun Ram, Resident Editor, TOI Chennai. 

AIADMK's VA Pugazhendi says "It's combined responsibility of the Govt & public to ensure there's no rise in COVID19 cases."

Resident Editor at Deccan Chronicle Sriram Karri says "The mindset in Telangana was that if you don't test, nobody will catch coronavirus. The Govt has refused to test and as a result, the containment management collapsed."

Tanvi Shukla asks "Why is there a sudden jump in COVID 19 cases in Telangana? What has gone wrong?" to Paul Marx, TRS.

Clyde Crasto from NCP says "In the whole of Maharashtra, the recovery rate has gone up. The way things have happened in Mumbai, they'll happen in the rest of Maharashtra; we're making sure of that things improve."

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: W.H.O recognizes COVID is airborne, Should we take more precautions? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, WHO recognizes evidence that COVID 19 is airborne. Should you take more precautions? 

Dr. Rajesh M. Parikh, Director, Medical Research Jaslok Hospital explains.

Lilavati Hospital's Dr. Shashank Joshi says "The risk of airborne transmission goes up to where there is crowded, clustered & poorly ventilated environment; humidity is going to make it worse
Listen in to know some precautions Mumbaikars can take to keep safe.

Dr. Subramanian Swaminathan Sr Consultant at Infectious diseases Gleneagles Global says "We need to be very careful as it has huge public health & infection control implications. Once we say it's airborne, we have to invest in negative pressure rooms for everybody, that's not a possibility."

Saurabh Arora, Founder & CEO - University Living explains after POTUS Donald Trump modifies student visa, what impact will it have on Indian students in the U.S? 

CEO CanAm Asia Jeff Decicco says "What will probably happen over the next few weeks is that some of the universities will start to reconsider the policies, as they are also a business after all."

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: Big shortage of COVID-19 treatment drug "Remdesivir" | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Big shortage of COVID treatment drug "Remdesivir"

Anuja Tabrej, Daughter of the patient says "My father who was detected COVID 19 positive was prescribed 7 doses of Remdesivir and Tocilizumab injections. I couldn’t find it anywhere in the market." 

Anoo Bhuyan Special Correspondent at India Spend says "Drugs like Remdesivir and Tocilizumab are not new drugs. They have existed but are now being repurposed for COVID 19. There is definitely a black market and grey market going on." 

Professor( Addtnl) Consultant senior Endovascular neurosurgeon KEM & Lilavati Hospital, Mumbai COVID19 Dr. Nitin Dange says  "Remdesivir and Tocilizumab are life saving drugs." 

Consultant Infectious Diseases Apollo Hospitals Dr. Laxman Jessani says "In the initial part of COVID19, Remdesivir acts very well. It has been shown in studies to decrease the duration of hospital stay."

CMD, BDR Pharmaceuticals Dharmesh Shah says "Black marketing of Remdesivir and Tocilizumab was limited to the unauthorized stock which entered into the market. It is a matter of 2 weeks before we see ease out on this" to Tanvi Shukla on Shortage of COVID19 drugs. 

Diana Monteiro Relative of the Patient says "We have called so many people, every day, to get these drugs but, either one of them isn't available. There were some who were asking for ₹50,000 per vial of Remdesivir & around ₹80,000 per vial for Tocilizumab." 

Watch the video to know more!

SUBSCRIBE NOW for more such videos ►http://bit.ly/2LesD8T

snippet.title: Uttar Pradesh Police battling moles in their gangster hunt? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Can the entire might of the Uttar Pradesh Police not find one gangster? Tanvi Shukla questions BJP's, Anila Singh.

The Former DGP U.P Arvind Kumar Jain says  "The U.P Police has done several commendable jobs in the past and its anti-dacoity operations have been very successful. The Kanpur Encounter is a glaring example when there have been lapses and the U.P. Police attack the right track.

Resident Editor, Navbharat Times Lucknow/NCR Sudhir Misra says "In Uttar Pradesh, the bond of the police and the mafia is so strong, that the mafia never attacks the police."

Juhie Singh of Samajwadi Party says "The intentions of the Government are under question because the SDF is still being headed by a person who was responsible for certain issues which slain cop Devendra Mishra raised."

Former DGP U.P AL Banerjee says "The only way out of the police-gangster nexus, is to have a systemic overhaul, which takes into account not only the police but the entire criminal justice system."

Vizag Gas Leak | After 2 months, the CEO and 2 Directors of LG Polymers have been arrested in connection with the styrene vapor leak.

Special Chief Secy Andhra Pradesh Govt in LG Polymers Neerabh Kumar Prasad on Vizag Gas Leak says "There was a sharp rise in polymer content that was ignored by management. The company had sufficient signals to take necessary action." He further adds "If the temperature of Styrene is maintained below 20 degrees centigrade & inhibitor chemicals are added, there will be no accident. This is standard protocol. The factory perhaps did not bother to take these precautions."

Watch the video to know more!


SUBSCRIBE NOW for more such videos ►http://bit.ly/2LesD8T
