snippet.title: Are Migrants now a pawn in political blame-game? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Why don't we just accept the fact that we completely failed lakhs of people of our own country rather than getting into a political blame-game? 

I've traveled 11 states & what I'm seeing on ground is that Centre & states have failed our migrants. Workers are traveling on foot, bicycles or cramped up in trucks. Who cares about Priyanka Gandhi-Yogi Adityanath battle when a humanitarian crisis is unfolding in India?. says, Senior Journalist Barkha Dutt.

From the very beginning we had decided that we will not follow anything except the central guidelines. No migrant in our  state border is traveling on foot. says, Supriyo Bhattacharya.

I don't see much of a realistic chance of having a vaccine for COVID19 this year. Must more realistic is sometime early or middle of next year. says, Harvard Global Health Institute Director Dr Ashish K. Jha.

Watch!

snippet.title: Cyclone hits Odisha & West Bengal coast, Are deaths expected? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Amphan left a trail of Odisha with unconfirmed reports of two deaths in the state. It reached West Bengal and the eye of the cyclonic depression is expected to completely enter West Bengal by 7 pm. Kolkata weather worsened in the evening, witnessing wind speeds of up to 112 kmph.  

The exact quantum of damage will be assessed by district administration & detailed report will be given in 24-48 hours. The main motto of Odisha govt was to save lives; so far, 2 lives have been lost. says,  Senior Journalist Jajati Karan.

High speed winds have hit Kolkata. Kachha houses have been damaged & trees uprooted. 21 teams have started working on ground in affected areas. Teams are busy with restoration & are helping the affected communities. says, DIG, NDRF Randeep Kumar Rana.

#CycloneAmphan

snippet.title: Will the Parties end politics over Migrants plight? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, The misery of lakhs of #Migrants has been reduced to political fodder for the BJP and Congress as they lock horns over a 1000 buses.

Aarti Subramaniam questions BJP's Dr Syed Zafar Islam about why these buses stuck at the border? 

Why does the party which isn't in power in U.P. for over 30-years have to come and offer buses? What's stopping the BJP govt in Centre & State from letting these people reach their homes. says, Congress' Radhika Khera.

American firm Moderna InC. tested an experimental vaccine for COVID19, called mRNA-1273, & initial results are positive.

Super Cyclone Amphan is expected to make landfall tomorrow. Dr M Mohapatra, Director General of IMD speaks to Aarti Subramaniam and explains the severity of the cyclone and also talks about the precautionary measures that can be taken.

Watch!

snippet.title: Is the journey back to home a pure torture? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, More than 75% of Delhi is open despite the fact that the state has reported more than 10,000 cases.

The simple act of just going back home has become a torturous journey for migrants. Sometimes I believe that it's possibly being done deliberately, because govt don’t want to lose them as they help in running the systems, industries etc. says,  Mirror Now  Managing Editor Vinay Tewari.

What will happen once the migrants reach their home states? Things don't get easier, as healthcare issues emerge. Are states equipped to handle the huge influx of migrants?

When our esteemed PM announced that we are going to have a Lockdown, if at that time our migrant workers were sent back home, we wouldn't have had such a problem, because that time the virus was still amongst elite of the cities. says, Public Health Expert Dr N Devadasan.

India's worst Coronavirus hotspot - Mumbai's Dharavi slums. With over 1300 positive cases reported, including 56 deaths, people can still be seen flouting social distancing norms in this densely populated slum.

Watch!

snippet.title: Are the Government's announcements a smokescreen? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Government announced ₹20 lakh crore stimulus package saying that it amounts to 10% of India's GDP. Now, many experts & Opposition is are questioning it.

Times Network's internal calculation shows the overall fiscal impact of these announcements is 1% of GDP.

RELIEF PACKAGE DECODED: The ₹3 lakh crore package has been announced for MSMEs. How much of that will actually translate into on-ground lending? says, HDFC Bank Chief Economist Abheek Barua.

We want something tangible & not just big numbers. I feel govt is staying away from us because they feel that the hospitality sector is luxury segment, not realizing that we're the largest employers. says,  National Restaurant Assoc Amrish Arora.

Watch!

snippet.title: City life eases but Migrants' misery continues? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, There is a contrast exist within our own country. a tale of two India's. both this India's got hit by Coronavirus. both of this went into a lockdown but right now, things are very different for some of us then the rest of Indians.

This is probably the worst migrant crisis since the Partition of India. Indian states have failed the migrants, the very migrants who helped build the cities that we live in. says, Mirror Now Managing Editor  Vinay Tewari.

Pramod Madhav tells us about the Lockdown 4.0 relaxations that have been made in Tamil Nadu and to what extent has life opened up in the state.

Karnataka held a cabinet meeting earlier today and a series of announcements were made.

snippet.title: How will your life change amid LOCKDOWN 4.0? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the special weekend edition of The Urban Debate, Mirror Now’s Tanvi Shukla get you all the details you need to know about the fourth phase of lockdown. The Central government has issued new guidelines with many relaxations in lockdown 4.0

The migrants, however, are still facing a humongous crisis; The labourers in Madhya Pradesh broke the police barricades, to enter the border, while, Migrant workers block Mathura-Agra highway and create a ruckus as no arrangements were being made for them to go back home. There was another Migrants clash at a screening Centre in Bihar's Sitamarhi; Additional force was called in to control the situation

snippet.title: Is India ignoring its biggest mental health crisis? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, United Nations warns of global emergency. In India, one of the reasons for people to face mental health problems is the lack of awareness & sensitivity about the issue, as there is a big stigma around it.

There's a huge population which is asymptomatic in mental health also. says, Moolchand Hospital Delhi Senior PsychiatristDr. Jitendra Nagpal.

As we're stuck at our homes during this Lockdown. How can we seek help?  Director of NIMHANS Dr. B N Gangadhar explains.

We need to focus on what's going to happen when things start easing, The challenge is how are we going to adapt to the 'new normal' again. We need to look at this crisis time as learning. says, Counsellor  Usha Krishnamurthy.

#MentalHealth

Watch!

#MentalHealth

snippet.description:
On Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, How are you going to ensure that these people find employment? What are the opportunities in your State that you'll look at?

Tanvi Shukla questions Health Minister of Chhattisgarh TS Singh Deo.

Malls are actually a place where social distancing can be ensured. We are all ready with the current situation. The brands in the malls are also organized, they will be cautious too. says, The Phoenix Mills Ltd Group COO Rashmi Sen.

snippet.title: Migrants exodus, Did States failed to address the biggest humanitarian crisis? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Despite all govt announcements, lakhs of Migrants continue to walk back home, covering thousands of kilometres on foot. Why are we failing to address the biggest humanitarian crisis India has seen in the recent past?

We're dropping Migrants to the borders because other States aren't taking their people inside. They're asking Maharashtra govt to do their COVID-19 testing. How can you do testing for so many people? It'll take more than a year to complete. says,  NCP's Clyde Crasto

First, we failed to understand that an entire set of the population will be stuck because of the decision, during this pandemic. We're asking Migrants to go online & register, pay for their commute. We've failed at every level of policymaking. Mirror Now asks to BJP's Vivek Subba Reddy.

Minister of Health & Family Welfare, Balbir Singh Sidhu speaks to Tanvi Shukla about the on-ground situation of Migrants in Punjab.

#MigrantMess

Watch!

snippet.title: PM Narendra Modi highlights 5 pillars of Indian economy | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,  Here are the 5 big takeaways incase you missed the speech this is what PM essentially said, 'The details of Lockdown 4.0 will be announced before May 18', 'Building an Self-reliance India', '20 lakh crores stimulus package for all the sectors, details will be announced by the FM'. 

What's the larger expectation? The 10% GDP relief package, that has been announced, how do you wish to see it allocated? Mirror Now asks to  L&T Infrastructure Development Projects Limited Director & CEO Shailesh Pathak.

Everybody needs a job. If the agriculture sector could feed their families, urbanization & migration of workers from villages to cities wouldn't have taken place. says, Raheja Developers  Chairman & MD Navin M Raheja.

#ModiMangalSandesh #AatmaNirbharBharat

snippet.title: Are the States misusing COVID-19 crisis? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,  Why are States changing the Labour Laws amid COVID-19 crisis? 

How can such changes impact firms, their workers, and the economy? Economic Times Editor R Sriram  explains!

I don't see how suspension of Labour laws will create any greater employment. What we're doing is not going to contribute to the country's interest. It is no where a COVID-19 related contingency. says, Swaraj India National President Yogendra Yadav.

Bhartiya Mazdoor Sangh had said that changes in Labour laws, from a 'License Raj' will lead to 'Jungle Raj'. What is the biggest concern here? Mirror Now asks to Maharashtra Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh  State Secy Anil Dhumane.

snippet.title: 15 Trains gets green signal, Full-fledged service & flight operations next? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Currently, the 5th meeting between CMs & Prime Minister Narendra Modi is underway. CM of Telangana & Tamil Nadu have opposed the resumption of train services. What should be India's strategy to open up public transport and when should it happen?

At this stage when demand itself is going to be very weak, consumer sentiment is very low, if we restrict a significant portion of the market, it's going to be very difficult for the industry to resume operations. says, Consulting & Research CAPA  Manager  Amit Thakran.

The virus is here to stay. There’s no perfect time for opening up. It is a calculated risk but we need to take such risks. says,  Public Health Expert and Senior Researcher George Institute of Global Health India  Dr Oommen John.

Tune in!

snippet.title: Is Mumbai failing COVID-19 war? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, This entire week we have been telling you the story of Mumbai.  in fact for many weeks we have been constantly tracking this data to raise the alarm on the status of affairs in Mumbai. with the steep rise in cases specially in last one week since the month of May really began. 

Question now been asked on the handling of the cases?

Today the state Government has confessed that the Municipal Commissioner was not doing the job. This action should have been taken 5 weeks back. says, BJP's Rajeev Panday. 

Mumbai Civic Body chief has been shunted out. What more proof do we need of the fact that the #Mumbai situation has not been handled properly? Tanvi Shukla asks to Congress' Charan Singh Sapra.

Watch!

snippet.title: Vizag Gas Leak: Is industrial safety being compromised? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Vizag gas leak news today, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy has announced ₹1 crore each as a relief to the next of kin of the deceased. Are we prepared to handle such disasters?

“We were in a situation where either, we were forced to breathe in the poisonous gas or not breathe at all. When I came out of my house I saw scores of people running for their lives.” says, A Vizag gas leak survivor Balasouri K recounts the ordeal.

For different chemicals there are different SoPs to safeguard oneself. People who live in such areas should be aware of these SoPs & the local district administration should also help them. says, NDRF IG Amrendra Senger.

#VizagGasLeak

snippet.title: COVID-19 takes toll on tourism, How are Hotels dealing with the challenge? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Tourism shut, hospitality industry struggles. What is the way forward for India's hotels? Watch top voices from the industry in an exclusive conversation.

OYO Hotels & Home, India & South Asia, CEO Rohit Kapoor talks about the COVID-19 impact on the hospitality industry and how they're managing it.

We don't see any form of business coming pack now till mid-November. says, Chalet Hotels Ltd. CEO & MD Sanjay Sethi.

The app isn't in compliance with the provisions of Indian Cyber Law being the Information Technology Act, 2000. On cyber-security it does lip-service. says, Cyber Law Expert Dr Pavan Duggal.

snippet.title: Corona count in Mumbai reaches 10k mark, Is State Government failing the war? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, 4days, 2133 cases, 1 city- Mumbai. The COVID hospital beds are filling up fast & shortage of healthcare professionals is a big concern. There is no clarity on govt orders & no transparency in COVID data. 

The number of cases is a concern. We were coming down but we are now climbing up. A peak is expected between May 15 & May 30 & we have to prepare for that. However, there are some signals in the right direction. says,  Indian College of Physicians Dean Dr Shashank Joshi.

snippet.title: COVID-19 biggest economic fallout, People rendered jobless during lockdown | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Biggest Economic Fallout of COVID-19. According to the latest CMIE report, the unemployment rate in India has spiked to an all-time high of 27.1% for April 2020 & 12.2 crore jobs have been lost across sectors.

We're talking about job loss of 4-5 million just in govt sector & if you could translate that to, across entire textile chain, you could end up seeing a Job-Loss of 10 million people. says,  Clothing Manufacturers Association of India (CMAI) President Rahul Mehta.

I think if the govt is firm on implementing the norms of social distancing, we can solve this problem without getting into extreme action. We've to open up more, we can't shut the economy forever. says, CIABC Director General Vinod Giri.

#JobLoss #LiquorShops

On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Biggest Economic Fallout of COVID-19. According to the latest CMIE report, the unemployment rate in India has spiked to an all-time high of 27.1% for April 2020 & 12.2 crore jobs have been lost across sectors.

I think if the govt is firm on implementing the norms of social distancing, we can solve this problem without getting into extreme action. We've to open up more, we can't shut the economy forever. says, CIABC Director General Vinod Giri.

#JobLoss #LiquorShops

snippet.title: Delhi School Boys on Police radar for online chat, Where are we going wrong? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Delhi schoolboys on police radar for their online chat objectifying girls, sharing morphed images & chats on gang-raping girls. And this isn't the first instance! Where are we going wrong? Is there a regulation aspect that needs to be brought in? 

We need to formulate a policy by training teachers, as to what role they can play. Teachers need to look beyond their role of just teaching in the classroom. says, Indian Association of Teachers Educators Regional Secretary West Prof. Sanjeev Sonawane.

The child should be made aware that once legal action is taken, his entire future is in jeopardy. That should be a part of education. The existence of laws should be explained. says,  Former Commissioner of Delhi Police Neeraj Kumar.

#BoisLockerRoom 

Watch!

snippet.title: Real Estate industry heavyweights on reviving the economy | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Spotlight on the economy & continuing the conversation on India Revival Mission. after 6 weeks of lockdown, we have now entered lockdown 3.0 with lot more relaxation & relief coming in for the industry.  

All the States need to open up factories as well as partial opening of IT offices. A lot of people internationally aren't happy. I think what Delhi CM said is correct, the opening up needs to be done quickly now. says, NAREDCO Dr Niranjan Hiranandani.

The longer it takes to revive the industry, I fear that a lot of young educated people will not have jobs. We can't wait longer anymore, we're highly capital intensive industry. says, Lemon Tree Hotels Ltd. Deputy MD Rattan Keswani.

#IndiaRevivalMission

snippet.title: Lockdown 3.0 in action, What will be it's impact? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) issued an order on Friday to extend the nationwide lockdown for two weeks beyond its May 4 deadline albeit with relaxations in the orange and green zones.

The guidelines given by the Centre has put the maximum onus & responsibility on the states to take a call. The guidelines still need a larger picture taking into consideration the stakeholders. says, AIADMK Kovai Sathyan. 

Are the relaxations in line with the kind of results we have seen in the past 5 weeks of lockdown, in terms of cases and recovery rate? PHFI Public Health System Support Vice President Dr Preeti Kumar shares her views.

#LockdownExtension

snippet.title: New Lockdown order for 2 weeks, Is relaxation allowed in your city? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, After a comprehensive review and in view of the lockdown measures having led to significant gains in the Covid-19 situation, the government has decided to further extend the lockdown till May 17th. 

I think what the entire guidelines have missed out on from the central govt, are the daily wage earners, these people have no source of income. says, AAP's Preeti Menon.

SEZs & export units will be open. Now, the question is how will you get workers there, because public transport isn't allowed. There's a difference between making an announcement & seeing its pragmatic on-ground delivery. says, Congress' Aadil Singh Boparai.

#Lockdown3

In terms of online delivery, we should open up for non-essential products as well. In Red Zones, we'll have to maintain lockdown & use the time to move to South Korea model. says, Former Vice-Chairman of NITI Aayog Arvind Panagariya.

snippet.title: Why migrants are lockdown's biggest victim? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Lakhs of migrants stranded away from their homes without money, shelter or food, awaiting attention & help. We don't have a clear policy to take care of these migrant workers making them the biggest victims of the lockdown! 

We have asked the Centre for a clear cut guideline on how to send these migrant workers back. As soon as we get the guidelines we will send all of these workers home. says, Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Nawab Malik.

ICMR says the Rapid Test Kits from 2 Chinese firms will be sent back. It has also advised states to not use test kits from these 2 suppliers.

Maharashtra is conducting the highest number of tests in the country. As of yesterday, we've tested 1,08,000 people. More testing we do, the more numbers will come up, more people can be treated. says, NCP's Clyde Crasto.

snippet.title: Ramzan in the time of COVID-19, Pray at home & stay safe | The Urban debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Starting from 23rd of this month, the holy month of Ramzan will begin. one month usually of fasting, prayers & festivities of meeting love once. but unfortunately this time Ramzan is happening in middle of the Pandemic & middle of a lockdown. 

The message is for everyone to observe Ramzan and all its practices individually & with their families at home. As it is said in the Quran, 'if you save one life, you save humanity.' says, Dargah Ajmer Sharif,  Haji Syed Salman Chishty.

Why is it that, when it comes to Maharashtra, you are only interested in Mumbai & Pune but, when it comes to West Bengal, you have a long list of districts that the Centre wants to look at? Tanvi Shukla asks to BJP's Gopal Agarwal.

Watch!

snippet.title: Coronavirus count spikes, Is it too soon to dilute lockdown? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, 80% cases were asymptomatic so far & roughly 1000 new cases everyday. Are we moving too quickly in terms of bringing in relaxations?

Couple of days ago we had tested 736 people out of which 186 were COVID positive but asymptomatic and that's a bigger worry. AAP's Raghav Chadha explains why the Delhi Government decided to not bring in any lockdown relaxations in the capital.

snippet.title: 80% COVID-19 cases are asymptomatic; How will India deal with this?| The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, India's new challenge, infected but no symptoms. Does this mean that we need to change our policies slightly more? What is the solution? Do we step up our testing? 

Lot of people are going for testing, but might be hiding their symptoms. We should consider this. Disclosure of symptoms is voluntary. A simple thing like lack of smell can also be a symptom. says,  Lilavati Hospital & DEAN of Indian College of Physicians  Dr Shashank Joshi.

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Should India restrategise testing protocol? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Spotlight is on testing strategies. do we need to ramp it up? we have experts to guide on the strategies & how can it be implemented.

We can't look at Rapid testing in isolation. There has to be a complementary algorithm. says, Institute of Infectious Diseases, Pune & Member of Covid19 taskforce Director Dr Sanjay Pujari.

Chairman & MD of Medanta Dr Naresh Trehan says, India is late in the cycle as compared to the rest of the world, which is an advantage. These Rapid testing kits will become more accurate & we will have a better idea. This has been a grace period for India.

#IndiaFightsCoronavirus

Watch!

snippet.title: Lockdown 2.0 guidelines issued, How does it impact you? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, What we think needs to be explain to you about Governments new lockdown guidlines. 

Government today came out with new set of rules, there have been some relaxation & some amount of relief for the rural sector. 

There is a debate on life or livelihood. The first 21 days of the lockdown, we were clear it was life. Now we know livelihood is important too. says, Former National President Of All India Manufacturers Organization K.E. Raghunathan. 

There are 3 parts to the whole chain: production, transportation and distribution. The question is where can we allow economic activity with limited amounts of people movement. says, Secretary General of FICCI Dilip Chenoy.

#Lockdown2

Watch!

snippet.title: Do hotspots hold key to India's battle against COVID-19? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, A large group of migrant labourers gathered in Bandra, demanding permission to return to their native states. They later dispersed after police and local leaders intervened and asked them to vacate.

Delivery of 37 lakh rapid testing kits awaited. Is this delay now becoming a concern? What are India's options of using the available testing kits or importing them from elsewhere?  Medical Director of Apollo Hospital Group Dr Anupam Sibal responds. 

Around 2000 migrant workers also gathered in Surat demanding that they be sent back home.

#LockdownImpact

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Does India have enough COVID-19 testing kits? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Are we testing enough? Does India have enough testing kits?

snippet.title: Who is responsible for the Markaz mayhem? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Mirror Now asks Mujeeb Ur Rehman, Advocate & Representative of Tablighi Jamaat: The first round of advisories came in the first week of March & by mid March, mass gatherings were not allowed. Don't you think it was the organizer's responsibility to inform about such a thing?

Police is not working independently. The Markaz meeting was attended by people who came to the country under tourist visa. They thus violated the tourist visa norm saying that they cannot participate in such activities. says, BJP's Sudesh Verma.

#MarkazMayhem

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Nizamuddin Markaz incident creating a major scare not just in the national capital but across the country, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday assured that his government would not hesitate to take strict action in the matter. 

Since the matter came to light on Monday evening, Kejriwal said a total of 1,548 people has been brought out of the Markaz building located in Nizamuddin West.

snippet.title: How can government money reach those with no accounts? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Unorganised sector bears the brunt. More than simply giving money, what's necessary is to give supplies of essentials.

South-African govt also announced 21 day Lock-down, but they gave 4 days notice, in our country State government got 4 hours. It's impossible to make arrangements in 4 hours regardless of the package. says,  Prof. of Economics at Centre for Informal Sector and Labour Studies, JNU Santosh Mehrotra.

#21DaysLockdown

Watch!

snippet.title: India Lockdown: How can we help migrants on the move? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, Want to know how can you help the migrant workers during the 21 Days Lockdown? 

Former IAS Officer, Kannan Gopinathan says,  Firstly, we need clarity on lockdown situation to plan anything. If we don't allow this migration, we're going to see urban unemployment & hunger crisis. We didn't think of reverse migration when cities would go in lockdown.

#21DaysLockdown

snippet.title: Coronavirus Fight: Why Government must help thousands walking home? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Hungry, Thirsty, Stranded. Thousands of migrant workers, living in big cities across the states, are walking back to their villages because they have no other option. 

This is a policy-induced disaster. Why is it that passenger trains were cancelled first & flights were cancelled in the end? Is it that these people don't figure in our priority? says, National President Yogendra Yadav.

#CoronavirusLockdown

snippet.title: Coronavirus War: Is India sitting on a community transmission time bomb? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,  Now Coronavirus cases from crowded clusters are emerging.

Everyone should be in #lockdown. In some pockets of the country, people still cluster together & think that they will not be affected. We should respect the curfew. says, Member of Maharashtra task force Dr Gautam Bhansali.

World Health Organization (WHO) Dr. David Nabarro speaks about India's Lockdown and China's initial response to Coronavirus.

#21DayLockdown

snippet.title: Coronavirus Lockdown: Food is available but where are the suppliers? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,  It's Lock-down Day 2, Enough food, but where are the suppliers? 

Mirror Now's Disha Shah  visited the APMC market in Vashi in Maharashtra to find out how the availability of stock has been affected & if there has been a change in the prices of vegetables. 

Grofers CEO Amit Sachdeva says, The initial disruption in the supply chain has put us back by around 4,00,000 orders. Our foremost priority is to get our warehouses up and running.

#LockdownDay2

Watch!

snippet.title: Coronavirus Lockdown: Why smooth supply of essentials critical right now? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Taking questions from people of his Lok Sabha constituency - Varanasi - on day one of the national quarantine, Modi said “Mahabharata was won in 18 days. The war being fought by the whole country will take 21 days. We hope to win it the next 21 days”. 

We wrote to Home Minister & he replied saying that action would be taken. We were assured that police would reach & sensitise entire community about this: Dr Srinivas Rajkumar T, AIIMS Resident Doctors Association, on doctors being asked to vacate their residences

#21DayLockDown

snippet.title: Coronavirus warriors face cruel society & high handed Cops | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,  Ostracised, Harassed, Assaulted. Corona Warriors face a cruel society & high handed cops. Mirror Now shares details of 6 incidents where essential service providers were attacked. 

Amrita Shah, a Private Airline staffer speaks to Tanvi Shukla and shares her ordeal of facing harassment from her neighbours, as people accused her of having & spreading the Coronavirus. 

"I was slapped and dragged by my hair to the police station" Dr Himabindu shares her ordeal of how she was allegedly assaulted by a cop in Telangana's Khammam.

#CoronaWarriorsAttacked

snippet.title: Coronavirus war intensifies, What are the things Centre & States should do next? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, How do we ensure that we don't get in a situation worse than what it is today? What should be the top priority for the Centre & States? Here are 5 things that should be on India's priority list. 

Coronavirus Survivor Rohit Dutta speaks to Mirror Now.  Listen in as he narrates the ordeal. 

Rohit Dutta, Coronavirus Survivor: Maintain isolation & don't ever think the virus cannot affect you. It can happen to anyone & once you get it, 28 days of your life are gone.

snippet.description:

#IndiaFightsCoronavirus

snippet.title: Coronavirus Impact: Should worship places asks devotees to pray at home? The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,  Many places of worship have shut down but there are few which are still functional. Hundreds of devotees have been lining up. During a pandemic, a mass gathering is a ticking time bomb. So, should places of worship ask devotees to pray at home? 

Manjinder Singh Sirsa, Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee says, It is a matter of faith & it is difficult to ask people to stay away from religious places. But it is also about the lives of the people. Religious leaders should come together to address the issue.

#IndiaFightsCoronavirus

snippet.title: Coronavirus Outbreak: Mass gathering rule for public, Not for Netas? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Number of Coronavirus cases in India rises to 114. While India has intensified its fight against the pandemic, Netas are flouting the no gathering rule. Is the mass gathering rule only for the public & not the Netas? 

The basic problem with the leaders is that they consider themselves above the law. They make laws only for others. says, Political Analyst Ravi Srivastava.

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Delhi Riots: Has HM Amit Shah silenced opposition on inaction charge? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,  Today in the Parliament, it was a fiery discussion, a fiery debate. 19 days since Delhi riots, it started with Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury of the Congress party leading the attacks for the opposition party in the Lok-Sabha followed by the response of BJP & BJP's MP Meenakshi Lekhi.

snippet.title: Are Gandhis leading Congress to destruction? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Young and restless  in Congress! What triggered the resignation of Jyotiraditya Scindia? 

The answer lies in the Rajya Sabha elections in which Scindia was the strong contender but with pressure tactics from Digvijaya Singh and Kamal Nath, the party was not able to decide on candidates, said a source. Are the Gandhi's leading  the Congress to destruction?

snippet.title: U.P Government's banner on Anti-CAA protesters highly unjust? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Allahabad High-Court orders U.P government to remove all posters put up by U.P Police  that named & shamed people accused of violence during Anti-CAA stir. Is it right to make accused's identity public? 

What Yogi Govt did in U.P wasn't wrong. There was no ill intention. It was only done to tell people that those  people on the hoardings were indulged in creating ruckus on rods during Anti-CAA Protests. says BJP's Anila Singh.

Tanvi Shukla to Kailash Vasdev Sr SC Advocate, U.P Govt says that if the people who have been named are upset, they can take it up with the Government. Why is the Court interfering?

snippet.title: Yes Bank Crisis:  Could RBI have prevented the Aam Aadmi's pain? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, The banking regulator dissolved the board of directors of the Yes Bank and took control of the bank for a period of 30 days till April 3 and placed some restrictions on transactions. The bank lent a lot to stressed corporates like IL&FS, DHFL, ADAG group and Vodafone Idea, the FM said. 

Yes Bank, being a private bank, RBI has got better & direct control & therefore, RBI could help them out, while PMC, being a cooperative bank, we need to reform better. says, BJP's Vishwas Pathak.

#YesBankCrisis

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Andhra Pradesh approves 3-capitals; Are multiple state capitals a boon or bane? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
Original Release Date: 20th January 2020

On The Urban Debate;

Story 1: Andhra Pradesh Capital Row
Andhra Pradesh Cabinet has cleared the proposal for three capital cities. The bill was introduced in Assembly amidst massive protest. The capital cities are going to be Amaravati, Kannur, Vishakapatnam. Amaravati will continue being the Legislative capital; Kannur will become the judicial capital and Vishakapatnam will become the executive capital. 
Are multiple state capitals a boon or bane?

Story 2: The Jallikattu Debate
The Jallikattu event is going on in the state of Tamil Nadu since Pongal and has unfortunately already become a part of a big controversy with 6 people being killed and over a 100 being injured.
Is the sport about culture or animal cruelty?

Tune in!

snippet.title: 4 red flags about rogue Cop that were ignored, J&K Police's 'Terrorist Friend'? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban debate with Tanvi Shukla, Davinder Singh is under investigation for his alleged role in helping Hizbul Mujahideen commander, Naveed Baba, and Altaf to escape from Kashmir. The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Tuesday issued a clarification, saying Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) Davinder Singh, who was arrested on Saturday, have not been awarded any gallantry or meritorious medal by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). "Only gallantry medal awarded to him during his service is by the erstwhile J&K State on Independence Day 2018," said police.

snippet.title: Can facial recognition software be misused? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
We're not saying it's wrong to use technology to maintain law & order or to track down terrorists, but if indeed the accuracy of this system is not even 50%, should there not be more rules & regulation to govern this? If something is done to protect the people, what kind of misuse can be done? It’s assured that police do not have the time to misuse such technologies because they are too busy with their duties: BJP's Vinit Goenka to Tanvi Shukla on surveillance software. Shouldn't there be regulations on who can use the surveillance software and where? Tune in!

snippet.title: SHOCKING Whatsapp Chats of School Teens about Gangrape, Homophobia & Violence | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, 8 boys from a top school in #Mumbai suspended after their WhatsApp group chat about raping their classmates came to light.
As we talk about Women Safety, we should educate the men & boys. If we are not doing it in the correct way for our generation, we are in big trouble. 
Are we a good environment for our youngsters to be brought up in? Are we imbibing the right kind of values, helping them distinguish between what’s right & not?

Listen to your kids & imbibe them with right values because if we don’t, then it’ll be a problem later.

snippet.title: Are Political Parties fueling unrest in Universities? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Thousands of students across India are leading the protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act.
A group of over 500 students and faculty of top educational institutions including those from IIM Ahmedabad, IIM Indore, IIT Madras, Gujarat University and AMU have written an open letter, denouncing the amended citizenship act.

"The Act is discriminatory and violative of the basic structure of the Indian Constitution. It is inconsistent with the cherished values of equality under law and secularism," they wrote in the open letter.

Umar Khalid, JNU Alumni: The Govt, rather than starting a dialogue, listening to students & responding to them, they snapped the internet, beat up students to pulp and then you’re saying it’s no big deal?

Why is the govt afraid to listen to us? They are suppressing our voices down. JMI Law student Safiyat Naseema & BJP's Aman Sinha debate over merits of #CitizenshipAmendmentAct

snippet.title: Is the New Citizenship Law Divisive? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, 
The citizenship Amendment Bill (CAB) 2019 cleared the second major hurdle when Rajya Sabha passed it with a majority of 125 against 105.

Vinay Tewari, Managing Editor: While the govt has managed to pass the floor test in Rajya Sabha, the 2 biggest challenges for the govt start from here on, the uproar in North-East & the likely legal challenge that may come to this case

Is the religious persecution so grave in Bangladesh & Pakistan that we wanted to bring in a law for these 2 countries & not talk about Sri Lankans or Tibetans in our country? Tanvi Shukla to Sr Journalist Neerja Chowdhury

snippet.title: Russia banned from world sports, Is Citizenship Amendment Bill constitutional? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, India is divided right now over the Citizenship Amendment Bill. The bill has been cleared by the Lok Sabha and in a rare occurrence, the Lok Sabha debate an issue for 8 hours non-stop till almost midnight and then voted on it and passed the bill. After the Lok Sabha passed the bill, massive protests erupted across the north-east with the demand of scrapping the bill.

Is the BJP's new political ploy constitutional?

For the second time in history, Russia has been banned for a period of four years from competing in any international sporting events. They were slapped with a blanket ban after a wide range of doping scandal was exposed.

snippet.title: Women still being betrayed & abandoned by cops; Who will make Police accountable? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, Tanvi Shukla narrates the horrific story of a woman who was gang-raped by 5 men in Hajipur, Bihar. Turned away by railway police, she sat outside another police station waiting for a complaint to be registered. 
Where is the outrage now? 

What's changed after the country outraged on #WomanSafety? Indian women are still being betrayed, let down & abandoned by cops. Those who are turned away are being attacked with fire, acid & being set ablaze. Why has cry for justice fallen silent? 
Will action be taken against those policemen who fail to do their jobs? 

#KhakiShamed

snippet.title: Is India witnessing unprecedented economic crisis? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, India's economy hit an unprecedented slowdown. The GDP has come down by over 3.5% in less than a year.  The last time we had a debate on the #EconomicCrisis, we barely had 10-12 percent in attendance and those who were in attendance were sleeping, do the ministers understand the gravity of this grave situation?

Mirror Now's Tanvi Shukla to BJP’s Gopal Krishna Agarwal: How is it that from 8%, in the beginning of this year, we’ve come down to 4.5%. The RBI said we’ll grow over 7% but, now they say we’ll grow at 5%. Did we get the match wrong? Or is the economy in that kind of a free-fall? 

We ask - What's going on? What do we do to stop this?

Watch for more details.

snippet.title: Aghadi govt takes charge; What should be Uddhav’s priority? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we focus on what the people of Maharashtra expects from the newly formed government.

We put 5 Big questions before the political parties that have come to power in Maharashtra:

1. Will Maha Aghadi derail Modi's Bullet train?
2. Will Uddhav save Mumbai's trees?
3. When will India's financial capital get world-class roads?
4.1200 suicides this year, How will Maha Aghadi save the farmers?
5.  Does Uddhav have a plan for Maha Jobs crisis?

Your first example of great governance was how civic body runs Mumbai. Every year people die due to potholes or flooding, so please don't give that example & say, that's how governance will happen. That really scares us!
Tanvi Shukla to Shiv Sena's G Radhakrishnan

snippet.title: Gujarat HC raps state police; is police going soft on accused Nithyananda? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, we discuss the Nithyananda case, Swami Nithyananda has been accused in a rape case and is now also accused of kidnapping and torturing children. The Gujarat High Court slams state police while hearing a writ petition filed by the father of the 2 girls who have been kidnapped & restrained in Nithyananda's ashram; directs cops to use all mechanisms available to produce the girls before the court by December 10. 
After which four more parents have filed a habeas corpus in the Gujarat HC, says, our children are not allowed to leave the ashram and we are not being allowed to meet them.

snippet.title: Children & Elderly are becoming sick; Does anyone care for the Delhiites? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,

Story 1 North India Chokes

25 out of 29 MPs skip key pollution meet called by Parliament's Standing Committee on Urban Development meeting. 5 Top Bureaucrats from Environment Ministry & the Municipal Corporations also bunk. What's going on? Why don't the Netas care? 
The central govt run by the BJP didn't ensure their top bureaucrats attend this meeting or their MPs attend this meeting. What commitment are you talking about here? Tanvi Shukla hits at BJP's Anila Singh 

Story 2 J&K Internet clampdown continues

Its been 100 days since interne tservices have been suspended in Jammu and Kashmir after special status for J&K was revoked.

Story 3 Is Government ignoring the Economic Slowdown?

Big drop in spending in Rural India. Spending dips for 1st time in 40 years but govt. ignores and junks findings citing data issues.

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,

Story 1 Online Child Sexual Abuse

In the past one year, 15,190 complaints of online child sexual abuse were received by the govt but only 31 http://F.I.Rs  were registered and the CBI has now set up an anti-child abuse unit.
Is the govt portal only for perception, not action?

snippet.title: MLA's rewarded for abandoning Government; No deterrent for turncoat Netas? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,

Story 1 Karnataka Bypoll Election

The BJP top leadership has announced nominations for 13 of the 15 Karnataka Assembly seats set to face bypolls on December 5. And they all go to 13 disqualified MLAs who joined the party just hours before the tickets were announced on November 14.
The disqualified MLAs have changed parties, have gotten a ticket, will fight elections & hope to become MLAs again. That's not a deterrent at all. We need stronger laws because our politicians are greedy, power-hungry & thick-skinned and that needs to change now.
Kailash Vasdev, Senior SC Advocate says"The entire concept of the convention, to have a stable govt, to have democratic principles in Parliament or in the state assembly, to run a country in accordance with law is now forgotten."
Should the law be changed to punish turncoat Netas? Do we need a stronger deterrent?

Story 2 Is Law and Order a joke for U.P. Police?

After "Thain Thain", Cops gallop on batons.
Does this look like a good re-vamp of the police dept that is being done by the govt? Shouldn't they actually have access to horses, functional guns & proper training?

WATCH!

snippet.title: Should courts intervene in the matter of faith and religion? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, it's Tradition Vs Equality as the Supreme Court gave its judgement on the Sabrimala Temple case today.
Reading out a majority verdict, Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi said the question of whether women of all ages should be allowed into Sabarimala is part of a larger debate. Whether the Supreme Court should review its decision to end the ban on women between 10 and 50 entering Kerala's Sabarimala Temple will be taken up by a larger seven-judge bench.
A number of petitions were filed after the SC verdict in September last year sparked violent protests in Kerala. CJI remarked, "The endeavour of the petitioners was to revive debate on religion and faith."

This is about our fundamental right. We're coming forward for our right to equality & right to pray that has been given to us: Trupti Desai, Founder of Bhumata Brigade to Tanvi Shukla
#RightToPray
#SabarimalaCase #SabrimalaTemple

snippet.title: Govt fails, Delhi chokes; Do government's have a 'Plan B'? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, The Delhi-NCR region chokes on the toxic air again this year. The pollution was on the severe category for the second day proving that the governments are failing repeatedly to curb pollution. Despite the Supreme Court stepping in and giving very clear instructions to the governments. The top court has also issued notices to the government for the rising toxic levels in air quality over the NCR. 'Very Little constructive steps have been taken to curb pollution,' says Supreme Court. 

The Supreme Court will be pronouncing its judgement in the review petitions challenging the judgement of 28 September 2018 which is related to the entry of the women inside the temple. Listen in!

snippet.title: Is it justified for courtrooms to be shut and justice to be blocked? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:

snippet.title: Shiv Sena's deadline over; Is Maharashtra heading towards President's rule? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, the deadline given by the governor to Shiv Sena was 7.30 pm today. The Shiv Sena team led by Aaditya Thackeray reached the governor's residence but till the end of the meeting, there was no letter of confirmation given by either NCP or Congress to lend their support to Shiv Sena. The Governor refused to give any more time to the party. 
Is the state of Maharashtra heading towards President's rule or is there still a possibility of a 'bits and pieces" government?

snippet.title: Maharashtra’s Game of Thrones; 13 days on, still no government formed | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, what's cooking in the Maharashtra Political Pot?
Power tussle in Maharashtra continues as Shiv Sena hints at the end of the alliance.'If BJP leaders are meeting Governor tomorrow to stake claim then they should form the government as they are the single largest party', says Sanjay Raut, Shiv Sena MP
Politics in Maharashtra has fired up since the BJP said a new government will be in place in the next 48 hours. Despite the BJP-Sena alliance winning a clear majority together, Sena's demand for a "50:50" shot at the chief minister's post and the BJP's refusal to accept it has blocked government formation in one of India's largest states. With the term of the current Maharashtra Assembly ending on November 9 and the government formation stand-off still unresolved, a delegation of the BJP, the single largest party in the House, will meet Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Thursday.  

Watch the video for more details!

snippet.title: Protectors demand protection; where have these policemen been failed? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, unprecedented protests within police ranks. Top Delhi cops heckled and booed by their own force personnel. Delhi cops protest outside police headquarters in Delhi. Family members of Delhi Police personnel march towards India Gate to protest in Delhi.
Protesting Delhi Police list their demands: 
- Arrest lawyers involved in violence
- Take back security from judges & courts
- No leniency by traffic cops towards lawyers  
Delhi L-G Anil Baijal issues a statement; appeals to maintain law & harmony. The L-G in his statement said that Cheif secretary will oversee the situation & also ensured that the best possible treatment will be given to injured cops & lawyers

snippet.title: Modi Government vs WhatsApp: Did centre sleep over warnings from Facebook? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate tonight, we discuss the biggest privacy breach of recent times.
Modi government has been blamed for ignoring two separate warnings issued by Facebook-owned WhatsApp. As per PTI, WhatsApp had informed the Indian government of spyware in May 2019 and September 2019 that 121 Indian users were targeted by Israeli spyware Pegasus.
The defence stated by Centre are as follows:
1. WhatsApp only shared "Technical Jargon"
2. WhatsApp refused to divulge the identities of those targeted
3. The letter was still too vague to be alarming

Did the centre sleep on the warnings from facebook?
#WhatsApp

snippet.title: Killer air sweeps across 5 states; will Odd-even be an effective solution?| The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On Urban Debate tonight, we discuss the politics surrounding the alarming air pollution levels of North India.

A huge part of our country is blanketed today with toxic smog and it has been that way since past few days. Instead of finding a solution for this issue, our politicians are busy bickering among themselves.
The odd-even road rationing scheme, which started as part of the pollution control measures of the Delhi government, faced the scrutiny of the Supreme Court today as the judges looked for a long-term plan to ensure clean air at the national capital. The court questioned the Delhi government what has been achieved by the odd-even scheme and asked that government supply figures regarding the impact of the road rationing.

#NorthIndiaChokes

snippet.description:

National Anthem becomes test for patriotism. While some ask what's the harm in standing up for 52 seconds, others ask why play national anthem in a theater, as patriotism must come from within. Where do you stand?

snippet.title: Delhi illegal colonies to be regularised,Missing children not priority for India | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate,

Story No 1: India's missing children:

As per India's crime registry, 173 children go missing every single day in this country. The Father of a minor girl who went missing 6-months ago from Mumbai's Chembur committed suicide. Data shows 63,000 children went missing in 2017. Are cops doing a shoddy job in missing children cases?
Mirror Now spoke to the mother of the victim. Listen in!

Story No 2: Regularisation of Illegal colonies

Big decision ahead of Delhi polls, the centre has changed the fortunes of nearly 40 lakh people living in 1800 illegal slums in Delhi. It is something that has been promised for years by successful political parties that they are going to regularise the illegal colonies and give the people their right to own the land. BJP & AAP continue to clamour for credit. 

WATCH!

snippet.description:

#TwoChildPolicy

Monsoon mayhem continues in the Southern coastal region. Five people have died in rain-related incidents in Karnataka and close to 200 people have been evacuated. #KarnatakaFloods

snippet.title: Man tortured to death by cops in Uttar Pradesh & BMC fails pothole test | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
Story 1 : #KhakiShame

Police brutality in its worst form. A suspect was tortured to death in front of his 11-year-old son. Why are guilty policemen still not behind bars? Who is accountable for such actions of the people who are entrusted with the safety of society? Is it free run for men in khaki in Uttar Pradesh?

What kind of new law is this where a murder accused will be arrested only after the investigation is finished? I haven't heard of this till now: Mirror Now's Tanvi Shukla hits at BJP's Rahul Trivedi.

Story 2: #PotholeMenace

BMC vigilance department conducts a probe and admits that 96% of the roads inspected by the inquiry panel were in bad shape. Does BMC need a complete structural overhaul?

Urban Planner & Researcher, Kedarnath Rao Ghorpade explains the technical details of the causes of potholes

snippet.title: NCR battles Air pollution & Flipkart, Amazon deals under Govt scanner | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On Urban Debate tonight,

Story 1: #stubbleburning

Is stubble burning the main reason for the worsening condition of NCR Air quality?

With the air quality in Delhi-NCR crossing the 'very poor' mark, concerns over the sources of pollution have started to emerge. Apart from the regular vehicular and industrial emissions, a significant amount of pollution is attributed to the stubble-burning activities in northern states post-monsoon. Now, environmentalists and even the Delhi government are highlighting that, despite regulations, farmers have continued to burn crops this year.

Story 2: Should the government regulate online discounts?

Are E-commerce giants flouting norms to weed out shopkeepers? Union minister warns E-commerce giants against huge discounts being offered. 

Watch the video to know more details!

snippet.title: India slips down the Hunger Index, Is India's food policy flawed? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, India's ranking has slipped down to 102 on the Global Hunger Index. According to the Global Hunger Index 2019, India has the highest wasting rate among any other country in the world. India is behind Pakistan, North Korea, and Burkina Faso among other nations. The index assesses progress and setbacks in combating hunger faced by countries across the globe. 

Is India's food policy flawed?

snippet.title: Dullest election in the State's history & CM Khattar takes a dig at Sonia Gandhi | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, With roughly 10-days to go before #MaharashtraAssemblyPolls, the state is witnessing perhaps its most low key election campaign.

What are political parties promising? Why are candidates not meeting citizens before polls? Maharashtra voters demand answers! Will this lead to an even lower turn out in Mumbai?

What is the Chief Minister talking about in these rallies if you don't have a Manifesto? Article 370? Is that your poll agenda? Mirror Now's Tanvi Shukla questions BJP's Shaina NC. Listen in.

We also discuss, An ugly discourse of #HaryanaAssemblyElections2019 campaign. CM Manohar Lal Khattar takes a dig at Congress president Sonia Gandhi. While Congress' Nitin Raut calls CM Khattar, 'khachhar' Are voters' issues being ignored in Haryana?

#MaharashtraAssemblyPolls #MaharashtraElections2019

snippet.title: Jammu and Kashmir clampdown, Immigrants blamed for crimes in Delhi & more | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

Story 1: #JammuAndKashmir Clampdown

Day 70 of Jammu And Kashmir Clampdown: As postpaid mobile services resume in the valley. Let's take a look at the other facilities that still remain under the shadow.


Story 2: #Delhi rising crime problem

Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari links the high crime rate in the capital to the presence of illegal immigrants in the region and supports NRC in Delhi. But is NRC the starting point for Delhi's rising crime problem?

Story 3: #KeralaCyanideMurders

Cyanide Jolly case gets murkier. Political links emerge in the case. Crime branch raids residence & shops of Senior Muslim League leader after probe team found that he allegedly helped prime accused, Jolly Joseph, prepare fake title deed so that she could inherit her husband's properties. How did such a thing be under wraps for so long? 

Watch for more details!

150 officials, 200 cameras and 7 Elephants! India's biggest-ever tiger hunt is underway in #Karnataka's #Bandipur forest reserve. Mirror Now's Neha Hebbale reports from the treacherous jungle.

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

Story 1: #PMCBankCrisis

For 17 days now #PMCBank depositors have been forced to beg for their own hard-earned money. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said RBI is the regulator of cooperative banks & it will investigate the fraud. Who is going to give their money back? 

Story 2: Vigilantes Vs cow smugglers

#Haryana has a Gauraksha task force, a task force of policemen to handle cow smuggling cases.  But where are they in this case? Is Haryana govt’s policy to crackdown on cow smuggling failing? Are vigilantes running a mock with police doing nothing?

snippet.title: World Mental Health Day end the stigma, Seek help if you are depressed | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, Speak up, speak out. Let's not hide. Let's not suppress it. The worry is real. On #WorldMentalHealthDay, let's break the stigma around Mental Health. 

Dr. Harish Shetty, Psychiatrist: There has to be a people's movement that can change the stigma. We need a mental health revolution in the country.

NIMHANS, Dr. Santosh Chaturvedi: The last 5-6 years have been really good for Mental Health. We had the Mental Health Policy, Mental Health Care Act was introduced & the National Mental Health survey gave us a rough idea of what is happening in the country.

Psychologist, Aditi Govitrikar:  The first fear that comes is from within, why can't I handle this issue myself? Am I weak? That's the first question a patient goes through.

Listen in for more details!

#MentalHealthAwareness #MentalHealthAwarenessDay

snippet.title: Economic slowdown, Celebrities' sedition charge & RSS Chief sparks row | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

Story 1: #EconomicSlowdown

7 million increase in jobs is a substantial increase. But one can expect a small fall from the 7 million shoot-up.

Listen in as MD & CEO of Centre for Monitoring India Economy Mahesh Vyas explains the increase in jobs in September.

Will things improve post-Diwali or are we headed for a prolonged slowdown? 

Story 2: Celebrities' sedition charge

Muzzafarpur police cancel F.I.R against all the 49 celebrities; terms it false. A case will now be filed against Petitioner Sudhir Ojha.

Story 3: Lynching 

RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat stokes controversy; says 'lynching' is a western construct & shouldn't be used in the Indian context to defame the country

What hurts India more: lynching or talking about lynching?

Watch for more details!

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

Story 1 -- #PMCBankScam

It's been over 2-weeks since Multi-crore #PMCBankScam, depositors of the bank are still running pillar to post for their own money. PMC Bank depositors spoke to Mirror Now's Neha Kulkarni about how they're facing problems during festivals.

We ask - Will depositors get their money before #Diwali?

Story 2 -- #RakeshAsthana Case

#Delhi High Court has granted 2-months time for CBI to complete its probe in the bribery charges against former CBI director Rakesh Asthana, and CBI deputy SP Devender Kumar. 

Aarti Subramaniam explains. 

We ask - How will CBI investigate the other high profile cases if they can't solve this case?

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight,

Story 1: #AmritsarTrainTragedy

A year after #AmritsarTrainTragedy, 60 families were destroyed & victims still wait for justice. There have been no arrests & no charge-sheet. Why has there been no accountability? When will they get justice? 

Story 2: Letter accessed by MIRROR NOW shows that 20 top government buildings including the Home Ministry, Finance Ministry & Defence Ministry buildings are not fire compliant

snippet.title: Supreme Court stops Aarey tree cutting & RBI survey | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

Story 1: #Aarey

In the span of 2 days, the #Maharashtra government chopped over 2000 trees when the citizens were protesting. 29 people were arrested for 48 hours. 

Were the arrests justified? Did the state show unnecessary haste in chopping the trees?

Mirror Now's Tanvi Shukla to Shiv Sena's Manisha Kayande: A senior party leader told us that MMRCL took the wrong decision & that 4-5 years ago Shiv Sena raised this issue that the plan was wrong. If that is the case, how could you allow this to happen?

Story 2: Economy in crisis

RBI's monthly Consumer Confidence Survey reveals that the job crisis is the biggest concern for the majority of Indians. The survey also reveals that consumer sentiment has crashed to a 6 year low

We ask - What can revive the sentiment?

Watch for more details!

snippet.title: Kerala's chilling cyanide murders: Woman plots 6 murders in 14 years | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, In a span of 14 years, six people from an extended family died from what seemed to be natural causes, but after the case was reopened recently it has turned out to be the chilling handiwork of one woman, who poisoned them with potassium cyanide. Probe widens in Kerala's serial murder.

In the matter of serial killings & premeditated murders, how capable are our policemen and investigative agencies to solve the cases? Lawyer, Tanveer Ahmed Mir explains. Listen in!

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Sedition FIR lodged against 50 celebrities including filmmakers Mani Ratnam and Aparna Sen after they wrote an open letter to the Prime Minister raising concerns over the growing incidents of mob lynching

snippet.title: Have we failed single use plastic ban challenge? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
A year after Maharashtra government banned single-use plastic in the state, Mirror Now went on-ground to check the extent to which Mumbaikars have stopped using plastic. The industry was given 2-years of time to come up with alternatives for the multi-layer packaging and it did not come up with it. With this pace, I don't think India can reach that level by 2020: Dinesh Raj, CSE to Mirror Now.
Watch!

snippet.title: Bihar: 2nd big floods in 2019, Is Alcohol prohibition a political gimmick? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, 

Story No 1: Debating liquor ban

Andhra Pradesh becomes the latest state to push for liquor ban. Liquor shops will only be open from 11 AM to 8 PM. 20% liquor shops were also shut down. New Excise Policy effective from today

Is Liquor Ban effective in states?

Story No 2: Bihar Floods

The floods killed over 30, Deputy CM had to be rescued. Food and medicines air dropped.
Is it not the government's responsibility to think about such issues for the long term and make policies accordingly?
When will the Bihar government wake up?

Auto sales slowdown continued in September. Sales numbers indicate no substantial turnaround for the sector despite measures announced by Finance Minister to boost demand.

snippet.title: PMC Bank bails out HDIL group, Is Co-op bank sector at risk? |The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, economic Offence Wing of Mumbai Police has filed an F.I.R against ex-MD Joy Thomas & Chairman Waryam Singh and other officials of PMC Bank and HDIL group. An SPecial Investigation Team (SIT) has been formed by the Mumbai Police to probe the PMC bank case. Mirror Now's Santia Gora reports. Listen in.

How will the depositors get their money back? Where's the role of the government? When will the Government of India step in and treat these 7.5 lakh depositors as their own? And If it's not the governor of the Reserve Bank of India, then who should we blame?

snippet.description:

Story No 1: PM Modi at UNGA

 Prime Minister Narendra Modi's big address at the United Nation's General Assembly. snippet.title: Will compensation for homebuyers be a deterrent for errant builders? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, Compensation for Homebuyers 

Three separate instances of three different cities with exactly the same problems. Flat owners who have bought their houses with hard-earned money now face a threat of losing their homes. In Kochi, the Supreme Court has ordered the demolition of 5 apartment complexes that are built on the coastal zones.
The fate of 80,000 homeowners in Bengaluru hangs in the balance as they have now been sent notice by the Karnataka power transmission company as the houses are close to high tension electric wires.

The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday said that the demolition of flats on the coastal zone of Ernakulam’s Maradu must be completed in 138 days, as per the timeline provided by the Kerala government.SC bench comprising also directed the freezing of assets of builders and promoters who were involved in the construction of illegal buildings ON the coastal area of Ernakulam’s Maradu. 

Will compensation for homebuyers be a deterrent for errant builders?

snippet.title: Why hasn't there been a criminal investigation against PMC Bank? |The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, 

Story No 1: PMC Bank crisis

Just 2 days ago the RBI put out circular bringing restrictions on the Punjab Maharashtra Cooperative Bank which sent its depositors & its customers into a tizzy. If the HDIL promoter took a loan of ₹100 Cr to pay his dues to Bank of India in August this year when HDIL was already considered an NPA. If RBI has found evidence of wrongdoing why hasn't there been a criminal investigation?

Story No 2: PNB Bank scam

Antiguan PM Gaston Browne blames India for giving Mehul Choksi a clean chit. He said that Choksi will be deported once all his appeals get exhausted.
Why was Mehul Choksi given clean chit? Do prompt agencies become inactive when we talk about rich people?


WATCH!

snippet.title: Economic slowdown, Citizenship debate, Fuel prices rise & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, 

Story 1: Slowdown in economy

With the turnaround in the stock market, is our economy also turning around? Does one equal the other? MD & CEO, Kotak Mahindra Asset Management Nilesh Shah responds, speaks on the rising crude prices and tells what you should be doing with your investments at this point in time. He also shares his views on whether the issues of PSU banks will be solved by Melas and Mergers.

Story 2 :#UNClimateActionSummit 

16-year-old Climate Activist #GretaThunberg has a message for all. Listen in as she addresses the #UNClimateActionSummit.

Story 3: Citizenship Debate 

Union Home Minister Amit Shah sparks the NRC debate again. Speaking at #Jharkhand he spoke of a nationwide Citizenship Registry. Can a Nationwide NRC be implemented? Former Additional Solicitor General Sidharth Luthra shares his views.

Story 4: Fuel Prices Rise 

Considering the rise is happening at a time when liquidity in the hands of consumers is at an all-time low, burdening them with another ₹5-₹6/ litre for fuel is ethically wrong & will put further pressure on them: Economist Ajay Dua.
 
Watch for more details!

snippet.title: Big win for Mahul residents, Bombay HC makes landmark judgement | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, 

Story 1: #IndiasToxicHell  

Big win for the residents of Mahul who have been protesting for years for their right to life after Bombay High Court gives its verdict in their favour. The Bombay High Court orders the state gov & BMC to either give alternate accommodation or rent & security deposit.

Debi Goenka, Environmentalist: These people have been subjected to a hell hole these 2 years and I wished the High Court has also given them compensation for the health impact and the medical expenses they had to incur.

snippet.title: Twist in Chinmayanand, massive climate strike across the globe | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza,

Story No 1: Chinmayanand Case

Chinmayanand admits to 'wrongdoing' & has now been arrested. Extortion angle also emerges in the case. 3 friends of the law student arrested for attempting to extort ₹5 crores from the BJP Neta.
The amount of media pressure it took for the police to do anything at all is a worrying point. It's in cases like these, where the perpetrator is powerful & victim happens to be of lesser means, that our law is truly tested.

Story No 2: Global Climate strike

Thousands of protesters from across the globe, many of them students who skipped school, joined Global climate strike on Friday calling for action against climate change. The protest was started by 16-year old climate activist Greta Thunberg.

snippet.title: Auto sector demands GST cut, Killer potholes in Bengaluru & more| The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza,

Story No 1: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar categorically denies any kind of crisis in India; says the fundamentals of the economy are still strong.
n the day and age of online banking, how could a mela under the shamiana physically be a solution to the lack of lending?

Story No 2: Killer Potholes

BMC comes up with a solution for killer potholes; launches an App for potholes. An app is now available for android phone, soon to be available for iOS users. Although dug-up road left unpaired; 2 children & their mother injured after her bike skid on a pothole-ridden road
Don't taxpayers deserve better roads?


Story No 3: Malnutrition in India

Malnutrition remains the leading risk factor for 68% deaths of children under five; 2 out of 3 child deaths in India is due to Malnutrition. Does India need a better nutrition plan? 

WATCH!

snippet.title: Bombay HC reserves order on Mahul, Chinmayanad case & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza,

Story No 1: Indias Toxic Hell: Mahul

Bombay High Court reserves order on Mahul. Judge observes air quality has only deteriorated in the last 4 years & people are dying. The judge concluded this after a comparative analysis of air quality reports was handed to the court.
Will the Maharashtra government follow the orders of the Bombay High Court? Or will there be an appeal made to the Supreme Court if this order does not go in your favour? 

Story No 2: Chinmayanand Case

The law student from Shahjahanpur, who levelled rape charges against former BJP MP Chinmayanand, has threatened to kill herself if the leader is not arrested immediately.  The police are yet to arrest Chinmayanand as he checked into a hospital complaining of breathing problem.
As per the law, should Chinmayanand have been arrested already? Is the Uttar Pradesh police following the law?

Story 3: Tracking situation in Kashmir.

With no internet services in the valley, students have missed out on crucial entrance tests for colleges. The state administration claims that internet kiosks have been set up but parents say the measures are inadequate.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Impact of drone attacks on Saudi,will fuel prices shoot up more?| The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
Original telecast date: 18th September 2019

On this debate, we discuss about the drone attacks on Saudi, the latest update in the Swami Chinmayanad rape case and the strike over heavy fines in the Delhi-NCR region. 

Story 1: Petrol, diesel spike up
Petrol, diesel prices shoot up by 25 paise. This is the biggest fuel price hike in the last 2 months & is being seen as a consequence of the drone attack on Saudi Arabia's largest oil processing facility. 
Are fuel prices likely to go up further?

Story 2: Swami Chinmayanad rape case
According to agencies, the Uttar Pradesh law student, who leveled rape charges against former BJP MP Chinmayanand, has threatened to kill herself if he is not arrested immediately.

Story 3: Transport Strike in Delhi-NCR
Transport associations in the National capital have called for a strike tomorrow to protest against steep traffic fines. Ola, Uber, and auto-rickshaws are also likely to stay off the road.

snippet.title: Pregnant woman beaten in jail, E-cigarettes ban, Economic crisis| The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, 

Story 1: Alleged police brutality in #Assam

A pregnant woman and her two sisters allegedly stripped & tortured inside a police post in #Assam. The Chief Minister has ordered a DIG level probe into the alleged police brutality.

Former Assam CM Tarun Gogoi speaks to Faye D'Souza: says the government of Assam is not doing enough. The policemen should have been arrested immediately. Law & order has deteriorated.

Story 2: #ECigaretteBan 

Banning electronic cigarettes while allowing conventional cigarettes, does not make sense, says Dr Farrukh Khan of Vapers Association.

Story 3: #EconomicSlowdown

General Motors India becomes 3rd auto company to offer voluntary retirement to employees in an attempt to cut costs. But it's not just the auto sector which is under stress. The leather industry has also been hit.

Faye D'Souza asks BJP's Abhishek Mishra: Are there any specific moves for the unorganized sector and those people of the unorganized sector who are currently suffering?

Watch for more details!

snippet.title: J&K clampdown, Dengue alert & Drone attacks at Saudi Refinery | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight, 

Story 1: Day 44 of J&K Clampdown

The citizens in the Valley are citizens of India; their rights are our rights, their problems are our problems & hence, on behalf of those who can’t tell their stories, we do this on their behalf. We become their voice.

Maya Mirchandani, Senior Journalist: There's an absence of violence barring a few pockets. But that does not mean that things are not simmering & that people aren't upset.

Owais Wani, Student: It took me 25 attempts to connect to the landline to speak to my family in Kashmir. I want Govt to please resume the clampdown as we need to connect to our families. I’m confused & worried about my family.

Story 2: Dengue Alert

Dengue menace hit southern states the worst. K’taka reported over 10,534 cases of dengue. Telangana has reported 4,500 cases since January. #Delhi, on the other hand, has been successful in containing the deadly vector-borne disease by 80%.

We ask - Does the government of #Karnataka has a plan to tackle this problem? 

Story 3: Drone Attacks at Saudi Refinery

RS Sharma, Former Chairman, ONGC: We don't have a contingency plan that in case the prices go up how it is going to impact especially at the stage our economy is at an influx situation. 

Story 4: Former FM Yashwant Sinha denied entry to Srinagar

Former Finance Minister Yashwant Sinha reaches Srinagar airport but wasn't allowed to enter the city which is under communication clampdown & restrictions; had to return to Delhi by the last flight.

Faye D'souza speaks to the Fmr Finance Minister. Listen in!

SUBSCRIBE NOW for more such videos ►http://bit.ly/2LesD8T

For More Updates ► http://www.mirrornownews.com

snippet.title: Shared-auto gang attacks youth, Mumbai's killer potholes & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight, 

Story 1: Youth attacked & robbed in Thane

A 25-year-old man attacked in Thane near Mumbai. He was stabbed, robbed & thrown from a moving auto-rickshaw by the driver & 3 co-passengers. Victim's cousin, Alum Rai Khan speaks to Faye D'souza.

According to witnesses, the victim was taken to the hospital in an ice-cream van. Former IPS officer Aftab Ahmed Khan says at that point, where could they get an ambulance?

Story 2: Killer Potholes

If the government is brazen and confident enough to multiply traffic fines 10 times over, can we not expect better service when it comes to our roads? How many more lives will need to be lost? 

Story 3: Aarey petitions in Bombay High Court

#Aarey hearing adjourned till Wednesday. Petitioner invites Chief Justice to visit Aarey. Earlier in the day, the state govt assured the court that trees won't be axed till September 30th.

Watch for more details!

snippet.title: Illegal AIADMK banner kills student & Maharashtra govt fails farmers again | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight,

Story 1: #WhoKilledShubashree 

Illegal AIADMK banner kills student. Mirror Now accesses CCTV footage of the whole incident wherein an illegal banner fell on a 23-year-old student, leading to her death. Tamil Nadu CM brazens it out and evades questions.

Advocate, Sudha Ramalingam: Safety of people is the last priority as far as #TamilNadu is concerned. every other road has banners put up after this flex printing has become cheap.

We ask - Why is the state blind towards netas who break the law?

Story 2: Farmer Suicides

Farmers distress worsens as Maha Govt fails its farmers again. Data reveals at least 7 farmers have committed suicide every day in past 7 months. In fact, 219 farmers killed themselves in the month of July alone.

snippet.description:

If the #millennials prefer #Ola and #Ubers, wouldn't app-based cab aggregators buy more cars? How does the 'millennial mindset' explain truck sales falling?
