Anyone who does a 3gms of 'Meow Meow'or crystal meth will overdose. An anonymous drug user, explains what the drug 'Meow Meow' looks like, where you get it from, what it does to a person & the signs to look out for to know if you suspect that someone is doing drugs.

snippet.title: Save Aarey campaign, Chinmayanand case & Differently-abled harrassed in Delhi | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight,

Story 1 - #SaveAareySaveMumbai, Mirror Now Campaign

Wildlife activists have urged the state to not cut down trees, so that wildlife can be protected. A recent RTI query revealed that at least 7 leopards have been captured in Aarey over last 3-years. 

As of today, none of the trees has been cut, still, the flooding happened. Flooding in Mithi river is not because of #Aarey. It is not a holding pond. Says, BJP's Bhalchandra Shirsat to Mirror Now's Kavita Krishnan. 

Story 2 - #ChinmayanandCase

The law student who accused #Chinmayanand of rape & sexual exploitation has provided 14 videos o the S.I.T as evidence. She added that since she felt threatened by the Uttar Pradesh Police, she filed a rape case in #Delhi. 

Story 3 - Differently-abled harrassed at #Delhi airport

A differently-abled woman was ill-treated & asked to stand, despite her declaring her disability. Virali Modi has filed a complaint with the CISF & now demands a public apology.

Watch for more details!

snippet.title: Alarming rise in suicides, Let's talk, help save lives | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, It's World Suicide Prevention Day today. Let's try to understand how we can identify if someone around us going through time & what we can do to help.

Lata Jacob, Sahai: Pay attention to the changes. We need to be alert to those around us because the indicators are very subtle but it collects and it affects their decision making.

Neerja Birla, Mpower: Every child is unique in their own way. We need to focus on that & encourage them to reach their optimum potential. We need to teach them how to accept failures, deal with rejection.

Dr. Harish Shetty, Psychiatrist: If you ask a depressed person whether he wants to end his life, the mind suddenly surprisingly will say how do you know it? Are you an astrologer?

Listen in for more details!

snippet.title: Face-off over Mumbai's green lung, Sedition Law & ISRO keeps its hopes alive | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

Story 1: #SaveAarey

Today, BMC chief Praveen Pardeshi along with #Mumbai Metro Railway Corporation Managing Director, Ashwini Bhide, reached out to activists in a bid to allay their fears about damage to the environment. 

We ask - Has the government identified land available for all of this replantation?

Story 2: #SeditionLaw

The #SeditionLaw is an anachronism. It was a colonial law and should have gone with the coming into force of the constitution, which guaranteed the Freedom of Speech: Senior Advocate, Sanjay Hegde to Mirror Now's Sahar Zaman.

Story 3: India's Lunar Mission -- #Chandrayaan2

snippet.title: No signs of an economic revival, Mumbai murder mystery, PUBG murder case & more  | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

Story 1: #EconomicSlowdown

Is a #GST rate cut the solution? Will festive season boost demand? Does real estate need an intervention?

What is required to be done immediately is pump-priming, which means more liquidity has to be infused in the economy and that can be done by the government: Ajay Dua, Fmr Commerce Secretary

Story 2: Mumbai Murder Mystery

According to Sources, accused claimed that he had supernatural powers which guided & made him commit the crime. Accused allegedly also called the police & informed them of crime. Police are probing angles.

Story 3: Argument over PUBG turns fatal

A 25-year-old man from Karnataka allegedly murdered his 60-year-old father and severed his head after he took away his phone, cut off the internet connection and forbid him from playing PUBG. What can be done to help our youth?

FIR against former JNU student and activist Shehla Rashid for remarks against Indian army for her post on #Kashmir 

Is it a valid FIR? Is it valid to use sedition law in a particular case?

snippet.title: One year since Section 377 scrapped, Have we created a more open society? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, Out & Proud!
It has been one year since Section 377 was struck down. What has changed? Have created a more open society? 

'It has started conversations in workspaces. Not just that, other similar conversations have been initiated after the verdict.' says Vinay Aarote, LGBTQ activist

Activist Harish Iyer says, 'It becomes extremely important that we have a robust mechanism where we educate the masses, have sensitivity education in schools & colleges & anti-bullying laws.'

snippet.title: New traffic fines, Jammu & Kashmir clampdown, & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, 

Story No 1: Motor Vehicle Act of 2019

As more states implement the amended Motor Vehicle Act, traffic rule violators are beginning to feel the heat.

But, will hefty traffic fines be a deterrent or lead to more corruption? Are these traffic fines, eventually going to lead to a system collapsing?

Story No 2: Jammu and Kashmir

A month since the J&K clampdown, restrictions continue in Kashmir.

When will the normalcy return to the valley?

Story No 3: Rajasthan live-in relationships row

Rajasthan Human Rights Commission has issued an order asking the state & central government to prohibit the practice of live-in relationships.

Story No 4: Kolkata Metro

10 buildings have crumbled in the last 4-days & 55 houses are at risk due to the Metro work in Bowbazaar.
Journalist, Shikha Mukerjee speaks to Faye D'Souza. Says, "Kolkata is scared & worried about where this Metro corridor is going."

snippet.title: Fight to save Aarey continues & Mirzapur Journalist booked | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight,

Story 1: #SaveAarey

MIRROR NOW CAMPAIGN, #SaveAareySaveMumbai powered by citizens across India to save 2,700 trees in #AareyColony continues.

Amitha Balachandra reports LIVE and speaks to the protesting citizens in #Mumbai.

Story 2: Mirzapur Journalist #PawanJaiswal's case

Uttar Pradesh government's bizarre justification; The District Magistrate of Mirzapur has said that the story was done in the wrong manner and that a print journalist should only take photos and take videos.

Senior Advocate Sanjay Hegde explains what journalist Pawan Jaiswal can do now to tackle these legal implications. 

We ask - Why is the Uttar Pradesh government bullying and harassing journalists?

snippet.title: Kulbhushan Jadhav case, Protest to save Aarey & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight,

Story 1: #KulbhushanJadhav

The Pakistan government has issued an official statement on Kulbhushan Jadhav's consular access. Says, we provided uninterrupted access and in order to ensure transparency, the access was recorded. Mirror Now's Faye D'souza & Meenakshi with the details.

Story 2: MIRROR NOW CAMPAIGN #SaveAarey

MIRROR NOW CAMPAIGN to Save Aarey powered by citizens & activists across Mumbai & India gains steam. Through the weekend, Mumbaikars stood as one to fight the cutting of 2700 trees. Bollywood stars also lend support to the people's movement.

Story 3: Dalit family denied access to the crematorium

After Vellore, an incident of caste discrimination reported from Madurai. A Dalit family was denied access to crematorium despite requests.

Story 4: Journalist Pawan Kumar Jaiswal

A case was registered against journalist Pawan Kumar Jaiswal, who exposed that children at a government school in Uttar Pradesh were fed chapatis and salt as part of the mid-day meal. Faye D'souza speaks to the Journalist about it.

snippet.title: FDI in digital media restricted to 26%, Cap in funding to hurt the news business? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, FDI norms for Digital India. On Wednesday, the government made a big announcement to boost the economy The centre said that it had relaxed several FDI (foreign direct investment) norms in retail and other big announcements. The government has allowed 26% cap on funding in Digital Media.
How will the centre regulate funding that goes into digital platforms & what happens to media agencies that have over 26% FDI funding already? Will this move make it easier for news agencies to register abroad?

Story No 2: Economic Slowdown & GDP Growth

The Indian economy grew 5% annually in the first quarter of FY2020, slowing from a 5.8% growth in the march, missing market expectations.
Consumption can only be maintained by reducing savings. So personal household savings have actually fallen from 23% of GDP in 2012 to 17% in 2018: Senior Economist, Santosh Mehrotra to Faye D'Souza

WATCH!

snippet.title: Tracking Kashmir, MS Dhoni dropped from T20 squad, NRC list | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
Original airdate: 29th August 2019.

On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, 

Story 1: #JammuAndKashmir

Attendance in schools still low. Communication lines are yet to be completely restored. Many shops in the Lal Chowk market are still shut & owners are facing substantial losses. Mir Fareed gets the latest. Listen in.

Faye D'souza speaks to Sirrajuddin Khan a Kashmiri student who is studying in Pune. Listen in as he gives a sense of the situation in the valley.

Story 2: #MSDhoni dropped from the Indian T20 team

Mahendra Singh Dhoni dropped from the Indian T20 team that will take on South Africa in September. Rishabh Pant to remain as the lead wicketkeeper in the squad. Is this the end of the road for #Dhoni?

Story 3: Assam NRC Final List 2019

Assam is 2 days away from publishing the NRC list. Times Network visited Bamunigaon village where 500 families stare at an uncertain future. People here have been residing as refugees since 1964. Despite having valid ID proofs 99% didn't find their names in the last 2 NRC drafts.

Watch the video for more details.

snippet.title: Midday meal Controversy, Shouldn't authorities ground A320 Neo? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza,

Story No 1: Mid-day Meal Controversy

Months after Mirror Now exposed how food packets infested with insects, worms & ants were supplied to schools as part of mid-day meal scheme in Bengaluru, authorities swing into action. Lab test results reveal items substandard & unsafe.

Story No 2: VVIP Racism in Karnataka 

Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa's nephew threatens Deputy Commissioner of transfer after he was not allowed to enter a temple due to security reasons.

Story No 3: Missing UP student

5 days since law student from Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur went missing police yet to question BJP leader #Chinmayanand who was accused by the girl for harassing & threatening her. The police have now been accused of maligning the girl's character.

Story No 4: Discrimination in UP school

Dalit students in Uttar Pradesh allege discrimination during mid-day meals. They allegedly carry their own utensils. Some Dalit students claim that other students don't want to sit next to them. Meanwhile, school authorities have defended themselves.
Is this systemic? Are the schools pushing this further into another generation?

Story No 5: DGCA's statement reveals 40% of A320 Neo passenger planes in India run on Pratt & Whitney engines which have reported multiple snags in recent past. 

Shouldn't the aviation authority ground these planes? Is our safety being compromised? 

Watch to know more!

snippet.title: UP missing law student, RBI surplus transfer, Amazon fire | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
Original airdate: 27th August 2019.

On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza,

Story 1: #UttarPradesh girl goes missing after she complained against BJP Neta.

A law student from U.P. who accused BJP's Swami Chinmayananda of ruining the lives of several girls has now gone missing. In the video, the girl alleged that the leader had threatened to kill her. Her family sought the protection form both PM Narendra Modi & CM Yogi Adityanath. DG of Uttar Pradesh has now ordered an F.I.R against BJP leader Swami Chinamayanand. This comes 3-days after the woman went missing.

Story 2: #RBIReserves

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to transfer ₹1.76 lakh crore to the government after the Bimal Jalan committee report.

We ask - Does this move, infringe the autonomy of the RBI & should citizens be worried?

Story 3: #AmazonFire

Amazon rainforest fire continues to rage on, reports have surfaced of an endless scale of devastation.

Andrew Freedman, Deputy Weather Editor of The Washington Post speaks to Faye D'souza about it & explains how citizens can help.

Watch for more details.

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to transfer ₹1.76 lakh crore to the government after the Bimal Jalan committee report.

We ask - Does this move, infringe the autonomy of the RBI & should citizens be worried?

Story 3: #AmazonFire

Amazon rainforest fire continues to rage on, reports have surfaced of an endless scale of devastation.

Andrew Freedman, Deputy Weather Editor of The Washington Post speaks to Faye D'souza about it & explains how citizens can help.

snippet.title: Bulandshahr violence, Economic slowdown, Amazon fire & more | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
Original airdate: 26th August 2019

On The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza,

Story 1: #HongKongProtests

On Sunday, protests in Hong Kong turned ugly after police officers brandished guns and fired a gunshot.

China Editor at Asia Times, Jeff Pao speaks to Faye D'souza and explains the on-ground situation.

Story 2: #BulandshahrViolence

A hero's welcome was given to the accused who are out on bail. Slain cop #SubodhKumarSingh's family alleges threat to life & demand the bail of the accused to be cancelled.

Faye D'souza speaks to his wife Rajini Singh about it.

Story 3: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has decided to transfer 1.76 lakh crores to the government. Avni Raja explains.

Story 4: #EconomicSlowdown

From last one year Mirror Now has been red-flagging how our economy is crumbling. Now the govt has made big announcements. 

But, with the Finance Minister's announcement, has centre addressed the #EconomicCrisis? 

Story 5: #AmazonFire

#Amazon rainforest fire continues to rage on. As per reports, there is an 84% increase in the number of forest fires compared to 2018. Now Brazilian troops are joining the efforts to put out the fire.

snippet.title: Caste case in Madras, PM Modi's strong stand on Kashmir & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza,

Story No 1: Karnataka Cabinet Expansion 

Almost a month after BS Yediyurappa was sworn in & a week after cabinet formation, allocation of portfolios still pending. As a result, citizens' issues have been ignored. Where's the service to the people?
Why have 3 Deputy CMs been appointed for Karnataka? What work will this govt take up immediately? What are the priorities for the cabinet? 

Story No 2: Caste discrimination case in Madras HC
Madras HC expresses displeasure over separate crematoriums for Dalits while hearing a caste discrimination case where a group of Dalits was forced to lower a body from a bridge as they were denied road access to the crematorium.

Story No 3: PM Modi-US Pres Trump bilateral meet

 Prime Minister Narendra Modi sent a strong message on Kashmir when meeting with U.S President Donald Trump on the sidelines of the G7 summit in France. PM Modi said Kashmir is a bilateral issue & both India & Pakistan are capable of handling it & working towards a solution.

WATCH!

snippet.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman on reviving the economy, Will move spur industry to invest? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, Government's bid to kickstart the economy. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed India's economic slowdown. Here are Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's big assurances that she made today.

1. Big assurance in reducing tax harassment 
2. I-T action through the central system 
3. Govt assures further GST simplification
4. FM emphasizes speedy approvals for environment
5. Corporate social responsibility to be a civil matter

We ask - Will the announcements by the Finance Minister help address the root cause of the Economic Slowdown? Have the fears & concerns of people & industries been addressed?

snippet.title: Congress stands by Chidambaram, Delhi Ravidas temple demolition row & more | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

Story 1: #PChidamabaram in custody

With multiple cases being probed, does 'Vendetta charge' hold value? Will CBI be able to prove money trail, quid Pro Quo? Former Finance Minister and Former Home Minister, P. Chidamabaram in CBI custody. But, is this a valid arrest or vendetta?  Advocate, Ashish Dixit speaks to Tanvi Shukla and explains the legal point of view. #INXMediaCase

Story 2: Tracking developments inside #Kashmir

A hotel in #Srinagar has been turned into a media centre by the government, where 4 systems have been installed with internet services. But outside of this setup, nothing is easy. Mir Fareed gets the on-ground report.

Story 3: Delhi Ravidas temple demolition row

Politics over the demolition of Sant Ravidas temple  
5,000 Dalits from Punjab, Rajasthan, Haryana & Uttar Pradesh stormed into Delhi on Wednesday, after the Ravidas Temple was demolished following a Supreme court order.

snippet.title: Aadhaar-Social media linkage in Supreme Court & Kashmir limps back to normalcy  | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
Original airdate: 20th August 2019

On The Urban Debate, The Supreme Court transferred all cases regarding a plea which is to link Aadhaar Card with your social media accounts. This was based on a plea which was filed by Facebook. The Tamil Nadu government had originally asked for Aadhaar Card to be linked to Facebook to prevent cybercrime and track anti-national activities. The State government is now being represented by our Attorney General K. K. Venugopal. However, Facebook has opposed the proposal saying that their WhatsApp platform is already encrypted and a tracking Aadhaar would lead to a breach of privacy. 
We ask - Will linking Aadhaar to Facebook help check fake news? Will you link your Aadhaar to social media? We also discuss the situation in Kashmir as it returns to normalcy. Listen in.

snippet.title: Chandrayaan 2 enters lunar orbit, Income Tax slab rejig soon & more | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, 

Story 1: Direct Tax Code

The Draft Direct Tax code will take the place of the Income Tax Act once it is passed. What's in it for the common man? 
Financial Advisor Harsh Roongta says, 'If there are going to be so many goodies on the reduction front, there has to be a sting in the tail. That money has to come from somewhere.' Economist Akash Jindal says, 'I don't think in the present scenario of the global recession, which has clearly impacted India, there is any scope of tax reduction. If DTC comes in, I would welcome it but let's not do it in haste.'

Story No 2: Mahul- India's Toxic Hell

Bombay High Court says that its order granting rent or alternative accommodation to the residents of Mumbai's Mahul prevails. The State govt had moved the SC against the High Court's order.

Story No 3: Chandrayaan 2

India's moon mission has reached a step closer to history as Chandrayaan 2 entered the lunar orbit this morning. Chandrayaan is due to land on the moon's south pole in September.

Former Professor of Indian Institute of Astrophysics Dr. Ramesh Kapoor speaks to Kavita Krishnan.

snippet.title: India's economic slowdown, Floods in India: Nature's fury or man-made disaster? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, 

Story No 1: India's Economic Slowdown

Government sources told Mirror Now that they are looking at Non-fiscal sector-specific boost in upcoming days. Relief measures for Auto & Real Estate sector are being discussed at the highest level. The govt is also looking at the impact of rolling back FPI surcharge.
Founder of SKA Advisors, Sunil Alagh says, 'The problem of getting into recession is more the fear of recession itself. That is what one has to avoid. You need to start ploughing money into the hands of consumers.' while talking about the economic slowdown.

Stroy No 2: Floods in India

15 states flooded across India. Nearly 500 lives lost. As govts blame unprecedented rains for flooding is this a result of nature's fury or man-made disaster?

Skymet's GP Sharma shares his views!

snippet.title: Triple talaq abolished only on paper, Tarun Tejpal to stand trial & more | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate

Story No 1: Triple Talaq

 A man from Uttar Pradesh gave triple talaq to his wife over the phone and wanted her to leave the house. Against Triple Talaq, the woman went to the police to lodge her complaint, but despite that the police did nothing. Later, the woman's in-laws burnt her alive in front of her daughter after she refused to leave the house. 

Triple Talaq abolished only on paper?

Story No 2: Jammu & Kashmir 

Two weeks since there were restrictions imposed in Jammu and Kashmir after the abrogation of Article 370, primary schools opened in the state. While teachers reported for duty, attendance of students was low in Kashmir. Mir Fareed reports from on the ground.

Story No 3: Tarun Tejpal Case

6 years on, the Tarun Tejpal case continues. Tehelka founder Tarun Tejpal will stand trial after the top court refused to quash proceedings against him in a rape case. Tejpal was accused of rape by a junior colleague in 2013. 
Advocate Aishwarya Bhati speaks to Tanvi Shukla about the case. She said, 'Unfortunately, the delays are something which is infesting our judicial system & the situation only seems to be getting grimmer'

Story No 4: Pilgrims attacked by fringe groups

Pilgrims from Kolar Gold Fields in Karnataka were attacked on their way to Velankanni Church in Tamil Nadu by fringe groups. 

Pramod Madhav shares the details.

localized.title: Triple talaq abolished only on paper, Tarun Tejpal to stand trial & more | The Urban Debate
localized.description:
On The Urban Debate

Story No 1: Triple Talaq

 A man from Uttar Pradesh gave triple talaq to his wife over the phone and wanted her to leave the house. Against Triple Talaq, the woman went to the police to lodge her complaint, but despite that the police did nothing. Later, the woman's in-laws burnt her alive in front of her daughter after she refused to leave the house. 

Triple Talaq abolished only on paper?

Story No 2: Jammu & Kashmir 

Two weeks since there were restrictions imposed in Jammu and Kashmir after the abrogation of Article 370, primary schools opened in the state. While teachers reported for duty, attendance of students was low in Kashmir. Mir Fareed reports from on the ground.

Story No 3: Tarun Tejpal Case

6 years on, the Tarun Tejpal case continues. Tehelka founder Tarun Tejpal will stand trial after the top court refused to quash proceedings against him in a rape case. Tejpal was accused of rape by a junior colleague in 2013. 
Advocate Aishwarya Bhati speaks to Tanvi Shukla about the case. She said, 'Unfortunately, the delays are something which is infesting our judicial system & the situation only seems to be getting grimmer'

Story No 4: Pilgrims attacked by fringe groups

Pilgrims from Kolar Gold Fields in Karnataka were attacked on their way to Velankanni Church in Tamil Nadu by fringe groups. 

Pramod Madhav shares the details.

Watch the full show for more details!

snippet.title: PM Modi meets FM to discuss economy, AAP freebies shower in Delhi & more | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate,

Story No 1: Economic Slowdown

Amid the Economic slowdown official data shows that the government's capital expenditure for the June quarter has reduced considerably. Now, this even as the consumption demand and investment activity has seen a steady slide. Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday on the state of the economy and various officials of the Finance Ministry were also present at the meeting. 

Story No 2: AAP's Freebies 

After promising free WiFi hotspots and free 200 units of electricity, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announces free bus rides for women from October 29th. He said that women will be able to travel free on Delhi government buses from October 29th. He also said, 'We are also working so that metro rides for women can be made free'. 

Watch!

snippet.title: Centre eases restrictions in J&K, 'Caste bands' stokes row, & more | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate,

Story No 1: Kashmir Clampdown

After 12 days of Kashmir clampdown, restrictions and connectivity to be eased gradually. Centre to review preventive detention. Jammu & Kashmir's Chief Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said, 'The government's approach was guided by conviction, the all-round development was the most credible solution to address separatist sentiments that were propagated by vested interests.'

Story No 2: Caste Bands in Tamil Nadu schools

Days after Tamil Nadu education dept issued circular on action to be taken against schools using caste markers. State education minister scraps the circular denying discriminatory practice

Caste barriers a reality in schools? Is this a prevalent practice? Are these sacred threads that children wear based on their communities? Or are these bands being given by the school? 

Story No 3: Pehlu Khan Case

Two days ago we were all shocked and disappointed over the Pehlu Khan lynching case verdict where a 55-year-old dairy farmer from Haryana's Nuh, was beaten up by self-styled cow vigilantes near Behror in Rajasthan on the Delhi-Alwar highway.

Was there a deliberate attempt by the Rajasthan police to absolutely destroy the case? 


Watch!

snippet.title: Celebrating the LGBTQIA+ community | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza,  Listen in as Indian Politician Apsara Reddy shares the story of coming out. She says, "While the world is accepting the Transgenders into education & employment, families are not. Parental embrace is really important for empowerment".

Onir, Film & TV Director speaks on the influence of mass media on society, he says 'The portrayal of the community in cinema is disturbing. Very often, in the portrayal, the comedy comes out of making fun of your identity'

Listen in as the first openly gay prince of India Manvendra Gohil shares his story of coming out: "We don't want special favours. We should have the right to enjoy freedom. I have the right to be who I am".

Anjali Gopalan, Naz Foundation: In a democracy how can you deny rights to some people based on who they want to be with. If it's not criminal, why are we not giving everyone the same rights?  

#IndiaIndependenceDay #LGBTQIA

For More Updates ► http://www.mirrornownews.com

snippet.title: Pehlu Khan lynching case verdict, CJI bats for CBI autonomy & Kerala floods | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

 Story 1: #PehluKhan

 A local court acquitted all six accused in the 2017 mob lynching case. The verdict was pronounced by additional district judge Sarita Swami. The judge said she was acquitting all six accused giving them 'benefit of doubt' in the case. The incident took place when Pehlu Khan and his two sons were beaten up by a mob while transporting cows on April 1, 2017. Khan succumbed to his injuries two days later in a hospital. 

Story 2: CJI bats for CBI autonomy.

CJI Ranjan Gogoi raises concerns over the autonomy of CBI in high profile cases. When will this caged parrot be released? Can the current do that?

Story 3: Deadly Kerala floods

More than 90 lives lost due to floods. Red alert issued for Mallapuram and Kozhikode districts. Watch for more details.

snippet.title: J&K administration acts tough on fake news, NRC debate, VVIP culture &  more | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, 

Story 1: #JammuAndKashmir 

Jammu and Kashmir administration acts tough on fake news. However, the clampdown continues ahead of Independence Day. Dress rehearsals held in all districts

 Story 2: #NRCDebate

Supreme Court rejects the government's demand for re-verification, says, no further delays in Assam's NRC. The register to be published on August 31.

Sr Supreme Court advocate Aishwarya Bhati speaks on the issue and says, 'This means the process that has gone on, will be the final list. But, the legal process starts from there. If there are any wrong inclusions or exclusions, it’ll be subject to judicial review'.

Story 3: VVIP culture

Kanchipuram collector threatens cop as he was upset over VIP darshan being disrupted. VIP culture at places of worship? Special passes for netas, babus, celebs?

Story 4: Hong Kong Protests

As protests outside the #Hong Kong airport intensifies, Journalist Timothy McLaughlin of The Washington Post, speaks to Tanvi Shukla with the latest; says, the aim of the protesters was to spread their message to international travelers.

Watch for more details!

snippet.title: Flood fury across India & India's economic slowdown | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
The Urban Debate tonight,

Story 1: #Floods #MonsoonMayhem

Are the floods man-made or nature's fury? Is India not ready for climate change? Neha Hebbale and Pramod Madhav bring ground reports from the flood-hit areas.

Finance Minister of Kerala, Thomas Isaac speaks on #KeralaFloods: Now the rains are slightly subsiding, therefore, the flood situation is improving but we are not very sure about the landslides.

We ask - Is India not ready for climate change? Is India unprepared for heavy rains? 

Story 2: #EconomicSlowdown

Prof. Arun Kumar, Chair professor, Institute of Social Sciences on the Economic Slowdown: Last 3 years, our economy was hit by 3 shocks; DeMo, #GST & NBFC crisis. Each hit the unorganized sector, a sector that employs 94% of workforce & produces 45% of output.

We ask - How long will the slowdown in consumption last?

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: PM Modi's BIG message on Jammu & Kashmir, links 370 to Terrorism & Corruption | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Kavita Krishnan, Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the nation and it was focused on his decision to effectively revoke Article 370 taken 3 days back. Since then Kashmir has been peaceful and we have been bringing you visual evidence of this over the last three days. The curfew has been relaxed, people are out, children are playing cricket and it appears even as the prohibitory orders have been relaxed, there has not been the kind of backlash that we were being told would actually take place. We ask - Has Prime Minister Narendra Modi settled the debate? Listen in!

snippet.title: Is India facing disastrous floods due to short-sighted politics? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, 

Story No 1: Floods In India
Nature has unleashed in 7states, heavy rain has made the people homeless overnight, has affected people in Maharashtra and Karnataka and in Kerala. Many people lost their lives 
Could the flood situation in Karnataka & Maharashtra be avoided? Is this the cause of nature's fury or has the politics over dam and rivers destroyed families in these states?

Story No 2: Jammu & Kashmir
Slight relief for J&K residents as shutdown eases up. However, security has been tightened in old #Srinagar. Communication & all essential services still affected & continue to remain a challenge

Story No 3: Relief for homebuyers

It is hard for such a larger group of people to find adequate and unified representation. It is much easier for a few creditors to create a solution: Amit Goenka,  CEO, Nisus Finance Services Co Pvt. Ltd

snippet.title: Top corporate meet FM Sitharaman to discuss slowdown in Indian Economy | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, 
Story 1: Economic Slowdown

With so many alarm bells ringing from across the board, how deep are we in Economy? Is this slowdown a structural problem? Are confidence booster packages & measures to boost sentiment going to be enough? What is the solution?  SKA Advisors: So far the efforts of the govt have been industry-led. I want them to be consumption-led in the economy.

Story 2: Arun Jaitley in AIIMS

Former  Finance Minister Arun Jaitley admitted to AIIMS in Delhi. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amith Shah, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman visited the hospital.

Story 3: Monsoon Mayhem

Several states hit by torrential rainfall. Worst-hit states include Maharashtra, Karnataka & Kerala. People have been rendered homeless, lives have been lost & thousands have been evacuated

 Former Member of National Disaster Management Authority NVC Menon speaks to Avni Raja.

Are confidence booster packages & measures to boost sentiment going to be enough? What is the solution?  SKA Advisors: So far the efforts of the govt have been industry-led. I want them to be consumption-led in the economy.

Story 2: Arun Jaitley in AIIMS

Former  Finance Minister Arun Jaitley admitted to AIIMS in Delhi. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amith Shah, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman visited the hospital.

Story 3: Monsoon Mayhem

Several states hit by torrential rainfall. Worst-hit states include Maharashtra, Karnataka & Kerala. People have been rendered homeless, lives have been lost & thousands have been evacuated

 Former Member of National Disaster Management Authority NVC Menon speaks to Avni Raja.

snippet.title: RBI cuts repo rate, Kashmir shutdown continues & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight,

Story 1: RBI Rate Cut

The RBI cut the #RepoRate, for the 4th time this year, by 0.35% today. How will this impact you? Will fixed deposit & home loan rates go down? Will the economy improve? 

We honestly request the RBI Governor & Finance Minister please make finance available for MSME: K.E. Raghunathan, A.I.M.O in conversation with Faye D'Souza.

NSA Ajit Doval reach out to locals in the Valley to oversee govt's groundwork after state's special status was taken away. He met J&K police to thank them for their efforts in maintaining law & order.

snippet.title: Maharashtra & Karnataka floods, JNU student rape case & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight,

Story 1:  #MonsoonMayhem #KarnatakaFloods & #MaharashtraFloods

A red alert has been issued in Dakshin Kannada. 70,000 people evacuated in Sangli and Kolhapur. 22 NDRF teams have also been deployed.

Everything on the ground is also saturated, it doesn't have the capacity to absorb any more rains. So whatever is raining is seen in terms of waterlogging, floods or inundation of that area: GP Sharma of Skymet Weather in conversation with Faye D'Souza.

Story 2: #KhakiShamed again!

A 35-year old female jail inmate from Tihar was allegedly raped by escorting police personnel while she was being taken back to Delhi from West Bengal. Has the Delhi police forgotten their job? 

Why is the Delhi police trying to leak the details to the media? Are they trying to ensure more victim-blaming happens and the person involved gets more traumatised?: N Sai Balaji, President JNUSU in conversation with Faye D'Souza.

Story 3: #KeralaNunCase

What message are you sending to the women of the church? Why are they continuing to put pressure on the victim here instead of the accused? It is time for the laypeople of the church to demand answers! 

Abraham Mathai, ICV in conversation with Faye: The action of the church has contradicted what the bible says. Writing poetry & buying a car isn’t in a violation where Sr Lucy has to be dismissed. It’s very unfair & also brings in the role of the church.

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza tonight,

 On August 2, a JNU student was raped by a cab driver. According to the victim, the cops didn't file her FIR & denied her request for a woman cop. snippet.title: Big move by Centre, Jammu & Kashmir's special status revoked | The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, In a massive historic move by the Centre, Jammu and Kashmir as a State lost its special status today. The provisions of Article 370 which gives special status to Jammu and Kashmir have been revoked as a result 35A which gave residents special rights over jobs and acquiring property also seize to exist. This essentially means is that the Jammu and Kashmir law and order will now be under the Centre's control. All law's that are applicable for the rest of India will also be applicable in Jammu and Kashmir. Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh to become a union territory. Will it hold scrutiny in the court of law? Watch the video for more details.

snippet.title: Anti-terror amendment passed in RS, threat to Amarnath Yatris | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, we discuss today -

Story No 1: Anti-Terror Amendment Bill Passed in Rajya Sabha

Unlawful Activites (Prevention) Amendment Bill 2019 empowers NIA to designate an individual as a terrorist leaving the onus on the individual to prove otherwise. Will the #UAPABill stand scrutiny in the court of law?

Stroy No 2: Plot to target Amarnath yatris

The Jammu and Kashmir government curtailed the annual #AmarnathYatra in the wake of intelligence inputs regarding terror threats. The J&K police and the Army addressed a joint press conference in Srinagar, Chinar Corps Commander Lt General KJS Dhillon revealed that terrorists had made an attempt to target security forces last night in Shopian.
After Jammu & Kashmir, Punjab government on high alert. Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh orders high alert in border areas; asked Pathankot district administration to ensure the safe return of Yatris. 

Watch the full show to know more!

snippet.title: Rajya Sabha passes NMC bill & AAP's 'power' freebies | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight, The National Medical Commission (NMC) bill has been passed in the Rajya Sabha. This bill that sparked a nationwide debate as doctors are on strike. It seeks to repeal the Indian Medical Council Act 1956 was passed by a voice vote, amid a walkout by AIADMK. The bill also has a provision for making national standards in medical education uniform by proposing that the final year MBBS exam be treated as an entrance test for PG and a screening test for students who graduate in medicine from foreign countries. We also discuss Aam Aadmi Party's 'power' freebies. Listen in for more details.

snippet.title: Unnao rape survivor's pleas ignored, Is the UP police complicit? |The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, Unnao rape survivor was critically injured after a truck rammed into her car. Her aunts were killed and the lawyer was badly injured. The family alleges that the accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar orchestrated the accident. The police have filed a case on the MLA and his brother along with 10 named people and 15 unnamed people. the Unno rape case survivor has written many letters to Chief os police but all the pleas went unheard. She also explained how the MLA's men tried to pressurize them into a compromise.
We ask- Why has BJP not sacked Kuldeep Sengar? Why was there no security for the Unnao survivor? To know more watch the video!

On another story, Farm crisis in Maharashtra as 1305 farmers committed suicide in the state for the last 6 months. snippet.title: National Pride Lynched in Pilibhit as a tigress is beaten up | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, A 6 years old tigress is beaten up by villagers in Pilibhit, Uttar Pradesh. The tigress has allegedly 9 villagers. In this event, people hunted her and beat up with sticks as she died due to fractures and wounds. The District Magistrate orders action as an FIR has been filed against 45 villagers. The forest officers were missing when this took place in Uttar Pradesh as the National Pride was Lynched. 
We ask- No protection for wildlife?

On another story today, A Fake call centre was busted in Noida, as 33 people were taken into custody for duping people. The accused offered a loan at lower interest rates. They asked for money on various charges for the loan. There is a rise in these kinds of fraud. There are many senior citizens who were called and asked for Aadhar card number and PAN card number which may help them to get to the money of people. We need strong legal frameworks are need of the hour in Country.
We ask- Are the cyber crimes increasing?

On another story today, Auto part manufacturing companies may soon face job loss as they face a major fall in revenue since 2018. Many companies have requested the Government to slash GST and help them come out of this situation or they may be forced to cut jobs.
To know more watch the video!

snippet.description:

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, Former Deputy Chief Minister of Goa Vijay Sardesai in conversation with Faye D'souza speaks on the betrayal last year when he was asked to resign by the Chief Minister. snippet.title: Sexist Azam strikes again, Chennai police face allegations | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, Chennais curious case of broken arms. Chennai police face allegation over brutality as spike and crooks in custody with broken arms as various photos of goons with fractured arms energies and human rights activists raise voices. The police are actually able to commit custodial violence and go scot-free. If magistrate sends out remanding officer and asks the accused in person, they will tell the truth says Advocate, Sudha Ramalingam
We ask- Police brutality or deterrent?

On another story, After the floor test the state of Karnataka awaits for the new government as the crisis continues. The Karnataka Speaker disqualifies 3 rebel MLAs, R Shankar, Ramesh Jarkiholi and Mahesh Kumthahalli, as per the anti-defection law. They can't re-contest elections till the next term.

On another story, Azam Khan, motor mouth Neta strikes again as he makes the sexist comment on BJP's MP Rama Devi in Lok sabha. Ministers demand an immediate apology. He says he won't apologise instead he will resign if the comment is unparliamentary. When women come to work, they're there for their capacity to do their jobs. They deserve to be respected for being professionals and human beings. They don't need to be flirted with, or anything else.

To know more watch the video!

snippet.title: BJP to stake claim in Karnataka, RTI amendment bill spark debate |The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, Shashi Tharoor exclusive in talk with Faye D'souza on the Karnataka political saga, Donald Trump's mediation claim, and the RTI amendment bill.
After the win in the floor test, BJP is all set to stake a claim in the state of Karnataka as BJP's B. S. Yeddyurappa to be the Chief Minister of the state. The leaders are waiting for the high command decision.
We ask- What next for Karnataka? 


On another story, Rti amendment bill has sparked a debate in parliament as there is a lot of criticism on the bill from the opposition. As the bill state that the government will select the Chief Information Commissioner and the Information Commissioner, even the salary will be decided by the government. This will make RTI commissioner servants of the government and would take away the Independence of the Information Commissioners. 
We ask- Will amendments render RTI toothless? Is government diluting RTI act?

snippet.title: Artists letter to PM, Rape survivor unable to join school & more |The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, 49 Artists have written a letter to the Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the recent crime over Lynching, crushing of decent & misuse of 'Jai Shree Ram' in the crime. As Chief Minister of West Bengal Mamata Banerjee supports the letter by saying anyone can write the Pm and ask for help and state do not blame any party for this. Should India have a hate crime law?
In another story, Andra Pradesh's big employment push, the Andra Pradesh assembly has passed a controversial bill as they introduced a quota system by reserving 75% of the jobs in the state for locals. The Chief Minister Y. S. Jaganmohan Reddy says this will boost employment in the state of Andra Pradesh. We ask- should Quota be allowed in the private sector?
In another story, Raped as a child, rejected by society. Almost 42% of the survivors unable to rejoin schools. Many reasons as the child can be affected mentally or financially due to which he may not join school back, as the study says only 15% got the compensation, 16% of families affected by expensive legal procedures and 11% families saw their income drop following the rape.
We ask- No country for child rape survivors?

snippet.title: ISRO creates history, No girl child in Uttarakhand & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, India's moon mission history was created by India as we launched Chandrayaan-2 which was all led by two women Muthayya Vanitha and Ritu Karidal project directors of Chandrayaan-2. ISRO took many years to develop the technology and finally the efforts paid off. 
In Uttarakhand, no girl child was born in 132 villages. The activist has suspected female foeticide takin place in these villages. The district magistrate has decided to closely monitor the situation for the next few months.
In Karnataka assembly, the BJP politician BS Yeddyurappa says he won't leave until the floor test takes place. The drama is all building in the assembly as the speaker has stated he wants to conduct the vote on the very day. The speaker has the rights but he is not using them to their potential. This will go on for a while.
Maharashtra Chief Minister has written a letter to the Election Commissioner suggesting the linking of Adhar card and Voter ID as he states it will bring in more transparency. The linkage will prevent bogus votings.

localized.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, India's moon mission history was created by India as we launched Chandrayaan-2 which was all led by two women Muthayya Vanitha and Ritu Karidal project directors of Chandrayaan-2. ISRO took many years to develop the technology and finally the efforts paid off. 
In Uttarakhand, no girl child was born in 132 villages. The activist has suspected female foeticide takin place in these villages. The district magistrate has decided to closely monitor the situation for the next few months.
In Karnataka assembly, the BJP politician BS Yeddyurappa says he won't leave until the floor test takes place. The drama is all building in the assembly as the speaker has stated he wants to conduct the vote on the very day. The speaker has the rights but he is not using them to their potential. This will go on for a while.
Maharashtra Chief Minister has written a letter to the Election Commissioner suggesting the linking of Adhar card and Voter ID as he states it will bring in more transparency. The linkage will prevent bogus votings.

snippet.title: Ktaka govt delaying trust vote, Flood wreaks havoc in Bihar | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, Big twist to Karnataka conundrum as a further delay is done by the Congress MLAs. A meet took place between a BJP delegation and the speaker but still the outcome is questioned for today. The speaker declared the trust vote will take place on 22nd July but the Congress MLAs are not leaving their ground. The congress politicians want clarity from the speaker's side if the whip applies or not as they were ready for trust vote on these criteria. Meetings after meeting are taking between the politicians. Why is Congress-JDS delaying the trust vote? 
In the second story, The Nitish Kumar government is exposed as they are not able to help the people affected by floods, already 102 people have lost their lives in the flood, many people are without drinking water, food & place to live. After so many days the state government took the stock of the situation. There are about 133 relief camps in 3 districts who are providing aid to the people. The Assam government was much better than that of the Bihar as the evacuated the people from the endangered places were as in Bihar no precaution was taken as now 12 districts are affected by the floods.
To know more watch the video!

snippet.title: Instagram rolls out  new feature to hide likes for 'mental health' | The Urban Debate Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
Instagram will be rolling out its new feature where the likes on every post will be hidden. Only the owner of the image will be able to see the number of likes. This will be a part of promoting mental health in today's world which is completely under the influence of social media. "We have given Instagram so much power over self-worth. We have reached a place where for us if it's not on Instagram it didn't happen and that is something we have to work on", says Influencer Prajakta Koli. Listen in!

snippet.title: Karnataka Political crisis & Havok caused by floods in Bihar | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight,  The Karnataka political drama continues as the congress continue to delay the vote, the Chief Minister of Karnataka has moved to Supreme Court to seeking clarification on the order that the MLA's did not compete to attend the assembly that means the whip of congress applies or weather they are disqualified. Netas were busy fighting for power. In this whole political drama, the citizens of the state are suffering as many government infra plans are left incomplete. IS the citizen's plea ignored by the government?

In the other story, the Havok of floods in Bihar continues as the government is not doing what it has promised to do. they stated 1000 camps will be set up in Bihar but they did not respect the words. The ground reality is starkly different, the NGO's and the people are helping more than the government is offering as 12 districts of Bihar are badly affected by the floods. Will the government actually help the people?

snippet.title: Flood fury in Bihar, State unprepared for a recurring calamity? | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, Bihar is in a state of disarray due to floods and the ones in power seem to have a problem of priorities. With thousands of houses damaged, roads washed away, lakhs of people displaced and, the ones in power seem to have a problem of priorities. Sadly, Bihar’s Deputy Chief Minister Sushil Kumar Modi was earlier this week spotted meeting Bollywood actor Hrithik Roshan, whose recent film ‘Super 30’. The people in Bihar are angry and hungry even after the camps set up the conditions are not good. 67 Deaths and 47 Lakhs affected due to Floods. The conditions are worst as government is not giving their 100% for help.

We ask- Has Nitish Kumar Government failed Bihar again? State unprepared for a recurring calamity? Is the Nitish Kumar Government doing enough? To know more watch the video!

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Floods wreak havoc in Assam, Here's how you can help | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight, 46 lakh citizens across 30 of 33 districts have been affected. Nearly 1 lakh hectare of farms lie inundated. 90% of Kaziranga National Park lies submerged. Assam needs our help. 35 animals at #Kaziranga were killed in the floods. Volunteers & rangers of the Kaziranga National Park are the only hope for the animals. Wildlife Veterinarian Dr. Samshul Ali speaks to Faye D'souza about the challenges they are facing.

Assam needs our attention. Worst floods in Assam in 15 years, here is how you can contribute to the relief fund. Watch the video to more!

snippet.title: Worst floods in Assam in 15 years, here's how you can help | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight,
Over 90,000 hectares of farms inundated. 15 people in Assam died due to floods, 10 Lakh animals affected by floods and more. Assam Chief Minister of Assam has already asked for help and donations from the country. The floods are mainly being attributed to the overflowing water of the Brahmaputra river. To minimize the loss of human life and to house the imperiled citizens at a safe place, 62 relief camps were set up by the government. Even with water reaching their houses, the people of the state have not received adequate help from the government. Assam needs our attention. Worst floods in Assam in 15 years, here is how you can contribute to the relief fund.

snippet.description:

On The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza, India's 2nd lunar mission, Chandrayaan 2's launch was called off 56 minutes before liftoff due to a technical snag. snippet.title: BJP MLA's daughter threatened by father for marrying a Dalit? | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
Sakshi Mishra and her husband in a video message posted on social media said she faces a life threat from her father for marrying a Dalit. Sakshi and her husband also appealed to Bareilly superintendent of police to provide protection to them as their lives were in danger from her father's goons. Sakshi said she married Ajitesh Kumar, despite her family’s wishes. But the MLA claimed neither himself or anyone from his family have threatened Sakshi.
To know more watch the video!

snippet.title: Will new anti-lynching laws stop hate crimes in Uttar Pradesh? | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:

snippet.title: ECO Survey Data Vs Budget Data | The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
Today on Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza, Many messages were doing a round on internet that the Nirmala Sitharaman's budget did not tally but the real thing was not the mistake in calculation but the usage of data and estimates available. Government used old numbers (cag numbers) Is the economy depending on the shaky math? 

We ask- Is the budget arithmetic wrong? Why eco survey numbers not included in budget? Why use estimates when the actual data is available?

snippet.title: Can JD(S)-Congress retain power in the state of Karnataka? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza, Governance takes a back seat as Karnataka political crisis continues. Four days after the rebellion, the state assembly speaker Ramesh Kumar rejected all resignations with the help of a letter. The state has been a political turmoil since 14 MLAs resigned from the JD(S)- Congress coalition. 
Will BJP claim stake to form a government in Karnataka?
Will there be re-election in Karnataka?
 Who will resolve citizens' issues?

snippet.title: Homophobia kills young boy, right to choose not allowed? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, We live in a country that gives everyone equal rights & the law prevents discrimination against all of us. But somehow we have not managed to drive the last point home. Homophobia claimed another life as a 20-year-old committed suicide in Chennai. In the suicide note, the 20-year-old claims discrimination. Dr Harish Shetty speaks to Sahar Zaman about it. Says, 'we need to look at emotional and mental issues right at the age when a kid is in school'. Listen in!

Join Mirror Now's campaign. Let's unite & end discrimination against the #LGBTQ!

snippet.title: How will Budget 2019 impact the common man? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented her maiden Union Budget 2019-20 in Parliament today. The first female full-time finance minister said that the government assures every single rural family, except those unwilling to take the connection, will have electricity and clean cooking facility by 2022. 

We ask- How will Budget 2019 Impact your pockets? Will additional tax on fuel burden the middle class? Will the future be as we have expected? How is the new budget  going to help solve job crisis? To know more watch the video!

snippet.title: How will Budget 2019 power India's trillion dollar economy dream?|The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
Today on Urban Debate, the government is currently facing many challenges like providing jobs, farmers distress, development of the country, water crisis. 
Faye D'souza says, There’s job, farm & water crisis & we’re looking to come up with solutions that will solve these problems while we move toward a $5 trillion economy, if that’s the target. But, these are problems that can’t wait for 5 years, they need to be addressed this year.

We ask- How will the budget arrest slipping GDP growth? How will Modi 2.0 budget address the job crisis? How will the budget tackle the eater crisis? To know more watch the video!

snippet.title: Healthcare crisis exposed on Doctors' day, does government have a plan? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Kavita Krishnan, just a few days after a nationwide doctors' strike that began in Kolkata after violence against doctors, doctors have staged a strike at the Bara Hindu Rao Hospital in the national capital- Delhi. The services were boycotted after a clash broke out between doctors and relatives of a patient.
The doctors are demanding a written assurance from the authorities and a permanent deployment of police officials in the hospital premises. 
How much of the money that is allocated is being spent on Primary and Community healthcare?
What is stopping the government from spending more on healthcare?
Public healthcare crippled, does the government have a plan?

snippet.title: High political drama in AP, CM Jaganmohan sends house demolition notice to Naidu | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla discusses the demolition of the Naidu house. New Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy is in no mood to spare former CM N Chandrababu Naidu for the alleged environmental violations he has committed during his tenure as the chief minister. The structure is built in violation of River Conservation rules, at a distance of fewer than 100 meters from River Krishna, and the CRDA has given Naidu 7 days to respond to the notice. 

It was a sweeping mandate for Jaganmohan Reddy. Is he doing justice to the mandate by his clean-up politics or is this just a political vendetta?

snippet.title: Former IPS Officer sentenced to life, Sanjiv Bhatt's wife speaks to Faye D'Souza |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate, IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt and Police Constable Pravinsinh Jhala to life imprisonment in 1990 custodial death case. Bhatt and Jhala were found guilty under IPC section 302 (murder). Sanjiv Bhatt, who was posted as an Additional Superintendent of Police in Gujarat's Jamnagar in 1990, detained over hundred people for communal riots in Jamjodhpur town of the district, one of the detained persons, had died in a hospital after he was released.
His wife Shweta Bhatt speaks to Mirror Now's Faye D'Sozua. Watch!

snippet.description:

The UK-based singer has been booked for her remarks against Mohan Bhagwat, chief of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh and Yogi Adityanath, chief minister of Uttar Pradesh. snippet.title: Is the Nitish govt not taking encephalitis outbreak seriously? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza, Over 100 children die in Bihar due to Encephalitis in 16 days. Bihar is facing one of it's worst encephalitis outbreaks this year. From the Nitish government, MoS Health Ashwini Choubey was spotted yawning and allegedly ‘snoozing’ at the same meeting. Choubey could be seen sitting with his eyes closed even as Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan spoke at the meet, according to the video and the Bihar health minister appeared to have the cricket on his mind even as he sat down for the meeting along with Union Minister of Health Harsh Vardhan and MoS health Ashwini Choubey.

Mirror Now asks- Was the Nitish Government unprepared for the outbreak? Are they not taking it seriously? Was the government distracted by the Lok Sabha elections? Is the Nitish government not taking encephalitis outbreak seriously? Why is the cricket score more important at a meeting about the deaths of children due to Encephalitis than finding a solution for it? Why is healthcare so poorly paid attention to & so low on our priority in our country? How many more children have to die before the right action is taken?

snippet.title: Top court lambasts U.P police, Will CM Yogi take action? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, Supreme Court upholds free speech. Lambasting the Uttar Pradesh police, the top court ordered the release of journalist Prashant Kanojia immediately who was jailed for a tweet against the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. Apex Court said Liberty is Fundamental. Putting all political leaders on notice, Supreme Court added, India is not a police state. While allowing the probe on defamation to continue, the court asked why he was arrested when he did not commit murder. 

We ask - Why is Uttar Pradesh police attempting to stifle freedom of expression? Will CM Yogi Adityanath act against his police officers? Listen in!

snippet.title: IAF intensifies search for missing AN-32 flight  | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, It has been seven days since the AN-32 flight with 13 member crew on board went missing on Monday, June 3rd. The families of those on board and the country wait now for information as the Indian Air Force has intensified it's search operations. An Indian Airforce aircraft with 13 persons on board took-off from the Jorhat airbase in Assam at 12:25 pm and it's destination was in Arunachal Pradesh but the plane never landed. Its last contact with the ground agencies was at 1:00 pm. Sources say that the aircraft was about 30 kilometers away from the landing spot when it may have gone missing from the radar. Listen in for more details!

snippet.title: Water crisis looms over India, acute water crisis in Jalna | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, there is an acute water shortage in Maharashtra's Jalna as the Jui dam which supplies water to over 45 villages is drying up. Villagers are forced to dig the ground deeper for water. 
Mayuresh Ganapatye speaks to the residents of Jalna.
Waterman of India Rajendra Singh speaks to Faye D'souza about the water crisis across the country; says the governments just work for the relief whenever there is a drought. There is no planning to make the affected state's drought free.
PM Narendra Modi has set up a committee with a very focused approach in terms of job creation & economic issues. A target has been set for the next 5 years.
This and more on the Urban Debate.

snippet.title: IAF aircraft missing, lack of upgrades putting forces at risk? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, 13 families are hoping to hear about their missing loved ones. Those who were on board the AN-32 flight that went missing on Monday, June 3rd. An Indian Airforce aircraft with 13 persons on board took-off from the Jorhat airbase in Assam at 12:25 pm and it's destination was in Arunachal Pradesh but the plane never landed. Its last contact with the ground agencies was at 1:00 pm. Sources say that the aircraft was about 30 kilometers away from the landing spot when it may have gone missing from the radar. snippet.title: Kargil veteran declared foreigner, Loopholes in NRC process? | The Last Word
snippet.description:
On The Last Word with Tanvi Shukla tonight, Earlier on May 23rd, Kargil war hero Mohammad Sanaullah was declared a foreigner by a special tribunal in Assam and was then sent to a detention centre in Goalpara district jail on May 29th. While speaking to Times Now, Sanaullah's cousin alleged that Muslims are at the crosshairs of the authorities. "All the documents that are required to prove a person's nationality, Sanaullah has all of them yet he was detained by the police who deemed him as a foreigner and sent to a detention centre," he added. How can a soldier who served India all his life be labelled foreigner? Isn't this proof that the NRC process has some glaring loopholes? Listen in to know!

snippet.title: Kejriwal offers free ride for women, AAP's 'freebie' for votes? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, The Delhi government has announced free public transport to all women in the Capital. While making the announcement, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that the move would empower women to work and study and would encourage public transport as well which is considered to be the safest. He also added that the scheme would cost the government around 700-800 crore rupees. Arvind Kejriwal also mentioned that he did not need the Centre's approval for the same. This announcement has sparked off a massive row Politicians across party lines are calling it a cheap stunt to buy votes just ahead of the assembly elections in Delhi. Some women activists have slammed the move saying that women in Delhi want dignity not doles. 

We ask -How is offering free bus and metro tickets to women necessarily going to guarantee safety? Can Arvind Kejriwal explain how he will procure funds for his scheme that is seen by many as blatant appeasement? How does Arvind Kejriwal ensure the safety of women by offering them a free ride in Metros? Did Lok Sabha poll rout prompt Arvind Kejriwal to announce urban sop in form of a free metro ride to women in Delhi? If the AAP was truly committed towards women's empowerment, why did it field only one female candidate in Delhi in the 2019 polls? Is offering metro and bus rides for free to all women not patronizing towards women who have paid metro fares for over 17 years? If the primary purpose of this proposal by AAP is to ensure women's safety, why is it being put into action four and a half years after the party came to power in Delhi? Listen in to know!

snippet.title: Does the death penalty serve as a deterrent against rape? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, The Bombay High Court upholds the constitutional validity of Section 376E. The law that was brought in after Nirbhaya gang rape to give death penalty to repeat rape offenders. Under Section 376E an offender who has already been charged with a crime can be charged again for life imprisonment or the death penalty.  This was the Section used in Shakti Mills gang-rape verdict. Three men were sentenced to death on the grounds that they were repeat offenders, after they were tried and found guilty of two different instances of gang-rape in July and August 2013.
Will the death penalty bring down the number of crimes taking place? What happens if someone is wrongly convicted and is then proven innocent after it's too late? Listen in!

snippet.title: Unemployment highest in 45 years, Will Govt accept job crisis? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight, India has lost the tag of being the fastest growing economy letting China take the lead. With the GDP for the fourth quarter dropping to 5.8% from 8% in the beginning of the year and unemployment in the country is now at 45 years high. India's unemployment rate has jumped to a 45-year high at 6.1% in the financial year 2017-2018, according to the official data released by the government. Now, Opposition slams job dhokha. Has the NDA buried data deliberately? Will the government now accept the job crisis? How long will the slowdown last? Listen in!

snippet.title: Team NaMo takes oath, Modi-Shah ready for next 5 years | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza tonight, President Ram Nath Kovind administered the oath of office and secrecy to Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the forecourt of the Rashtrapati Bhavan with thousands gathered in the forecourt and millions watching on their TV screens. Prime Minister Narendra Modi ended his oath with "Bharat Mata ki Jai." Alongside Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union ministers, including BJP president Amit Shah, Nitin Gadkari, Rajnath Singh, and former foreign secretary S Jaishankar, took oath at a spectacular ceremony at the forecourt of majestic Rashtrapati Bhavan. However, Some of the key faces in the previous Modi government, including Arun Jaitley, Sushma Swaraj, Maneka Gandhi, and Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore were not part of the new Council of Ministers. In a tweet after taking the oath for the second successive term, PM Narendra Modi said, "Honoured to serve India!". Watch the video for more details!

snippet.title: Plea in Delhi HC for birth control, Will the 2 child norm work? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, the 'Hum Do Humare Do' debate reignites. A petition filed by the Bharatiya Janata Party leader and advocate, Ashwini Upadhyay in the Delhi High Court seeking a direction to the consider the implementation of the two-child norm policy in order to combat the rapidly growing population. The Delhi High Court has issued a notice to the centre seeking its response to the PIL. The government has been asked to respond by the month of September. 
Will denial of rights be an effective deterrent?
Will the two child policy work in India?
Should the right to vote be linked to the number of children per family?

snippet.title: Did the faculty in Nair hospital fail Dr Payal Tadvi? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, seven days after the 26-year-old doctor Payal Tadvi's suicide over alleged harassment and casteist remarks by her seniors at the BYL Nair Hospital in central Mumbai. All three accused have been taken into custody for 3 days.
Advocate Nitin Satpute, appearing for the family of deceased Dr Payal Tadvi, told a court today that he has good reason to believe that there were injury marks on her body, indicating foul play.
The anti-ragging committee of the hospital has submitted its report where it doesn't talk about caste-based ragging.
Do you have evidence to believe that it was caste-based ragging?
Did the faculty in Nair hospital fail Dr Payal Tadvi?

snippet.title: Why is caste-bullying still prevalent in elite institutions? | The Urban Debate Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza, there have been several cases where the people are being targeted and driven to suicide for belonging to the lower strata of society. A second-year student of Gynaecology and Obstetrics department, 27-year-old Payal Tadvi was found hanging in her room.
The kin of a junior doctor in Mumbai alleged that her seniors drove her to suicide by constantly ragging her, several doctors have staged protests in solidarity with the deceased. The family claimed that the deceased was bullied by her seniors for belonging to a lower caste.
Should quota details in the admission list be kept confidential?
Why is caste-bullying still prevalent in elite institutions?

snippet.title: PM Modi returns for 2nd term, dedicates victory to the nation | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, The BJP has swept it, the Exit polls suggested that the NDA altogether (BJP and its allies) will come up to maybe 300-306, however it turned out that the BJP by itself crossed 300. As BJP party President Amit Shah said, 'Abki baar 300 par' and he actually did it. The BJP with its allies are at 349. Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke at the BJP headquarters and thanked people for their support especially the party workers. This is the first time that any Prime Minister in this country has been given a full majority twice. He also spoke about the opposition parties, dynasty politics, caste politics and about the way the country will be run in the future. Listen in for more details!

snippet.title: Should gay marriage be legalised in India? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, India's fastest woman and India's first openly gay sportsperson Dutee Chand who has won 2 silver medals at the Asian Games 2018. She has said that she has found her soulmate who is a girl from her own village in Odisha's Jajpur. 
Dutee was forced to come out to her family because her sister who was aware of the relationship was blackmailing her for money. Her family after that claimed that her relationship will never be accepted and that she has been misled by her lover. 
While her relationship is being shunned by her family back at home, she is being hailed across the world for being openly gay. Dutee's relationship has reopened the LGBTQ debate.
While India has decriminalised homosexuality, should India now legalize gay marriage?

snippet.title: Will 2019 Lok Sabha polls hit states fortunes? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate With Faye D'Sozua, exit polls spoke the opposition. A confident BJP is blamed of reigniting operation 'Kamla 2.0.' Political pundits believe post-May 23rd, the NDA's first targets would be Madhya Pradesh & Karnataka governments. Also in Madhya Pradesh, they have made their first move.
The Bharatiya Janata Party dared M.P CM Kamal Nath to do a floor test to prove the Congress' majority. Kamal Nath has claimed that more than 10 of his ministers are receiving calls with offers for cabinet seats.
Whereas in Karnataka cracks seem to be emerging the Congress party. Senior Congress leader Roshan Baig sparked a fresh controversy by alleging that the Congress party sold ministerial berths.
If the NDA does sweep & like polls suggest, BJP wins 15-19 seats, will the Karnataka Govt be in trouble?
Do you think that your MLAs are strong within your government and they won't accept any offers from the other side? 
Know more!

Government caught unprepared once again this year? Listen in!

snippet.title: Has CM Gehlot failed to make the State safe for women? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, Lawlessness in Rajasthan exposed. Two rape horrors from Alwar. A Dalit couple was targeted, the husband thrashed and the woman gang-raped in front of him and this was just the beginning of their nightmare. The couple claimed the police refused to register an F.I.R in the case and asked them to wait for the elections to get over. The opposition party in the State the BJP has raised protests demanding a CBI probe in the case. As the Alwar case snowballed, the police were forced to act. The 6 men who were accused have been arrested. The Alwar gangrape case has completely exposed the law and order breakdown in Rajasthan. Have elections taken priority over law? Listen in!

snippet.title: Odisha residents protest, Is the Government doing enough? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, Six days since Cyclone Fani made its landfall in Puri district, residents of Odisha continue to struggle to get food and water, while the relief operations are still underway and in full swing. Mirror Now's Ayushmann & Pramod Madhav report LIVE from Odisha's Puri and share the latest updates on the current situation.

As people in Odisha pick up the pieces and attempt to get on with their lives, Mirror Now appeals to help rebuild the storm-ravaged state. It is one of the worst cyclones to hit Odisha in 20-years. The storm-ravaged state needs all your help. India, it's time to stand with Odisha. Watch to find out how you can help!

snippet.title: Is the level of competition for students too much to handle? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, Exam results are out. The stress and pressure for the perfect score is in. CBSE results that grabbed the headlines in most leading newspapers show the face of competition in education. In class 10 CBSE boards as many as 13 students have scored 99%. Earlier ICSE class 10 and 12 exam results were also announced where two students scored 100%. This is the first time that students have scored 100% in the ISC exams. The competition for the perfect score is not restricted to the national exams. In Kerala, 183 students have secured a full 100% score with 1200 marks in class 12 this year. Concerns are being raised over the intensity of competition. Listen in!

snippet.title: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik appeals to help rebuild Odisha | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, It has been five days since Cyclone Fani made landfall in Puri district, residents of Odisha continue to struggle to get food and water while the relief operations are underway and in full swing. The Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik has appealed to a contribution for relief work to help rebuild Odisha. In an exclusive conversation, Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik told Mirror Now that he hopes to restore all services in a month. It will take a month to get the State back on its feet and it needs our help. 

As people in Odisha pick up the pieces and attempt to get on with their lives, Mirror Now appeals to help rebuild the storm-ravaged state. It is one of the worst cyclones to hit Odisha in 20-years. The storm-ravaged state needs all your help. India, it's time to stand with Odisha. Watch to find out how you can help!
