snippet.title: Should citizens be penalised for not voting? | The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
Amitabh Kant, CEO of National Institution for Transforming India or NITI Aayog, on Thursday, sparked a fresh controversy by commenting on the ongoing Lok Sabha elections by proposing that voting should be made compulsory in India and that defaulters should be fined. Citing the example of Australia, where he claimed that those who do not vote are fined $20 in the country and the failure of which could lead to imprisonment, Kant said that “it is worth a try” in India. 
'Voting is our moral duty, but it will be very difficult to enforce it legally. We should aim at improving the social consciousness and the public-spiritedness' says Aryama Sundaram, Senior Advocate.
Should voting be made compulsory?
Should a citizen be penalised for not voting?
Listen in to The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza to know more!

snippet.title: Indian economy slowing down should we be worried? | The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
'The economy appears to Have slowed down,' says the Department of Finance Ministry, India's economy appears to have slowed down slightly in 2018-19, Ministry of Finance said in a monthly economic report for March 2019. The factors responsible for this slowdown include declining growth of private consumption, tepid increase in fixed investment, and muted exports, the report says.
Has India's purchasing power come down?
Indian economy slowing down should we be worried?

snippet.title: Shiv Sena urges a burqa ban, Is security threat a valid reason? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, while the Sri Lankan government has decided to temporarily ban the niqab or the veil that covers the face preventing the police from recognizing people. Taking a cue from Lanka, Shiv Sena has suggested, 'While in Ravan's Sri Lanka has banned the niqab; Ram's India should also follow. 
Is this really grandstanding for an election?
Is burqa or the veil standing in the way of National Security? 
Isn't it really RDX that causes bomb blasts?
If covering the face is the problem then what will we do with all of those other people who are riding two-wheelers and they don't want sunburn and you can't recognize them anywhere?

#BurqaBan

snippet.title: Is Yeti a myth, man or a beast? | The Last Word
snippet.description:
The Indian Army has said that its mountaineers have sighted giant footprints of the 'mythical beast Yeti.' the army’s additional directorate general of public information (ADGPI) said its mountain expedition team had made the sighting near the Makalu base camp in eastern Nepal. The official Twitter handle of the ADGPI also posted photographs of the footprints. Yeti is a myth and its there in the folk literature. 'The timing of the mythical creatures being put in the public domain is surprising because myths are publically debated to divert attention from the real issues' says Professor Vipul Singh, Historian.
Listen in to The Last Word to know more!

snippet.title: Did the Telangana government mess up the exam result? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
19 young boys and girls from the state of Telangana committing suicide due to their marks in the Telangana State Board Intermediate examinations. The deaths triggered massive state-wide protests which prompted even Chief Minister K Chandrashekhar Rao to take notice and call a review meeting at Pragati Bhawan. It was later revealed that out of the 9.5 lakh students who appeared for the Class 11 and 12 examinations for the Telangana state board, as many as 3 lakh failed. While the amount of pressure exerted on students in India, it is no open secret, the deaths of 19 young boys and girls is a rude awakening for not just those in power but also the country's education system.
Did the Telangana government mess up the exam result?
Listen in to The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza to know more!

snippet.title: 19 students commit suicide, Is it time to talk exam pressure? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
Three more intermediate students, including two girls, committed suicide reportedly due to failure in their exams across Telangana over the past 24 hours. With this, the number of students, who committed suicide since the past few days, has gone up to 19. This is among the highest number of suicides recorded post inter results, in the state.
Do you think that your child believes that his/her life is hinging on an exam & they only get one shot at it? Do you know if your child feels like there's no hope? Are we raising a generation that is crumbling under pressure? 
It's time to talk #ExamPressure
Listen in to The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza to know more!

snippet.title: Will EC take action against Saddhvi Pragya's token apology? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
The newly elected BJP candidate Sadhvi Pragya Thakur made a statement on the 26/11 martyr Mumbai ATS Chief Hemant Karkare who was investigating the Malegaon blast case. She said, 'Hemant Karkare died because of my curse.'
She withdrew her statement on Hemant Karkare and even apologized; said, 'I felt that the enemies of the country were being benefited from it, therefore, I take back my statement and apologize for it, it was my personal pain.'
Shouldn't BJP withdraw Sadhvi Pragya Thakur's ticket?
Will EC take action against Pragya?
Is Pragya's token apology acceptable?
Listen in!

snippet.title: Is cash, King in Phase 2 of the 2019 Lok Sabha Elections? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, Just hours left for the crucial Phase 2 of the Lok Sabha Elections to kick-off. 95 seats from 12 States will go to the polls on the 18th of April. The campaign for the 2nd Phase has been one of the dirtiest and messiest in recent history. Cutting across party lines, netas have resorted to making comments meant to flare up emotions, polarise people, even playing the religion and caste cards without any qualms. Political discourse slipped to a new low after Azam Khan's sexist remarks. After a rap from the top court, the Election Commission finally took action barring the motormouth netas for 48 hours and 72 hours respectively. It is not just controversial comments, netas are willing to go to any extent in an attempt to get votes. Riads across India makes it absolutely clear that cash is King this election season. An unprecedented amount of cash has been seized especially from Tamil Nadu. Has political discourse hit a new low? Listen in!

Things don't look for Jet Airways  the airline may be temporarily grounded as early as tonight as the board meets to come up with solutions to keep the airline alive for long enough to be sold, the 1500 crore rupees funding has not been realised by the SBI and in the meantime the creditors are beating down its doors. Will, there be an end to the Jet Airways crisis or will this be a final end to the Jet Airways?

Watch the debate tonight for the complete analysis of the Jet Airways Crisis!

snippet.description:

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Have electoral bonds failed to curb black money in elections? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
Last year in January when the government came with the electoral bond system to keep a watch on the political funding system in count of black money, these bonds allowed the citizens to donate money directly to the political parties using your bank account to donate money one should have to buy a bond and the bonds are available in various denominations, and the scheme sounds great on paper but the bonds do not name the bearer or the donor. The scheme has some loopholes which have raised some serious questions this case is now being heard by the Supreme Court.

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: Is Modi's claim of clean chit on Rafale no longer valid? | The Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
The Supreme Court on Wednesday agreed to hear review pleas challenging an earlier judgement dismissing a Central Bureau of Investigation inquiry into the deal and dismissed the Centre's objections to the petitions. Congress President Rahul Gandhi soon said that the Supreme Court has accepted that there was corruption in Rafale and that the Prime Minister has given Rs 30,000 crore to Anil Ambani, while Union Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman accused Congress President Rahul Gandhi of making comments that verge on contempt of a court's order. How big pushback is this to the government's objection to the review?

snippet.title: Was the Jammu and Kashmir highway ban necessary? | The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight the civilian vehicle ban on Jammu Srinagar national highway an order from the Jammu and Kashmir state administration have crippled the lifeline of the valley for common man for additional troops and security for 2019 Lok Sabha elections and post the Phulwama attack the Jammu Srinagar highway has been blocked for citizens twice a week to facilitate troops movement 
The Srinagar Jammu highway stayed closed today as part of the ban in civilian vehicles that been actioned twice a week security experts have called this a dumb idea.

snippet.title: Was Mahagathbandhan just for name sake? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:

snippet.title: Congress' Nyay scheme, Is it a poll gimmick or landmark scheme? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about a new scheme for the poor which has been promised by Congress President Rahul Gandhi. Rahul Gandhi said that many noted economists were consulted including former RBI governor Raghuram Rajan before the announcement by the party.
The announcement of the plan was lacking one thing, which is clarity. Rahul Gandhi didn't explain all the aspects of the scheme. This has raised many questions about the intention of the party.
Is it a poll gimmick or landmark scheme?
Will this scheme of Minimum Income Guarantee, work? 
What is the definition of poorest in the country and how will you arrive at this bottom 5%? 
There needs to be more information handed to the general public in order for them to understand whether or not this scheme will actually work!

snippet.title: Has Government weakened the laws of political funding? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about why the Government of India had brought some changes in the rules of political funding, these changes were made in the last two years.
Three fundamental changes were made by the Government.
The problem with the changes made is that the voter doesn't know who has given a political party the money. They don't know whose favours you'll be returning if you come to power. And as a voter, it's our democratic right to know who gave you money!
We appeal to the Supreme Court to intervene and ensure that as citizens of this country we've access to the information that tells us where's the money coming from!

snippet.title: Is India's employment crisis a political agenda? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, the mystery of India's job data explores. Finance Minister Arun Jaitley has hot back to the 108 economists, in a point by point debacle he says that they are politically motivated.
As recently, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley hits back on missing Indian data by saying, the credibility of the 108 economists must be questioned. Unemployment with unprecedented growth under the Modi government is a myth.
This raises many important questions.
Why will anybody in this country not want to believe that we're growing at a healthy level if indeed we were growing at that level? 
Why aren’t independent economists speaking out against the 108 ‘politically motivated’ economists? Where is the data on poverty, farmer suicides, crime, and unemployment?
Why is it that the minute we start questioning something linked to the government, we become anti-government or politically motivated? 

Where do we stand on this missing data debate? What's the true picture of our economy?
Listen in!

As recently, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley hits back on missing Indian data by saying, the credibility of the 108 economists must be questioned. Unemployment with unprecedented growth under the Modi government is a myth.
This raises many important questions.
Why will anybody in this country not want to believe that we're growing at a healthy level if indeed we were growing at that level? 
Why aren’t independent economists speaking out against the 108 ‘politically motivated’ economists? Where is the data on poverty, farmer suicides, crime, and unemployment?
Why is it that the minute we start questioning something linked to the government, we become anti-government or politically motivated? 

Where do we stand on this missing data debate? What's the true picture of our economy?
Listen in!

snippet.title: Is the Government withholding the data for electoral gains? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight we will talk about India's economic data and why 108 experts have released a joint statement, raising concerns over statistical data of India. 
The government has not published the economic data and has rejected data of government organisation saying that they are not the final one. Because of this delay, their credibility of India is decreasing.
When will the government disclose the crucial data? Isn't the govt hurting India's credibility by withholding data?
Is the government hurting India's credibility by withholding data? 
Niti Aayog gets increasingly involved with the data. Do they have the expertise to deal with national-level data? 
Since demonetisation, why the numbers on farmers Suicide have not been released? 
We understand that elections are coming up, but, that shouldn't stand in the way of normal course of business. It won't stop us from asking questions. 
Because people who ask questions, whether economists or journalists are the real Chowkidars!

snippet.title: Don't citizens deserve to know who is funding political parties?| The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about politics and how parties manage to pull of rallies and give away so many things to voters during election season.
During election season, every political party giveaways stuff to attract voters, but from where do they get this money?
Shouldn't we know about this link of who is sponsoring political parties?
Laws around funding to political parties have been relaxed. We demand that information about donations to political parties be made public. Political parties are made subject to RTI so that as voters, we know where the money is coming from.
Whose money is being funnelled back into India for political funding?
If someone funds a political party heavily, does it encourage crony capitalism? Don't you as a citizen deserve to know where the money is coming from?
Do Electoral Bonds increase the thickness of the veil on political funding?
Listen in!

snippet.title: What is a priority of Government, Elections or human life?  | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about the bridge which collapsed in CSMT. What can be the reason for this massacre?
Everyone is blaming each other, but no victim has been named.
Why has no government official been named for the Mumbai bridge collapse? 
What does 'Bhrashtachar Mukt Bharat' mean.
Can the Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis assure us that the city of Mumbai & all the bridges, Safe? 
So, if they are going to sit here and blame each other, we would be fools to fall for it: 
The government has not convicted anyone. Nobody has gone to jail earlier also, these are just lip-service.
Why is Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis in Amravati and not in Mumbai? And at what point will Municipal Commissioner, Ajoy Mehta be sacked? 


Mumbai bridge collapsed because of corruption. They could've cleared the projects to fix those bridges but instead, they cleared the projects that will make them money. 
You & I don't matter, and we've to remember that when we go to the polls. 
Election Campaigns or Human Lives. What's the priority? 
Listen in!

snippet.title: Footover bridge collapses, Negligence maims Mumbai again | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate, tonight we will bring you all the details of the footover bridge which collapsed in CSMT, Mumbai.
In July of last year, a joint audit of 445 structures, including Road Over Bridges (ROBs) and Foot Over Bridges (FOBs) was conducted by experts from IIT-Bombay, the Western Railways and the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). Twelve teams were constituted to carry out the audit following the collapse of the Gokhale pedestrian bridge at Andheri.
Government and BMC have been promising since years now after such events, but we don't see any end to it.
Will Government and the BMC start to take their work seriously after this?
Listen in!

snippet.title: Bridge collapses in Mumbai again, What inquiry will Govt do now?| The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about an appalling incident which surfaced from ‘Maximum City’ Mumbai after a section of a foot-over bridge at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus in south Mumbai collapsed on Thursday, killing 5 people and injuring over 30 others.
The incident occurred around 7:30 pm, a time when officegoers use it to commute to the station in the southern part of Mumbai. The injured have been rushed to St. George hospital and GT Hospital.
3 years, 3 killer bridges. No lessons learnt. When will the heads start rolling? Enough is enough! Stop the blame game. 
The word inquiry has now become a joke. Insensitivity has gone to another level. This is death due to negligence.
Listen in!

snippet.title: Will 7 phased poll schedule benefit big political parties? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about the new seven-phase polls schedule announced by Election Commission.
This new schedule has raised many questions which need to be answered.
Will longer poll schedule benefit better funded political parties? Will it increase the chances of malpractice or violations of the code of conduct? Why can't assembly polls be held simultaneously in J&K? 
How would a simultaneous election change the security needs of J&K? Why can't we simultaneously have the assembly elections? 
The opposition in Bengal raised questions about the election calendar. Could the consequence of the calendar mean an advantage to the BJP in some states?
There was a commitment made by the govt that J&K would return to having a state govt. So why isn't there state elections happening in J&K?
Listen in!

snippet.title: Key witness shot dead, Is state trying to shield riot accused? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
A prime example of the lack of fear of law in Uttar Pradesh came to light today when a milkman, who was a prime witness to the brutal murder of his two brothers during the Muzaffarnagar riots, was shot dead by armed assailants in broad daylight. The victim, Ashbab who worked as a milk vendor was murdered in his native village of Khatoli.
The Court decides who is the culprit, not the Chief Minister. Why did Yogi Adityanath recommend that 38 cases against the 100 people charged in Muzaffarnagar riots will be withdrawn?
Has the Uttar Pradesh police completely failed to do its job? 
Why did the State fail to protect the key eyewitness in the Muzaffarnagar riots case?
Listen in!

snippet.title: Unite against hate in name of Nationalism, Stand with Kashmir | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
3000 people have gone back to Kashmir. In almost 19 universities Kashmiris have faced some kind of intimidation. This discrimination is not limited to students. The insane voices are controlling the streets. 
Crime in the name of religion is something that can be brought in for an augmented punishment. It should be done if we want to keep India as one; if we want a union of India & not a cessation of states
What is giving these goons the authority to take the law into their own hands? What is giving them the authority to use the Pulwama attack as an excuse to bully people?
Has the government of India & the governments of various states done enough to stop or prevent these crimes from taking place?
Why hasn't the govt done more? Where is the instruction to the police? Where is the instruction to the state governments? Why is the government silent?

If you are that angry & want to show how macho you are, join the forces.  We are all citizens of this country & we will stand together. If you hurt a Kashmiri, you hurt us.
Mirror Now stands with the Kashmiris across the country.  #IAmKashmiri

snippet.title: How did sensitive defense deal documents of Rafale get leaked? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about the Rafale deal and the case in Supreme Court after the Centre dropped bomb news about the deal. As they admitted that sensitive deal documents of Rafale deal were leaked and got published in Indian newspapers.
Should the Official Secret Act be brought into play when a journalist publishes a classified document? 
Should the Supreme Court Consider these Stolen Rafale Files? 
Listen in!

snippet.title: Can Modi sarkar dismiss NSSO & CMIE unemployment report? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about another jolt for the Modi Government, as the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) has released the latest unemployment data. This fresh report says that the employment of the country is at two year high.
This CMIE report comes just after the unofficially released NSSO data which showed that unemployment was at 45 years high. The NDA Government had dismissed the data claiming that the data didn't count the jobs created in the unorganised sector and new age jobs created by online companies.
Where are the jobs? Where is the data?
When will the Centre disclose the job data?
Is unemployment India's biggest challenge?
Has the NDA  government failed to create jobs?
Listen in!
